cobblemon.move.toxicthread.desc: The user shoots poisonous threads to poison the target and lower the target's Speed stat.
cobblemon.move.trailblaze.desc: Has a 100% chance to raise the user's Speed by 1 stage.
cobblemon.move.transform.desc: The user transforms into a copy of the target right down to having the same move set.
cobblemon.move.triattack.desc: The user strikes with a simultaneous three-beam attack. This may also burn, freeze, or paralyze the target.
cobblemon.move.trick.desc: The user catches the target off guard and swaps its held item with its own.
cobblemon.move.trickortreat.desc: The user takes the target trick-or-treating. This adds Ghost type to the target's type.
cobblemon.move.trickroom.desc: The user creates a bizarre area in which slower Pokémon get to move first for five turns.
cobblemon.move.triplearrows.desc: Has a 50% chance to lower the target's Defense by 1 stage, a 30% chance to make it flinch, and a higher chance for a critical hit.
cobblemon.move.tripleaxel.desc: A consecutive three-kick attack that becomes more powerful with each successful hit.
cobblemon.move.triplekick.desc: A consecutive three-kick attack that becomes more powerful with each successful hit.
cobblemon.move.tropkick.desc: The user lands an intense kick of tropical origins on the target. This also lowers the target's Attack stat.
cobblemon.move.trumpcard.desc: The fewer PP this move has, the greater its power.
cobblemon.move.twinbeam.desc: Hits twice. If the first hit breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the second hit.
cobblemon.move.twineedle.desc: The user damages the target twice in succession by jabbing it with two spikes. This may also poison the target.
cobblemon.move.twinkletackle.desc: The user creates a very charming space using its Z-Power and totally toys with the target. The power varies, depending on the original move.
cobblemon.move.twister.desc: The user whips up a vicious tornado to tear at opposing Pokémon. This may also make them flinch.
cobblemon.move.uproar.desc: The user attacks in an uproar for three turns. During that time, no Pokémon can fall asleep.
cobblemon.move.uturn.desc: After making its attack, the user rushes back to switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.
cobblemon.move.vacuumwave.desc: The user whirls its fists to send a wave of pure vacuum at the target. This move always goes first.
cobblemon.move.vcreate.desc: With a hot flame on its forehead, the user hurls itself at its target. This lowers the user's Defense, Sp. Def, and Speed stats.
cobblemon.move.veeveevolley.desc: The more Eevee loves its Trainer, the greater the move's power. It never misses.
cobblemon.move.venomdrench.desc: Opposing Pokémon are drenched in an odd poisonous liquid. This lowers the Attack, Sp. Atk, and Speed stats of a poisoned target.
cobblemon.move.venoshock.desc: The user drenches the target in a special poisonous liquid. This move's power is doubled if the target is poisoned.
cobblemon.move.victorydance.desc: Raises the user's Attack, Defense, and Speed by 1 stage.
cobblemon.move.vinewhip.desc: The target is struck with slender, whiplike vines to inflict damage.
cobblemon.move.visegrip.desc: The target is gripped and squeezed from both sides to inflict damage.
cobblemon.move.vitalthrow.desc: The user attacks last. In return, this throw move never misses.
cobblemon.move.voltswitch.desc: After making its attack, the user rushes back to switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.
cobblemon.move.volttackle.desc: The user electrifies itself and charges the target. This also damages the user quite a lot. This attack may leave the target with paralysis.
cobblemon.move.wakeupslap.desc: This attack inflicts big damage on a sleeping target. This also wakes the target up, however.
cobblemon.move.waterfall.desc: The user charges at the target and may make it flinch.
cobblemon.move.watergun.desc: The target is blasted with a forceful shot of water.
cobblemon.move.waterpledge.desc: A column of water hits the target. When used with its fire equivalent, its power increases and a rainbow appears.
cobblemon.move.waterpulse.desc: The user attacks the target with a pulsing blast of water. This may also confuse the target.
cobblemon.move.watershuriken.desc: The user hits the target with throwing stars two to five times in a row. This move always goes first.
cobblemon.move.watersport.desc: The user soaks the battlefield with water. This weakens Fire-type moves for five turns.
cobblemon.move.waterspout.desc: The user spouts water to damage opposing Pokémon. The lower the user's HP, the lower the move's power.
cobblemon.move.wavecrash.desc: If the target lost HP, the user takes recoil damage equal to 33% the HP lost by the target, rounded half up, but not less than 1 HP.
cobblemon.move.weatherball.desc: This attack move varies in power and type depending on the weather.
cobblemon.move.whirlpool.desc: The user traps the target in a violent swirling whirlpool for four to five turns.
cobblemon.move.whirlwind.desc: The target is blown away, and a different Pokémon is dragged out. In the wild, this ends a battle against a single Pokémon.
cobblemon.move.wickedblow.desc: The user, having mastered the Dark style, strikes the target with a fierce blow. This attack always results in a critical hit.
cobblemon.move.wickedtorque.desc: Has a 10% chance to cause the target to fall asleep.
cobblemon.move.wideguard.desc: The user and its allies are protected from wide-ranging attacks for one turn.
cobblemon.move.wildboltstorm.desc: Has a 20% chance to paralyze the target.
cobblemon.move.wildcharge.desc: The user shrouds itself in electricity and smashes into its target. This also damages the user a little.
cobblemon.move.willowisp.desc: The user shoots a sinister flame at the target to inflict a burn.
cobblemon.move.wingattack.desc: The target is struck with large, imposing wings spread wide to inflict damage.
cobblemon.move.wish.desc: One turn after this move is used, the user's or its replacement's HP is restored by half the user's max HP.
cobblemon.move.withdraw.desc: The user withdraws its body into its hard shell, raising its Defense stat.
cobblemon.move.wonderroom.desc: The user creates a bizarre area in which Pokémon's Defense and Sp. Def stats are swapped for five turns.
cobblemon.move.woodhammer.desc: The user slams its rugged body into the target to attack. This also damages the user quite a lot.
cobblemon.move.workup.desc: The user is roused, and its Attack and Sp. Atk stats increase.
cobblemon.move.worryseed.desc: A seed that causes worry is planted on the target. It prevents sleep by making the target's Ability Insomnia.
cobblemon.move.wrap.desc: A long body, vines, or the like are used to wrap and squeeze the target for four to five turns.
cobblemon.move.wringout.desc: The user powerfully wrings the target. The more HP the target has, the greater the move's power.
cobblemon.move.xscissor.desc: The user slashes at the target by crossing its scythes or claws as if they were a pair of scissors.
cobblemon.move.yawn.desc: The user lets loose a huge yawn that lulls the target into falling asleep on the next turn.
cobblemon.move.zapcannon.desc: The user fires an electric blast like a cannon to inflict damage and cause paralysis.
cobblemon.move.zenheadbutt.desc: The user focuses its willpower to its head and attacks the target. This may also make the target flinch.
cobblemon.move.zingzap.desc: A strong electric blast crashes down on the target, giving it an electric shock. This may also make the target flinch.
cobblemon.move.zippyzap.desc: The user attacks the target with bursts of electricity at high speed. This move always goes first and results in a critical hit.
cobblemon.overflow_no_pc: Your party was full and you don't have a PC!
cobblemon.overflow_no_space: Your party was full and so was %1$s!
cobblemon.overflow_to_pc: Your party was full! %1$s has been added to %2$s.
cobblemon.pasture.too_many_nearby: There are too many Pokémon nearby.
cobblemon.pc.inbattle: You cannot use a PC while in battle!
cobblemon.species.abomasnow.desc: A powerful Pokémon that can split huge boulders with ease. Dislikes associating with others and chooses to live quietly deep within the mountains, playing with the snow.
cobblemon.species.abomasnow.name: Abomasnow
cobblemon.species.abra.desc: Spends 18 hours of the day sleeping. Even while asleep, Abra can control its psychic powers—should danger approach, the Pokémon will simply teleport away.
cobblemon.species.abra.name: Abra
cobblemon.species.absol.desc: Because of this Pokémon's ability to detect danger, people mistook Absol as a bringer of doom.
cobblemon.species.absol.name: Absol
cobblemon.species.accelgor.desc: Discarding its shell made it nimble. To keep itself from dehydrating, it wraps its body in bands of membrane.
cobblemon.species.accelgor.name: Accelgor
cobblemon.species.aegislash.desc: Its potent spectral powers allow it to manipulate others. It once used its powers to force people and Pokémon to build a kingdom to its liking.
cobblemon.species.aegislash.name: Aegislash
cobblemon.species.aerodactyl.desc: Aerodactyl's sawlike fangs can shred skin to tatters—even the skin of Steel-type Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.aerodactyl.name: Aerodactyl
cobblemon.species.aggron.desc: Long ago, there was a king who wore a helmet meant to resemble the head of an Aggron. He was trying to channel the Pokémon's strength.
cobblemon.species.aggron.name: Aggron
cobblemon.species.aipom.desc: This treetop dweller possesses a tail as dexterous as a hand. Ancient writings describe this Pokémon as a one-armed oddity.
cobblemon.species.aipom.name: Aipom
cobblemon.species.alakazam.desc: The longer Alakazam lives, the larger and heavier its head becomes. Our tests have shown that the strength of its psychic powers correlates positively to the weight of its head.
cobblemon.species.alakazam.name: Alakazam
cobblemon.species.alcremie.desc: When Alcremie is content, the cream it secretes from its hands becomes sweeter and richer.
cobblemon.species.alcremie.name: Alcremie
cobblemon.species.alomomola.desc: The reason it helps Pokémon in a weakened condition is that any Pokémon coming after them may also attack Alomomola.
cobblemon.species.alomomola.name: Alomomola
cobblemon.species.altaria.desc: This Pokémon has a kind disposition, but if it's provoked, it will threaten opponents with shrill cries before attacking them without mercy.
cobblemon.species.altaria.name: Altaria
cobblemon.species.amaura.desc: Amaura is an ancient Pokémon that has gone extinct. Specimens of this species can sometimes be found frozen in ice.
cobblemon.species.amaura.name: Amaura
cobblemon.species.ambipom.desc: To affirm their kinship, members of this species will form a ring by linking their newly doubled tails together. On rare occasions, humans have been accepted into such rings.
cobblemon.species.ambipom.name: Ambipom
cobblemon.species.amoonguss.desc: Amoonguss generally doesn't move much. It tends to stand still near Poké Balls that have been dropped on the ground.
cobblemon.species.amoonguss.name: Amoonguss
cobblemon.species.ampharos.desc: Its tail shines bright and strong. It has been prized since long ago as a beacon for sailors.
cobblemon.species.ampharos.name: Ampharos
cobblemon.species.annihilape.desc: When its anger rose beyond a critical point, this Pokémon gained power that is unfettered by the limits of its physical body.
cobblemon.species.annihilape.name: Annihilape
cobblemon.species.anorith.desc: Anorith can swim swiftly by pulling its eight wings through the water like oars on a boat. This Pokémon is an ancestor of modern bug Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.anorith.name: Anorith
cobblemon.species.appletun.desc: Its body is covered in sweet nectar, and the skin on its back is especially yummy. Children used to have it as a snack.
cobblemon.species.appletun.name: Appletun
cobblemon.species.applin.desc: As soon as it's born, it burrows into an apple. Not only does the apple serve as its food source, but the flavor of the fruit determines its evolution.
cobblemon.species.applin.name: Applin
cobblemon.species.araquanid.desc: It acts as a caretaker for Dewpider, putting them inside its bubble and letting them eat any leftover food.
cobblemon.species.araquanid.name: Araquanid
cobblemon.species.arbok.desc: The frightening patterns on its belly have been studied. Six variations have been confirmed.
cobblemon.species.arbok.name: Arbok
cobblemon.species.arboliva.desc: This calm Pokémon is very compassionate. It will share its delicious, nutrient-rich oil with weakened Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.arboliva.name: Arboliva
cobblemon.species.arcanine.desc: Snaps at its foes with fangs cloaked in blazing flame. Despite its bulk, it deftly feints every which way, leading opponents on a deceptively merry chase as it all but dances around them.
cobblemon.species.arcanine.name: Arcanine
cobblemon.species.arceus.desc: It is the heavenly fount from which pours the light that shines across Hisui. Its luminance guides and protects all Pokémon. Hisuian mythology states that Arceus is the creator of all things.
cobblemon.species.arceus.name: Arceus
cobblemon.species.archaludon.desc: It gathers static electricity from its surroundings. The beams it launches when down on all fours are tremendously powerful.
cobblemon.species.archaludon.name: Аркалюдон
cobblemon.species.archen.desc: Archen is said to be the ancestor of bird Pokémon. It lived in treetops, eating berries and bug Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.archen.name: Archen
cobblemon.species.archeops.desc: Though capable of flight, Archeops was apparently better at hunting on the ground.
cobblemon.species.archeops.name: Archeops
cobblemon.species.arctibax.desc: Arctibax freezes the air around it, protecting its face with an ice mask and turning its dorsal fin into a blade of ice.
cobblemon.species.arctibax.name: Arctibax
cobblemon.species.arctovish.desc: The skin on its face is impervious to attack, but breathing difficulties made this Pokémon go extinct anyway.
cobblemon.species.arctovish.name: Arctovish
cobblemon.species.arctozolt.desc: This Pokémon lived on prehistoric seashores and was able to preserve food with the ice on its body. It went extinct because it moved so slowly.
cobblemon.species.arctozolt.name: Arctozolt
cobblemon.species.ariados.desc: It spews threads from its mouth to catch its prey. When night falls, it leaves its web to go hunt aggressively.
cobblemon.species.ariados.name: Ariados
cobblemon.species.armaldo.desc: Though it lives on land, it's also a good swimmer. It dives into the ocean in search of prey, using its sharp claws to take down its quarry.
cobblemon.species.armaldo.name: Armaldo
cobblemon.species.armarouge.desc: Armarouge evolved through the use of a set of armor that belonged to a distinguished warrior. This Pokémon is incredibly loyal.
cobblemon.species.armarouge.name: Armarouge
cobblemon.species.aromatisse.desc: The scents Aromatisse can produce range from sweet smells that bolster allies to foul smells that sap an opponent's will to fight.
cobblemon.species.aromatisse.name: Aromatisse
cobblemon.species.aron.desc: When Aron evolves, its steel armor peels off. In ancient times, people would collect Aron's shed armor and make good use of it in their daily lives.
cobblemon.species.aron.name: Aron
cobblemon.species.arrokuda.desc: After it's eaten its fill, its movements become extremely sluggish. That's when Cramorant swallows it up.
cobblemon.species.arrokuda.name: Arrokuda
cobblemon.species.articuno.desc: This Pokémon can control ice at will. Articuno is said to live in snowy mountains riddled with permafrost.
cobblemon.species.articuno.name: Articuno
cobblemon.species.audino.desc: This Pokémon has a kind heart. By touching with its feelers, Audino can gauge other creatures' feelings and physical conditions.
cobblemon.species.audino.name: Audino
cobblemon.species.aurorus.desc: When gripped by rage, Aurorus will emanate freezing air, covering everything around it in ice.
cobblemon.species.aurorus.name: Aurorus
cobblemon.species.avalugg.desc: The armor of ice covering its lower jaw puts steel to shame and can shatter rocks with ease. This Pokémon barrels along steep mountain paths, cleaving through the deep snow.
cobblemon.species.avalugg.name: Avalugg
cobblemon.species.axew.desc: They play with each other by knocking their large tusks together. Their tusks break sometimes, but they grow back so quickly that it isn't a concern.
cobblemon.species.axew.name: Axew
cobblemon.species.azelf.desc: The dreaded Being of Willpower. Legends tell of this Pokémon manipulating the will of its adversaries and turning them into puppets of its own.
cobblemon.species.azelf.name: Azelf
cobblemon.species.azumarill.desc: These Pokémon create air-filled bubbles. When Azurill play in rivers, Azumarill will cover them with these bubbles.
cobblemon.species.azumarill.name: Azumarill
cobblemon.species.azurill.desc: Although Azurill are normally docile, an angry one will swing around the big ball on its tail and try to smash its opponents.
cobblemon.species.azurill.name: Azurill
cobblemon.species.bagon.desc: Bagon is a solitary Pokémon that doesn't form groups with others of its kind. It also has a head hard enough to cleave a boulder in one strike.
cobblemon.species.bagon.name: Bagon
cobblemon.species.baltoy.desc: It was discovered in ancient ruins. While moving, it constantly spins. It stands on one foot even when asleep.
cobblemon.species.baltoy.name: Baltoy
cobblemon.species.banette.desc: Resentment at being cast off made it spring into being. Some say that treating it well will satisfy it, and it will once more become a stuffed toy.
cobblemon.species.banette.name: Banette
cobblemon.species.barbaracle.desc: Having an eye on each palm allows it to keep watch in all directions. In a pinch, its limbs start to act on their own to ensure the enemy's defeat.
cobblemon.species.barbaracle.name: Barbaracle
cobblemon.species.barboach.desc: Makes its home in swamps with murky water. The poor visibility hides this Pokémon from predators, and the slime on its body makes grasping it difficult.
cobblemon.species.barboach.name: Barboach
cobblemon.species.barraskewda.desc: It spins its tail fins to propel itself, surging forward at speeds of over 100 knots before ramming prey and spearing into them.
cobblemon.species.barraskewda.name: Barraskewda
cobblemon.species.basculegion.desc: Clads itself in the souls of comrades that perished before fulfilling their goals of journeying upstream. No other species throughout all Hisui's rivers is Basculegion's equal.
cobblemon.species.basculegion.name: Basculegion
cobblemon.species.basculin.desc: Though it differs from other Basculin in several respects, including demeanor—this one is gentle—I have categorized it as a regional form given the vast array of shared qualities.
cobblemon.species.basculin.name: Basculin
cobblemon.species.bastiodon.desc: Its face is sturdy—as strong as diamond—and this hardness offers a very stable defense. Much about this species is still unknown, such as its natural habitat.
cobblemon.species.bastiodon.name: Bastiodon
cobblemon.species.baxcalibur.desc: This Pokémon blasts cryogenic air out from its mouth. This air can instantly freeze even liquid-hot lava.
cobblemon.species.baxcalibur.name: Baxcalibur
cobblemon.species.bayleef.desc: Bayleef's neck is ringed by curled-up leaves. Inside each tubular leaf is a small shoot of a tree. The fragrance of this shoot makes people peppy.
cobblemon.species.bayleef.name: Bayleef
cobblemon.species.beartic.desc: It swims energetically through frigid seas. When it gets tired, it freezes the seawater with its breath so it can rest on the ice.
cobblemon.species.beartic.name: Beartic
cobblemon.species.beautifly.desc: A colorful and incredibly beautiful but also greedy Pokémon. In an effort to keep its favorite food all to itself, it will chase away Combee as they try to gather nectar.
cobblemon.species.beautifly.name: Beautifly
cobblemon.species.beedrill.desc: It has three poisonous stingers on its forelegs and its tail. They are used to jab its enemy repeatedly.
cobblemon.species.beedrill.name: Beedrill
cobblemon.species.beheeyem.desc: Sometimes found drifting above wheat fields, this Pokémon can control the memories of its opponents.
cobblemon.species.beheeyem.name: Beheeyem
cobblemon.species.beldum.desc: The cells in this Pokémon's body are composed of magnetic material. Instead of blood, magnetic forces flow through Beldum's body.
cobblemon.species.beldum.name: Beldum
cobblemon.species.bellibolt.desc: When this Pokémon expands and contracts its wobbly body, the belly-button dynamo in its stomach produces a huge amount of electricity.
cobblemon.species.bellibolt.name: Bellibolt
cobblemon.species.bellossom.desc: Bellossom gather at times and appear to dance. They say that the dance is a ritual to summon the sun.
cobblemon.species.bellossom.name: Bellossom
cobblemon.species.bellsprout.desc: Prefers hot and humid places. It ensnares tiny bugs with its vines and devours them.
cobblemon.species.bellsprout.name: Bellsprout
cobblemon.species.bergmite.desc: Lives on mountains blanketed in perennial snow. It freezes water vapor in the air to make the ice helmet that it dons for defense.
cobblemon.species.bergmite.name: Bergmite
cobblemon.species.bewear.desc: The moves it uses to take down its prey would make a martial artist jealous. It tucks subdued prey under its arms to carry them to its nest.
cobblemon.species.bewear.name: Bewear
cobblemon.species.bibarel.desc: Bibarel fur repels water and is also a fantastic material for heat retention. These Pokémon create dams on rivers to live in.
cobblemon.species.bibarel.name: Bibarel
cobblemon.species.bidoof.desc: Bidoof has an unsophisticated face and is rarely flustered by anything. There have been incidents involving Bidoof sauntering into villages and gnawing on the houses without a single care.
cobblemon.species.bidoof.name: Bidoof
cobblemon.species.binacle.desc: If the two don't work well together, both their offense and defense fall apart. Without good teamwork, they won't survive.
cobblemon.species.binacle.name: Binacle
cobblemon.species.bisharp.desc: Violent conflicts erupt between Bisharp and Fraxure over places where sharpening stones can be found.
cobblemon.species.bisharp.name: Bisharp
cobblemon.species.blacephalon.desc: A UB that appeared from an Ultra Wormhole, it causes explosions, then takes advantage of opponents' surprise to rob them of their vitality.
cobblemon.species.blacephalon.name: Blacephalon
cobblemon.species.blastoise.desc: The rocket cannons on its shell fire jets of water capable of punching holes through thick steel.
cobblemon.species.blastoise.name: Blastoise
cobblemon.species.blaziken.desc: Blaziken has incredibly strong legs—it can easily clear a 30-story building in one leap. This Pokémon's blazing punches leave its foes scorched and blackened.
cobblemon.species.blaziken.name: Blaziken
cobblemon.species.blipbug.desc: Often found in gardens, this Pokémon has hairs on its body that it uses to assess its surroundings.
cobblemon.species.blipbug.name: Blipbug
cobblemon.species.blissey.desc: A kindhearted Pokémon that will care for any sick person or Pokémon until their health improves. The eggs it lays are delicious and bring good fortune to those who eat them.
cobblemon.species.blissey.name: Blissey
cobblemon.species.blitzle.desc: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use the frequency and rhythm of these flashes to communicate.
cobblemon.species.blitzle.name: Blitzle
cobblemon.species.boldore.desc: It relies on sound in order to monitor what's in its vicinity. When angered, it will attack without ever changing the direction it's facing.
cobblemon.species.boldore.name: Boldore
cobblemon.species.boltund.desc: It sends electricity through its legs to boost their strength. Running at top speed, it easily breaks 50 mph.
cobblemon.species.boltund.name: Boltund
cobblemon.species.bombirdier.desc: It gathers things up in an apron made from shed feathers added to the Pokémon's chest feathers, then drops those things from high places for fun.
cobblemon.species.bombirdier.name: Bombirdier
cobblemon.species.bonsly.desc: Its tears elicit sympathy from those who see them, but do not be deceived! This expulsion of body water is merely a physiological mechanism for keeping itself in good health.
cobblemon.species.bonsly.name: Bonsly
cobblemon.species.bouffalant.desc: These Pokémon live in herds of about 20 individuals. Bouffalant that betray the herd will lose the hair on their heads for some reason.
cobblemon.species.bouffalant.name: Bouffalant
cobblemon.species.bounsweet.desc: When under attack, it secretes a sweet and delicious sweat. The scent only calls more enemies to it.
cobblemon.species.bounsweet.name: Bounsweet
cobblemon.species.braixen.desc: When the twig is plucked from its tail, friction sets the twig alight. The flame is used to send signals to its allies.
cobblemon.species.braixen.name: Braixen
cobblemon.species.brambleghast.desc: It will open the branches of its head to envelop its prey. Once it absorbs all the life energy it needs, it expels the prey and discards it.
cobblemon.species.brambleghast.name: Brambleghast
cobblemon.species.bramblin.desc: A soul unable to move on to the afterlife was blown around by the wind until it got tangled up with dried grass and became a Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.bramblin.name: Bramblin
cobblemon.species.braviary.desc: Screaming a bloodcurdling battle cry, this huge and ferocious bird Pokémon goes out on the hunt. It blasts lakes with shock waves, then scoops up any prey that float to the water's surface.
cobblemon.species.braviary.name: Braviary
cobblemon.species.breloom.desc: The seeds ringing Breloom's tail are made of hardened toxic spores. It is horrible to eat the seeds. Just taking a bite of this Pokémon's seed will cause your stomach to rumble.
cobblemon.species.breloom.name: Breloom
cobblemon.species.brionne.desc: On nights when the sea is calm, Brionne dance with one another to the singing of the Primarina that's leading them.
cobblemon.species.brionne.name: Brionne
cobblemon.species.bronzong.desc: Some believe that its bell-like cry opens holes to another world. It has been revered as a deity since ancient times.
cobblemon.species.bronzong.name: Bronzong
cobblemon.species.bronzor.desc: Floats using a mysterious energy. The pattern engraved upon its back is held as sacred and can sometimes be found in imagery from ancient cemeteries and other such timeworn places.
cobblemon.species.bronzor.name: Бронзор
cobblemon.species.brutebonnet.desc: It is possible that the creature listed as Brute Bonnet in a certain book could actually be this Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.brutebonnet.name: Брут-Боннет
cobblemon.species.bruxish.desc: Its skin is thick enough to fend off Mareanie's spikes. With its robust teeth, Bruxish crunches up the spikes and eats them.
cobblemon.species.bruxish.name: Броксиш
cobblemon.species.budew.desc: When the sun's light strengthens, the bud atop this Pokémon's head opens. This is a sign to the people that the harsh winter is over, and the season of budding has begun.
cobblemon.species.budew.name: Бадью
cobblemon.species.buizel.desc: It moves freely in the water by spinning its forked tail for propulsion. The resemblance to the screw of a steamboat is coincidental.
cobblemon.species.buizel.name: Бьюзел
cobblemon.species.bulbasaur.desc: Пока молод, он питается питательными веществами семян со спины для роста
cobblemon.species.bulbasaur.name: Бульбазавр
cobblemon.species.buneary.desc: My hypothesis as to why Buneary rolls up its ears is that its hearing is far too keen. I surmise that the Pokémon protects its hearing by limiting the sound that may enter its ears.
cobblemon.species.buneary.name: Банери
cobblemon.species.bunnelby.desc: It's very sensitive to danger. The sound of Corviknight's flapping will have Bunnelby digging a hole to hide underground in moments.
cobblemon.species.bunnelby.name: Банелби
cobblemon.species.burmy.desc: If its cloak is even slightly damaged, Burmy will immediately repair it with whatever is close at hand. The Pokémon within the cloak is scrawny and vulnerable to the cold.
cobblemon.species.burmy.name: Бёрми
cobblemon.species.butterfree.desc: It collects honey every day. It rubs honey onto the hairs on its legs to carry it back to its nest.
cobblemon.species.butterfree.name: Батерфри
cobblemon.species.buzzwole.desc: Buzzwole goes around showing off its abnormally swollen muscles. It is one kind of Ultra Beast.
cobblemon.species.buzzwole.name: Базвол
cobblemon.species.cacnea.desc: The more arid and harsh the environment, the more pretty and fragrant a flower Cacnea grows. This Pokémon battles by wildly swinging its thorny arms.
cobblemon.species.cacnea.name: Какниа
cobblemon.species.cacturne.desc: If a traveler is going through a desert in the thick of night, Cacturne will follow in a ragtag group. The Pokémon are biding their time, waiting for the traveler to tire and become incapable of moving.
cobblemon.species.cacturne.name: Кактёрн
cobblemon.species.calyrex.desc: Calyrex is known in legend as a king that ruled over Galar in ancient times. It has the power to cause hearts to mend and plants to spring forth.
cobblemon.species.calyrex.name: Calyrex
cobblemon.species.camerupt.desc: The humps on Camerupt's back are formed by a transformation of its bones. They sometimes blast out molten magma. This Pokémon apparently erupts often when it is enraged.
cobblemon.species.camerupt.name: Camerupt
cobblemon.species.capsakid.desc: The more sunlight this Pokémon bathes in, the more spicy chemicals are produced by its body, and thus the spicier its moves become.
cobblemon.species.capsakid.name: Capsakid
cobblemon.species.carbink.desc: It's said that somewhere in the world, there's a mineral vein housing a large pack of slumbering Carbink. It's also said that this pack has a queen.
cobblemon.species.carbink.name: Carbink
cobblemon.species.carkol.desc: By rapidly rolling its legs, it can travel at over 18 mph. The temperature of the flames it breathes exceeds 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit.
cobblemon.species.carkol.name: Carkol
cobblemon.species.carnivine.desc: Though this is a plant Pokémon, it has a gluttonous and unruly temperament. Carnivine attacks its prey with its cavernous maw wide open.
cobblemon.species.carnivine.name: Carnivine
cobblemon.species.carracosta.desc: This Pokémon emerges from the water in search of prey despite the fact that it moves more slowly on land.
cobblemon.species.carracosta.name: Carracosta
cobblemon.species.carvanha.desc: These Pokémon have sharp fangs and powerful jaws. Sailors avoid Carvanha dens at all costs.
cobblemon.species.carvanha.name: Carvanha
cobblemon.species.cascoon.desc: The silk coating its body is thin but sufficiently strong. Cascoon's silk has a luster and texture superior to that of Silcoon's, and clothes made using Cascoon silk are regarded as top-notch.
cobblemon.species.cascoon.name: Cascoon
cobblemon.species.castform.desc: Its form changes depending on the weather. The rougher conditions get, the rougher Castform's disposition!
cobblemon.species.castform.name: Castform
cobblemon.species.caterpie.desc: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.
cobblemon.species.caterpie.name: Caterpie
cobblemon.species.celebi.desc: This Pokémon traveled through time to come from the future. It bolsters grass and trees with its own strength, and it can heal wounds, too.
cobblemon.species.celebi.name: Celebi
cobblemon.species.celesteela.desc: Although it's alien to this world and a danger here, it's apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.
cobblemon.species.celesteela.name: Селестила
cobblemon.species.centiskorch.desc: While its burning body is already dangerous on its own, this excessively hostile Pokémon also has large and very sharp fangs.
cobblemon.species.centiskorch.name: Сентискортч
cobblemon.species.ceruledge.desc: The fiery blades on its arms burn fiercely with the lingering resentment of a sword wielder who fell before accomplishing their goal.
cobblemon.species.ceruledge.name: Церуледж
cobblemon.species.cetitan.desc: This Pokémon wanders around snowy, icy areas. It protects its body with powerful muscles and a thick layer of fat under its skin.
cobblemon.species.cetitan.name: Цетитан
cobblemon.species.cetoddle.desc: This species left the ocean and began living on land a very long time ago. It seems to be closely related to Wailmer.
cobblemon.species.cetoddle.name: Ситодл
cobblemon.species.chandelure.desc: In homes illuminated by Chandelure instead of lights, funerals were a constant occurrence— or so it's said.
cobblemon.species.chandelure.name: Чанделор
cobblemon.species.chansey.desc: This purehearted Pokémon shares its eggs with the injured.
cobblemon.species.chansey.name: Чанси
cobblemon.species.charcadet.desc: Burnt charcoal came to life and became a Pokémon. Possessing a fiery fighting spirit, Charcadet will battle even tough opponents.
cobblemon.species.charcadet.name: Чаркадет
cobblemon.species.charizard.desc: Крылья этого покемона могут поднимать его на высоту до 1400 метров. Он извергает пламя при очень высоких температурах.
cobblemon.species.charizard.name: Чаризард
cobblemon.species.charjabug.desc: Пищеварительные процессы этого покемона превращают съеденные листья в электричество. Электрический мешок в его животе хранит электричество для последующего использования.
cobblemon.species.charjabug.name: Чарджабаг
cobblemon.species.charmander.desc: С рождения на кончике его хвоста горит пламя. Если пламя погаснет, его жизнь закончится.
cobblemon.species.charmander.name: Чармандер
cobblemon.species.charmeleon.desc: Если он возбуждается во время боя, он извергает сильное пламя, сжигая всё вокруг.
cobblemon.species.charmeleon.name: Камелеон
cobblemon.species.chatot.desc: Универсальный исполнитель, мастерски имитирующий человеческую речь. Говорят, что более старые и опытные чатоты могут даже понимать смысл слов, которые они повторяют.
cobblemon.species.chatot.name: Чатот
cobblemon.species.cherrim.desc: Motionless, save for the occasional quiver. A rich array of Pokémon can be found gathered around it, drawn by the scent exuded from Cherrim's folded petals.
cobblemon.species.cherrim.name: Черрем
cobblemon.species.cherubi.desc: Once the fruit growing alongside the main body is large and plump, Cherubi will use the nutrients within to evolve. The fruit then detaches, becoming nourishment for other creatures.
cobblemon.species.cherubi.name: Чероби
cobblemon.species.chesnaught.desc: When it takes a defensive posture with its fists guarding its face, it could withstand a bomb blast.
cobblemon.species.chesnaught.name: Чезноут
cobblemon.species.chespin.desc: Such a thick shell of wood covers its head and back that even a direct hit from a truck wouldn't faze it.
cobblemon.species.chespin.name: Chespin
cobblemon.species.chewtle.desc: It starts off battles by attacking with its rock-hard horn, but as soon as the opponent flinches, this Pokémon bites down and never lets go.
cobblemon.species.chewtle.name: Chewtle
cobblemon.species.chienpao.desc: This Pokémon can control 100 tons of fallen snow. It plays around innocently by leaping in and out of avalanches it has caused.
cobblemon.species.chienpao.name: Chien-Pao
cobblemon.species.chikorita.desc: In battle, Chikorita waves its leaf around to keep the foe at bay. However, a sweet fragrance also wafts from the leaf, becalming the battling Pokémon and creating a cozy, friendly atmosphere all around.
cobblemon.species.chikorita.name: Chikorita
cobblemon.species.chimchar.desc: Full of vigor and always in high spirits. It was once known by the name «Lantern-Tail» and feared as some kind of apparition.
cobblemon.species.chimchar.name: Chimchar
cobblemon.species.chimecho.desc: Can emit waves of air powerful enough to knock out prey taller than itself. I hypothesize that it amplifies the faint sound of wind within its body.
cobblemon.species.chimecho.name: Chimecho
cobblemon.species.chinchou.desc: On the dark ocean floor, its only means of communication is its constantly flashing lights.
cobblemon.species.chinchou.name: Chinchou
cobblemon.species.chingling.desc: This Pokémon gave me an excruciating headache when it seemingly cried out without making a sound. Perhaps there are some sounds that the human ear is simply incapable of hearing.
cobblemon.species.chingling.name: Chingling
cobblemon.species.chiyu.desc: It controls flames burning at over 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit. It casually swims through the sea of lava it creates by melting rock and sand.
cobblemon.species.chiyu.name: Chi-Yu
cobblemon.species.cinccino.desc: A special oil that seeps through their fur helps them avoid attacks. The oil fetches a high price at market.
cobblemon.species.cinccino.name: Cinccino
cobblemon.species.cinderace.desc: It's skilled at both offense and defense, and it gets pumped up when cheered on. But if it starts showboating, it could put itself in a tough spot.
cobblemon.species.cinderace.name: Cinderace
cobblemon.species.clamperl.desc: Clamperl's pearls are exceedingly precious. They can be more than 10 times as costly as Shellder's pearls.
cobblemon.species.clamperl.name: Clamperl
cobblemon.species.clauncher.desc: By detonating gas that accumulates in its right claw, this Pokémon launches water like a bullet. This is how Clauncher defeats its enemies.
cobblemon.species.clauncher.name: Clauncher
cobblemon.species.clawitzer.desc: Clawitzer's right arm is a cannon that launches projectiles made of seawater. Shots from a Clawitzer's cannon arm can sink a tanker.
cobblemon.species.clawitzer.name: Clawitzer
cobblemon.species.claydol.desc: It appears to have been born from clay dolls made by ancient people. It uses telekinesis to float and move.
cobblemon.species.claydol.name: Claydol
cobblemon.species.clefable.desc: Legend says that on clear, quiet nights, it listens for the voices of its kin living on the moon. I, too, often think of my homeland, so far away.
cobblemon.species.clefable.name: Clefable
cobblemon.species.clefairy.desc: It can be found in quiet mountain areas on a full moon's night. Its dancing and its tiny, faintly glowing wings confer upon it a lovely fairylike quality.
cobblemon.species.clefairy.name: Clefairy
cobblemon.species.cleffa.desc: In silhouette, they resemble twinkling starlight. When shooting stars rain from the night sky, Cleffa gather in numbers and dance as though they are indeed incarnations of the stars.
cobblemon.species.cleffa.name: Cleffa
cobblemon.species.clobbopus.desc: Its tentacles tear off easily, but it isn't alarmed when that happens—it knows they'll grow back. It's about as smart as a three-year-old.
cobblemon.species.clobbopus.name: Clobbopus
cobblemon.species.clodsire.desc: When attacked, this Pokémon will retaliate by sticking thick spines out from its body. It's a risky move that puts everything on the line.
cobblemon.species.clodsire.name: Клодсайр
cobblemon.species.cloyster.desc: Once it slams its shell shut, it is impossible to open, even by those with superior strength.
cobblemon.species.cloyster.name: Клойстр
cobblemon.species.coalossal.desc: While it's engaged in battle, its mountain of coal will burn bright red, sending off sparks that scorch the surrounding area.
cobblemon.species.coalossal.name: Колосал
cobblemon.species.cobalion.desc: From the moment it's born, this Pokémon radiates the air of a leader. Its presence will calm even vicious foes.
cobblemon.species.cobalion.name: Кобалион
cobblemon.species.cofagrigus.desc: There are many depictions of Cofagrigus decorating ancient tombs. They're symbols of the wealth that kings of bygone eras had.
cobblemon.species.cofagrigus.name: Кофагригас
cobblemon.species.combee.desc: They swear fealty to a queen Pokémon and work diligently to gather nectar. Each swarm produces a different flavor of honey.
cobblemon.species.combee.name: Комби
cobblemon.species.combusken.desc: Combusken battles with the intensely hot flames it spews from its beak and with outstandingly destructive kicks. This Pokémon's cry is very loud and distracting.
cobblemon.species.combusken.name: Комбаскен
cobblemon.species.comfey.desc: These Pokémon smell very nice. All Comfey wear different flowers, so each of these Pokémon has its own individual scent.
cobblemon.species.comfey.name: Камфи
cobblemon.species.conkeldurr.desc: When going all out, this Pokémon throws aside its concrete pillars and leaps at opponents to pummel them with its fists.
cobblemon.species.conkeldurr.name: Conkeldurr
cobblemon.species.copperajah.desc: These Pokémon live in herds. Their trunks have incredible grip strength, strong enough to crush giant rocks into powder.
cobblemon.species.copperajah.name: Copperajah
cobblemon.species.corphish.desc: It was originally a Pokémon from afar that escaped to the wild. It can adapt to the dirtiest river.
cobblemon.species.corphish.name: Corphish
cobblemon.species.corsola.desc: These Pokémon live in warm seas. In prehistoric times, many lived in the oceans around the Galar region as well.
cobblemon.species.corsola.name: Corsola
cobblemon.species.corviknight.desc: With their great intellect and flying skills, these Pokémon very successfully act as the Galar region's airborne taxi service.
cobblemon.species.corviknight.name: Corviknight
cobblemon.species.corvisquire.desc: The lessons of many harsh battles have taught it how to accurately judge an opponent's strength.
cobblemon.species.corvisquire.name: Corvisquire
cobblemon.species.cosmoem.desc: It sucks in dust from the air at an astounding rate, frantically building up energy within its core as preparation for evolution.
cobblemon.species.cosmoem.name: Cosmoem
cobblemon.species.cosmog.desc: Cosmog is very curious but not very cautious, often placing itself in danger. If things start to look dicey, it teleports away.
cobblemon.species.cosmog.name: Cosmog
cobblemon.species.cottonee.desc: Weaving together the cotton of both Cottonee and Eldegoss produces exquisite cloth that's highly prized by many luxury brands.
cobblemon.species.cottonee.name: Cottonee
cobblemon.species.crabominable.desc: Before it stops to think, it just starts pummeling. There are records of its turning back avalanches with a flurry of punches.
cobblemon.species.crabominable.name: Crabominable
cobblemon.species.crabrawler.desc: Crabrawler has been known to mistake Exeggutor for a coconut tree and climb it. The enraged Exeggutor shakes it off and stomps it.
cobblemon.species.crabrawler.name: Crabrawler
cobblemon.species.cradily.desc: Once Cradily catches prey in its tentacles, it digests them whole and absorbs their nutrients.
cobblemon.species.cradily.name: Cradily
cobblemon.species.cramorant.desc: This hungry Pokémon swallows Arrokuda whole. Occasionally, it makes a mistake and tries to swallow a Pokémon other than its preferred prey.
cobblemon.species.cramorant.name: Cramorant
cobblemon.species.cranidos.desc: An incredibly rare sight. They duel each other by ramming their heads together, and the resulting sound echoes throughout the area like the pealing of a bell.
cobblemon.species.cranidos.name: Cranidos
cobblemon.species.crawdaunt.desc: A brutish Pokémon that loves to battle. It will crash itself into any foe that approaches its nest.
cobblemon.species.crawdaunt.name: Crawdaunt
cobblemon.species.cresselia.desc: Cresselia is reminiscent of the crescent moon. It leaves a brilliant line of light in its wake as it flies across the night sky. I daresay it resembles the heavenly maiden who created the Milky Way.
cobblemon.species.cresselia.name: Cresselia
cobblemon.species.croagunk.desc: A poison wielder with a dastardly personality. Despite such qualities, this species is afforded a measure of popularity due to its peculiar cry and comical features.
cobblemon.species.croagunk.name: Croagunk
cobblemon.species.crobat.desc: Its hind limbs have become another set of wings. Crobat expertly maneuvers its four wings to dart in exquisite fashion through even the most confined caves without losing any speed.
cobblemon.species.crobat.name: Crobat
cobblemon.species.crocalor.desc: The combination of Crocalor's fire energy and overflowing vitality has caused an egg-shaped fireball to appear on the Pokémon's head.
cobblemon.species.crocalor.name: Crocalor
cobblemon.species.croconaw.desc: Once Croconaw has clamped its jaws on its foe, it will absolutely not let go. Because the tips of its fangs are forked back like barbed fishhooks, they become impossible to remove when they have sunk in.
cobblemon.species.croconaw.name: Croconaw
cobblemon.species.crustle.desc: Its thick claws are its greatest weapons. They're mighty enough to crack Rhyperior's carapace.
cobblemon.species.crustle.name: Crustle
cobblemon.species.cryogonal.desc: When the weather gets hot, these Pokémon turn into water vapor. Cryogonal are almost never seen during summer.
cobblemon.species.cryogonal.name: Cryogonal
cobblemon.species.cubchoo.desc: It sniffles before performing a move, using its frosty snot to provide an icy element to any move that needs it.
cobblemon.species.cubchoo.name: Cubchoo
cobblemon.species.cubone.desc: This Pokémon wears the skull of its deceased mother. Sometimes Cubone's dreams make it cry, but each tear Cubone sheds makes it stronger.
cobblemon.species.cubone.name: Cubone
cobblemon.species.cufant.desc: If a job requires serious strength, this Pokémon will excel at it. Its copper body tarnishes in the rain, turning a vibrant green color.
cobblemon.species.cufant.name: Cufant
cobblemon.species.cursola.desc: Be cautious of the ectoplasmic body surrounding its soul. You'll become stiff as stone if you touch it.
cobblemon.species.cursola.name: Cursola
cobblemon.species.cutiefly.desc: An opponent's aura can tell Cutiefly what that opponent's next move will be. Then Cutiefly can glide around the attack and strike back.
cobblemon.species.cutiefly.name: Cutiefly
cobblemon.species.cyclizar.desc: Apparently Cyclizar has been allowing people to ride on its back since ancient times. Depictions of this have been found in 10,000-year-old murals.
cobblemon.species.cyclizar.name: Cyclizar
cobblemon.species.cyndaquil.desc: Hails from the Johto region. Though usually curled into a ball due to its timid disposition, it harbors tremendous firepower.
cobblemon.species.cyndaquil.name: Cyndaquil
cobblemon.species.dachsbun.desc: The pleasant aroma that emanates from this Pokémon's body helps wheat grow, so Dachsbun has been treasured by farming villages.
cobblemon.species.dachsbun.name: Dachsbun
cobblemon.species.darkrai.desc: On a moonless night, a strange incident occurred in which every one of a village's inhabitants suffered nightmares. The villagers attested that Darkrai appeared before them in these nightmares.
cobblemon.species.darkrai.name: Darkrai
cobblemon.species.darmanitan.desc: This Pokémon's power level rises along with the temperature of its fire, which can reach 2,500 degrees Fahrenheit.
cobblemon.species.darmanitan.name: Darmanitan
cobblemon.species.dartrix.desc: Regularly basks in sunlight to gather power—presumably due to the frigid climate. Nonetheless, the edges of the blade quills set into its wings are keen as ever.
cobblemon.species.dartrix.name: Dartrix
cobblemon.species.darumaka.desc: This popular symbol of good fortune will never fall over in its sleep, no matter how it's pushed or pulled.
cobblemon.species.darumaka.name: Darumaka
cobblemon.species.decidueye.desc: The air stored inside the rachises of Decidueye's feathers insulates the Pokémon against Hisui's extreme cold. This is firm proof that evolution can be influenced by environment.
cobblemon.species.decidueye.name: Decidueye
cobblemon.species.dedenne.desc: Since Dedenne can't generate much electricity on its own, it steals electricity from outlets or other electric Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.dedenne.name: Dedenne
cobblemon.species.deerling.desc: The turning of the seasons changes the color and scent of this Pokémon's fur. People use it to mark the seasons.
cobblemon.species.deerling.name: Deerling
cobblemon.species.deino.desc: Because it can't see, this Pokémon is constantly biting at everything it touches, trying to keep track of its surroundings.
cobblemon.species.deino.name: Deino
cobblemon.species.delcatty.desc: Delcatty sleeps anywhere it wants without keeping a permanent nest. If other Pokémon approach it as it sleeps, this Pokémon will never fight—it will just move away somewhere else.
cobblemon.species.delcatty.name: Delcatty
cobblemon.species.delibird.desc: It has a generous habit of sharing its food with people and Pokémon, so it's always scrounging around for more food.
cobblemon.species.delibird.name: Delibird
cobblemon.species.delphox.desc: Using psychic power, it generates a fiery vortex of 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit, incinerating foes swept into this whirl of flame.
cobblemon.species.delphox.name: Delphox
cobblemon.species.deoxys.desc: Deoxys emerged from a virus that came from space. It is highly intelligent and wields psychokinetic powers. This Pokémon shoots lasers from the crystalline organ on its chest.
cobblemon.species.deoxys.name: Deoxys
cobblemon.species.dewgong.desc: Its entire body is a snowy white. Unharmed by even intense cold, it swims powerfully in icy waters.
cobblemon.species.dewgong.name: Dewgong
cobblemon.species.dewott.desc: Its exquisite double-scalchop technique is likely the result of daily training, and it can send even masters of the blade fleeing in defeat.
cobblemon.species.dewott.name: Dewott
cobblemon.species.dewpider.desc: Dewpider normally lives underwater. When it comes onto land in search of food, it takes water with it in the form of a bubble on its head.
cobblemon.species.dewpider.name: Dewpider
cobblemon.species.dhelmise.desc: After lowering its anchor, it waits for its prey. It catches large Wailord and drains their life-force.
cobblemon.species.dhelmise.name: Dhelmise
cobblemon.species.dialga.desc: This Pokémon is revered as a deity in Hisuian legend. The birth of Dialga was what caused the vast river of time to begin flowing in our world.
cobblemon.species.dialga.name: Dialga
cobblemon.species.diancie.desc: It can instantly create many diamonds by compressing the carbon in the air between its hands.
cobblemon.species.diancie.name: Diancie
cobblemon.species.diggersby.desc: The fur on its belly retains heat exceptionally well. People used to make heavy winter clothing from fur shed by this Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.diggersby.name: Diggersby
cobblemon.species.diglett.desc: It burrows through the ground at a shallow depth. It leaves raised earth in its wake, making it easy to spot.
cobblemon.species.diglett.name: Diglett
cobblemon.species.dipplin.desc: Dipplin is two creatures in one Pokémon. Its evolution was triggered by a special apple grown only in one place.
cobblemon.species.dipplin.name: Dipplin
cobblemon.species.ditto.desc: When it encounters another Ditto, it will move faster than normal to duplicate that opponent exactly.
cobblemon.species.ditto.name: Ditto
cobblemon.species.dodrio.desc: One of Doduo's two heads splits to form a unique species. It runs close to 40 mph in prairies.
cobblemon.species.dodrio.name: Dodrio
cobblemon.species.doduo.desc: Its short wings make flying difficult. Instead, this Pokémon runs at high speed on developed legs.
cobblemon.species.doduo.name: Doduo
cobblemon.species.dolliv.desc: Dolliv shares its tasty, fresh-scented oil with others. This species has coexisted with humans since times long gone.
cobblemon.species.dolliv.name: Dolliv
cobblemon.species.dondozo.desc: This Pokémon is a glutton, but it's bad at getting food. It teams up with a Tatsugiri to catch prey.
cobblemon.species.dondozo.name: Dondozo
cobblemon.species.donphan.desc: If Donphan were to tackle with its hard body, even a house could be destroyed. Using its massive strength, the Pokémon helps clear rock and mud slides that block mountain trails.
cobblemon.species.donphan.name: Donphan
cobblemon.species.dottler.desc: As it grows inside its shell, it uses its psychic abilities to monitor the outside world and prepare for evolution.
cobblemon.species.dottler.name: Dottler
cobblemon.species.doublade.desc: The two swords employ a strategy of rapidly alternating between offense and defense to bring down their prey.
cobblemon.species.doublade.name: Doublade
cobblemon.species.dracovish.desc: Its mighty legs are capable of running at speeds exceeding 40 mph, but this Pokémon can't breathe unless it's underwater.
cobblemon.species.dracovish.name: Dracovish
cobblemon.species.dracozolt.desc: The powerful muscles in its tail generate its electricity. Compared to its lower body, its upper half is entirely too small.
cobblemon.species.dracozolt.name: Dracozolt
cobblemon.species.dragalge.desc: Dragalge generates dragon energy by sticking the plume on its head out above the ocean's surface and bathing it in sunlight.
cobblemon.species.dragalge.name: Dragalge
cobblemon.species.dragapult.desc: Apparently the Dreepy inside Dragapult's horns eagerly look forward to being launched out at Mach speeds.
cobblemon.species.dragapult.name: Dragapult
cobblemon.species.dragonair.desc: This Pokémon gathers power in the orbs on its tail and controls the weather. When enshrouded by an aura, Dragonair has a mystical appearance.
cobblemon.species.dragonair.name: Dragonair
cobblemon.species.dragonite.desc: This Pokémon is known as the Sea Incarnate. Figureheads that resemble Dragonite decorate the bows of many ships.
cobblemon.species.dragonite.name: Dragonite
cobblemon.species.drakloak.desc: Without a Dreepy to place on its head and care for, it gets so uneasy it'll try to substitute any Pokémon it finds for the missing Dreepy.
cobblemon.species.drakloak.name: Drakloak
cobblemon.species.drampa.desc: Drampa is a kind and friendly Pokémon—up until it's angered. When that happens, it stirs up a gale and flattens everything around.
cobblemon.species.drampa.name: Drampa
cobblemon.species.drapion.desc: Has a brutish, ferocious temperament. With immense strength and a sturdy shell off which swords will bounce, it rampages about and wreaks havoc.
cobblemon.species.drapion.name: Drapion
cobblemon.species.dratini.desc: This Pokémon was long considered to be no more than a myth. The small lump on a Dratini's forehead is actually a horn that's still coming in.
cobblemon.species.dratini.name: Дротини
cobblemon.species.drednaw.desc: This Pokémon rapidly extends its retractable neck to sink its sharp fangs into distant enemies and take them down.
cobblemon.species.drednaw.name: Дредноу
cobblemon.species.dreepy.desc: If this weak Pokémon is by itself, a mere child could defeat it. But if Dreepy has friends to help it train, it can evolve and become much stronger.
cobblemon.species.dreepy.name: Дрипи
cobblemon.species.drifblim.desc: It drifts along at dusk, perfectly silent. Its transient, melancholy aspect touches some people deeply—every so often, one will come upon a song or poem devoted to Drifblim.
cobblemon.species.drifblim.name: Дрифблем
cobblemon.species.drifloon.desc: Said to lure away young children and carry them off to the afterlife. Some whisper that Drifloon are formed of reincarnated human souls, but these rumors are as yet unconfirmed.
cobblemon.species.drifloon.name: Дрифлун
cobblemon.species.drilbur.desc: It's a digger, using its claws to burrow through the ground. It causes damage to vegetable crops, so many farmers have little love for it.
cobblemon.species.drilbur.name: Дрилбар
cobblemon.species.drizzile.desc: Highly intelligent but also very lazy, it keeps enemies out of its territory by laying traps everywhere.
cobblemon.species.drizzile.name: Дризиел
cobblemon.species.drowzee.desc: If you sleep by it all the time, it will sometimes show you dreams it had eaten in the past.
cobblemon.species.drowzee.name: Драузи
cobblemon.species.druddigon.desc: Druddigon are vicious and cunning. They take up residence in nests dug out by other Pokémon, treating the stolen nests as their own lairs.
cobblemon.species.druddigon.name: Драдигон
cobblemon.species.dubwool.desc: Its majestic horns are meant only to impress the opposite gender. They never see use in battle.
cobblemon.species.dubwool.name: Дабвол
cobblemon.species.ducklett.desc: They are better at swimming than flying, and they happily eat their favorite food, peat moss, as they dive underwater.
cobblemon.species.ducklett.name: Даклет
cobblemon.species.dudunsparce.name: Дюданспарс
cobblemon.species.dugtrio.desc: These Diglett triplets dig over 60 miles below sea level. No one knows what it's like underground.
cobblemon.species.dugtrio.name: Dugtrio
cobblemon.species.dunsparce.desc: The nests Dunsparce live in are mazes of tunnels. They never get lost in their own nests—they can tell where they are by the scent of the dirt.
cobblemon.species.dunsparce.name: Dunsparce
cobblemon.species.duosion.desc: Its brain has split into two, and the two halves rarely think alike. Its actions are utterly unpredictable.
cobblemon.species.duosion.name: Duosion
cobblemon.species.duraludon.desc: The special metal that composes its body is very light, so this Pokémon has considerable agility. It lives in caves because it dislikes the rain.
cobblemon.species.duraludon.name: Duraludon
cobblemon.species.durant.desc: With their large mandibles, these Pokémon can crunch their way through rock. They work together to protect their eggs from Sandaconda.
cobblemon.species.durant.name: Durant
cobblemon.species.dusclops.desc: There are rumors that peeking inside its bandage-wrapped body will cause one to get pulled in through the gaps between the bandages, never to return. I've been too scared to verify.
cobblemon.species.dusclops.name: Dusclops
cobblemon.species.dusknoir.desc: Comes to those whose lives have come to an end and escorts their souls to the afterlife. Known to mistakenly take the souls of those who yet have life left in them, albeit rarely.
cobblemon.species.dusknoir.name: Dusknoir
cobblemon.species.duskull.desc: I've heard that the children of Hisui all begin to behave once they've been told the story of how this Pokémon roams about before the witching hour to spirit away misbehaving children.
cobblemon.species.duskull.name: Duskull
cobblemon.species.dustox.desc: Tends to be drawn to bonfires on dark nights. Difficult to chase away from settlements because of the way it scatters highly toxic scales.
cobblemon.species.dustox.name: Dustox
cobblemon.species.dwebble.desc: It first tries to find a rock to live in, but if there are no suitable rocks to be found, Dwebble may move in to the ports of a Hippowdon.
cobblemon.species.dwebble.name: Dwebble
cobblemon.species.eelektrik.desc: These Pokémon have a big appetite. When they spot their prey, they attack it and paralyze it with electricity.
cobblemon.species.eelektrik.name: Eelektrik
cobblemon.species.eelektross.desc: They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean.
cobblemon.species.eelektross.name: Eelektross
cobblemon.species.eevee.desc: Harbors the potential to evolve into manifold forms. Within Eevee lies the key to the mysteries of Pokémon evolution—I'm certain of it.
cobblemon.species.eevee.name: Eevee
cobblemon.species.eiscue.desc: This Pokémon keeps its heat-sensitive head cool with ice. It fishes for its food, dangling its single hair into the sea to lure in prey.
cobblemon.species.eiscue.name: Eiscue
cobblemon.species.ekans.desc: The older it gets, the longer it grows. At night, it wraps its long body around tree branches to rest.
cobblemon.species.ekans.name: Ekans
cobblemon.species.eldegoss.desc: The cotton on the head of this Pokémon can be spun into a glossy, gorgeous yarn—a Galar regional specialty.
cobblemon.species.eldegoss.name: Eldegoss
cobblemon.species.electabuzz.desc: Feeds on electrical energy. During sudden showers beneath looming thunderclouds, one can observe Electabuzz scaling tall trees, where the Pokémon will then wait for lightning to strike.
cobblemon.species.electabuzz.name: Электабазз
cobblemon.species.electivire.desc: Its evolution was induced by an unusual item, and its electrical output rises along with its heart rate. From its tails, it can unleash an electric current measuring 20,000 volts.
cobblemon.species.electivire.name: Элективайр
cobblemon.species.electrike.desc: It stores electricity in its fur. It gives off sparks from all over its body in seasons when the air is dry.
cobblemon.species.electrike.name: Электрайк
cobblemon.species.electrode.desc: Ткань на поверхности его тела поразительно схожа с составом абрижёлудей. Когда он раздражён, он выпускает электрический разряд, эквивалентный 20 молниям.
cobblemon.species.electrode.name: Электрод
cobblemon.species.elekid.desc: Они генерируют электричество, вращая лапами. Если вы когда-либо во время грозы в дикой природе слышали весёлые детские голоса, на самом деле это были голоса элекидов.
cobblemon.species.elekid.name: Элекид
cobblemon.species.elgyem.desc: Этот покемон был обнаружен около 50 лет назад. Свои психические способности ему позволяет использовать его высокоразвитый мозг.
cobblemon.species.elgyem.name: Элгьем
cobblemon.species.emboar.desc: It has mastered fast and powerful fighting moves. It grows a beard of fire.
cobblemon.species.emboar.name: Эмбор
cobblemon.species.emolga.desc: This Pokémon absolutely loves sweet berries. Sometimes it stuffs its cheeks full of so much food that it can't fly properly.
cobblemon.species.emolga.name: Emolga
cobblemon.species.empoleon.desc: Since ancient times, it has been revered by the people of Hisui, who call it the Master of the Waves. Its wings are a match for even master-crafted blades.
cobblemon.species.empoleon.name: Empoleon
cobblemon.species.enamorus.desc: When it flies to this land from across the sea, the bitter winter comes to an end. According to legend, this Pokémon's love gives rise to the budding of fresh life across Hisui.
cobblemon.species.enamorus.name: Enamorus
cobblemon.species.entei.desc: Entei embodies the passion of magma. This Pokémon is thought to have been born in the eruption of a volcano. It sends up massive bursts of fire that utterly consume all that they touch.
cobblemon.species.entei.name: Entei
cobblemon.species.escavalier.desc: It charges its enemies, lances at the ready. An image of one of its duels is captured in a famous painting of Escavalier clashing with Sirfetch'd.
cobblemon.species.escavalier.name: Escavalier
cobblemon.species.espathra.desc: It immobilizes opponents by bathing them in psychic power from its large eyes. Despite its appearance, it has a vicious temperament.
cobblemon.species.espathra.name: Espathra
cobblemon.species.espeon.desc: Wields an arcane power with which it can predict the weather and even people's thoughts. When bathed in sunshine, the scarlet orb on its brow glows and builds energy.
cobblemon.species.espeon.name: Espeon
cobblemon.species.espurr.desc: There's enough psychic power in Espurr to send a wrestler flying, but because this power can't be controlled, Espurr finds it troublesome.
cobblemon.species.espurr.name: Espurr
cobblemon.species.eternatus.desc: It was inside a meteorite that fell 20,000 years ago. There seems to be a connection between this Pokémon and the Dynamax phenomenon.
cobblemon.species.eternatus.name: Eternatus
cobblemon.species.excadrill.desc: Known as the Drill King, this Pokémon can tunnel through the terrain at speeds of over 90 mph.
cobblemon.species.excadrill.name: Excadrill
cobblemon.species.exeggcute.desc: These Pokémon get nervous when they're not in a group of six. The minute even one member of the group goes missing, Exeggcute become cowardly.
cobblemon.species.exeggcute.name: Exeggcute
cobblemon.species.exeggutor.desc: When they work together, Exeggutor's three heads can put out powerful psychic energy. Cloudy days make this Pokémon sluggish.
cobblemon.species.exeggutor.name: Exeggutor
cobblemon.species.exploud.desc: This Pokémon can do more than just shout. To communicate with others of its kind, it'll emit all sorts of sounds from the holes in its body.
cobblemon.species.exploud.name: Exploud
cobblemon.species.falinks.desc: The six of them work together as one Pokémon. Teamwork is also their battle strategy, and they constantly change their formation as they fight.
cobblemon.species.falinks.name: Falinks
cobblemon.species.farfetchd.desc: They use a plant stalk as a weapon, but not all of them use it in the same way. Several distinct styles of stalk fighting have been observed.
cobblemon.species.farfetchd.name: Farfetch'd
cobblemon.species.farigiraf.desc: Now that the brain waves from the head and tail are synced up, the psychic power of this Pokémon is 10 times stronger than Girafarig's.
cobblemon.species.farigiraf.name: Farigiraf
cobblemon.species.fearow.desc: A Pokémon that dates back many years. If it senses danger, it flies high and away, instantly.
cobblemon.species.fearow.name: Fearow
cobblemon.species.feebas.desc: It is a shabby and ugly Pokémon. However, it is very hardy and can survive on little water.
cobblemon.species.feebas.name: Feebas
cobblemon.species.fennekin.desc: As it walks, it munches on a twig in place of a snack. It intimidates opponents by puffing hot air out of its ears.
cobblemon.species.fennekin.name: Fennekin
cobblemon.species.feraligatr.desc: Feraligatr intimidates its foes by opening its huge mouth. In battle, it will kick the ground hard with its thick and powerful hind legs to charge at the foe at an incredible speed.
cobblemon.species.feraligatr.name: Feraligatr
cobblemon.species.ferroseed.desc: Mossy caves are their preferred dwellings. Enzymes contained in mosses help Ferroseed's spikes grow big and strong.
cobblemon.species.ferroseed.name: Ferroseed
cobblemon.species.ferrothorn.desc: Its spikes are harder than steel. This Pokémon crawls across rock walls by stabbing the spikes on its feelers into the stone.
cobblemon.species.ferrothorn.name: Ferrothorn
cobblemon.species.fezandipiti.desc: Fezandipiti owes its beautiful looks and lovely voice to the toxic stimulants emanating from the chain wrapped around its body.
cobblemon.species.fezandipiti.name: Fezandipiti
cobblemon.species.fidough.desc: This Pokémon is smooth and moist to the touch. Yeast in Fidough's breath induces fermentation in the Pokémon's vicinity.
cobblemon.species.fidough.name: Fidough
cobblemon.species.finizen.desc: It likes playing with others of its kind using the water ring on its tail. It uses ultrasonic waves to sense the emotions of other living creatures.
cobblemon.species.finizen.name: Finizen
cobblemon.species.finneon.desc: What a gorgeous sight this Pokémon is as it swims with its long, pink-painted caudal fins fluttering behind it. Finneon's beautiful appearance has led to its nickname: «finery fish.»
cobblemon.species.finneon.name: Finneon
cobblemon.species.flaaffy.desc: It stores electricity in its fluffy fleece. If it stores up too much, it will start to go bald in those patches.
cobblemon.species.flaaffy.name: Flaaffy
cobblemon.species.flabebe.desc: Flabébé wears a crown made from pollen it's collected from its flower. The crown has hidden healing properties.
cobblemon.species.flabebe.name: Flabébé
cobblemon.species.flamigo.desc: This Pokémon apparently ties the base of its neck into a knot so that the energy stored in its belly does not escape from its beak.
cobblemon.species.flamigo.name: Flamigo
cobblemon.species.flapple.desc: It flies on wings of apple skin and spits a powerful acid. It can also change its shape into that of an apple.
cobblemon.species.flapple.name: Flapple
cobblemon.species.flareon.desc: Flames burn within a saclike organ inside this Pokémon. When Flareon inhales, these flames grow in intensity, reaching a mighty 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit.
cobblemon.species.flareon.name: Flareon
cobblemon.species.fletchinder.desc: Fletchinder are exceedingly territorial and aggressive. These Pokémon fight among themselves over feeding grounds.
cobblemon.species.fletchinder.name: Fletchinder
cobblemon.species.fletchling.desc: When this Pokémon gets excited, its body temperature increases sharply. If you touch a Fletchling with bare hands, you might get burned.
cobblemon.species.fletchling.name: Fletchling
cobblemon.species.flittle.desc: Flittle's toes levitate about half an inch above the ground because of the psychic power emitted from the frills on the Pokémon's belly.
cobblemon.species.flittle.name: Flittle
cobblemon.species.floatzel.desc: Has a long, rather splendid flotation sac, which prevents Floatzel from drowning even in stormy seas. One might glimpse this species around fishing hamlets from time to time.
cobblemon.species.floatzel.name: Floatzel
cobblemon.species.floette.desc: It gives its own power to flowers, pouring its heart into caring for them. Floette never forgives anyone who messes up a flower bed.
cobblemon.species.floette.name: Floette
cobblemon.species.floragato.desc: Floragato deftly wields the vine hidden beneath its long fur, slamming the hard flower bud against its opponents.
cobblemon.species.floragato.name: Флорагато
cobblemon.species.florges.desc: Its life can span several hundred years. It's said to devote its entire life to protecting gardens.
cobblemon.species.florges.name: Florges
cobblemon.species.fluttermane.desc: This Pokémon has characteristics similar to those of Flutter Mane, a creature mentioned in a certain book.
cobblemon.species.fluttermane.name: Flutter Mane
cobblemon.species.flygon.desc: It is nicknamed the Desert Spirit because the flapping of its wings sounds like a woman singing.
cobblemon.species.flygon.name: Flygon
cobblemon.species.fomantis.desc: During the day, Fomantis basks in sunlight and sleeps peacefully. It wakes and moves around at night.
cobblemon.species.fomantis.name: Fomantis
cobblemon.species.foongus.desc: The spores released from this Pokémon's hands are highly poisonous, but when thoroughly dried, the spores can be used as stomach medicine.
cobblemon.species.foongus.name: Foongus
cobblemon.species.forretress.desc: In the moment that it gulps down its prey, the inside of its shell is exposed, but to this day, no one has ever seen that sight.
cobblemon.species.forretress.name: Forretress
cobblemon.species.fraxure.desc: Its skin is as hard as a suit of armor. Fraxure's favorite strategy is to tackle its opponents, stabbing them with its tusks at the same time.
cobblemon.species.fraxure.name: Fraxure
cobblemon.species.frigibax.desc: Frigibax absorbs heat through its dorsal fin and converts the heat into ice energy. The higher the temperature, the more energy Frigibax stores.
cobblemon.species.frigibax.name: Frigibax
cobblemon.species.frillish.desc: Legend has it that the residents of a sunken ancient city changed into these Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.frillish.name: Frillish
cobblemon.species.froakie.desc: It protects its skin by covering its body in delicate bubbles. Beneath its happy-go-lucky air, it keeps a watchful eye on its surroundings.
cobblemon.species.froakie.name: Froakie
cobblemon.species.frogadier.desc: Its swiftness is unparalleled. It can scale a tower of more than 2,000 feet in a minute's time.
cobblemon.species.frogadier.name: Frogadier
cobblemon.species.froslass.desc: A Pokémon inhabited by the soul of a woman who died bearing a grudge in the snowy mountains. Legends of Froslass placing deathly curses on misbehaving men send shivers down my spine.
cobblemon.species.froslass.name: Froslass
cobblemon.species.frosmoth.desc: It shows no mercy to any who desecrate fields and mountains. It will fly around on its icy wings, causing a blizzard to chase offenders away.
cobblemon.species.frosmoth.name: Frosmoth
cobblemon.species.fuecoco.desc: It lies on warm rocks and uses the heat absorbed by its square-shaped scales to create fire energy.
cobblemon.species.fuecoco.name: Fuecoco
cobblemon.species.furfrou.desc: Left alone, its fur will grow longer and longer, but it will only allow someone it trusts to cut it.
cobblemon.species.furfrou.name: Furfrou
cobblemon.species.furret.desc: Furret has a very slim build. When under attack, it can slickly squirm through narrow spaces and get away. In spite of its short limbs, this Pokémon is very nimble and fleet.
cobblemon.species.furret.name: Фуррет
cobblemon.species.gabite.desc: Though Gabite are usually of a violent disposition, when I gave one a glass bead it had been eyeing covetously, it suddenly became quite docile.
cobblemon.species.gabite.name: Gabite
cobblemon.species.gallade.desc: The blades extending from its elbows are sharper than the finest swords. Its swordsmanship, albeit self-taught, is astonishingly impressive.
cobblemon.species.gallade.name: Gallade
cobblemon.species.galvantula.desc: It lays traps of electrified threads near the nests of bird Pokémon, aiming to snare chicks that are not yet good at flying.
cobblemon.species.galvantula.name: Galvantula
cobblemon.species.garbodor.desc: The toxic liquid it launches from its right arm is so virulent that it can kill a weakened creature instantly.
cobblemon.species.garbodor.name: Garbodor
cobblemon.species.garchomp.desc: Soars across the heavens at blinding speed—a magnificent sight! It has a feral disposition. Utmost caution is required if one meets a Garchomp out in the wilds.
cobblemon.species.garchomp.name: Garchomp
cobblemon.species.gardevoir.desc: It will dedicate itself to defending a master it has come to adore. Its pure white dress, reminiscent of those worn by ladies of nobility, is the dress of one who is willing to risk their life.
cobblemon.species.gardevoir.name: Gardevoir
cobblemon.species.garganacl.desc: Garganacl will rub its fingertips together and sprinkle injured Pokémon with salt. Even severe wounds will promptly heal afterward.
cobblemon.species.garganacl.name: Garganacl
cobblemon.species.gastly.desc: Gaseous and completely impalpable. Also highly dangerous— inhaling part of its poisonous body will cause one to faint instantly.
cobblemon.species.gastly.name: Gastly
cobblemon.species.gastrodon.desc: Eats beach sand for nourishment. Should one Gastrodon encounter another of a different color, a fierce battle will inevitably ensue.
cobblemon.species.gastrodon.name: Gastrodon
cobblemon.species.genesect.desc: This Pokémon existed 300 million years ago. Team Plasma altered it and attached a cannon to its back.
cobblemon.species.genesect.name: Genesect
cobblemon.species.gengar.desc: Possesses potential victims' shadows in an effort to steal away the victims' lives. If your shadow begins to laugh, you must take hold of a protective charm posthaste!
cobblemon.species.gengar.name: Gengar
cobblemon.species.geodude.desc: Makes its home in mountainous regions, using its arms to climb along harsh mountain roads. Can be troublesome—carelessly kicking one will cause it to fly into a rage and chase after you.
cobblemon.species.geodude.name: Geodude
cobblemon.species.gholdengo.desc: Its body seems to be made up of 1,000 coins. This Pokémon gets along well with others and is quick to make friends with anybody.
cobblemon.species.gholdengo.name: Gholdengo
cobblemon.species.gible.desc: It nests in caves untouched by sunlight. Its sharp teeth may fall out when worn away or after an impact, but they regrow within a few days.
cobblemon.species.gible.name: Gible
cobblemon.species.gigalith.desc: Although its energy blasts can blow away a dump truck, they have a limitation— they can only be fired when the sun is out.
cobblemon.species.gigalith.name: Gigalith
cobblemon.species.gimmighoul.name: Gimmighoul
cobblemon.species.girafarig.desc: Girafarig's rear head contains a tiny brain that is too small for thinking. However, the rear head doesn't need to sleep, so it can keep watch over its surroundings 24 hours a day.
cobblemon.species.girafarig.name: Girafarig
cobblemon.species.giratina.desc: There is one Hisuian verse that tells of a powerful light creating a deep shadow. I imagine that this deep shadow is Giratina.
cobblemon.species.giratina.name: Giratina
cobblemon.species.glaceon.desc: Glaceon is able to lower its body temperature very quickly. It freezes the atmosphere, creating diamond dust that glitters like gems while it flutters and dances around.
cobblemon.species.glaceon.name: Glaceon
cobblemon.species.glalie.desc: It covers its body with an armor of ice harder than steel. Uses its breath to freeze prey, which it then devours as if they were frozen desserts.
cobblemon.species.glalie.name: Glalie
cobblemon.species.glameow.desc: Bewitches humans with its helical tail and piercing gaze. Its hidden claws are quite sharp as well, making this Pokémon an exceedingly tricky opponent if antagonized.
cobblemon.species.glameow.name: Glameow
cobblemon.species.glastrier.desc: Glastrier has tremendous physical strength, and the mask of ice covering its face is 100 times harder than diamond.
cobblemon.species.glastrier.name: Glastrier
cobblemon.species.gligar.desc: Its tail is tipped by a thick, horrible stinger. To bring down prey, it will first obscure their vision by covering their faces with its body, and then it will use the stinger to inject them with venom.
cobblemon.species.gligar.name: Gligar
cobblemon.species.glimmet.desc: It absorbs nutrients from cave walls. The petals it wears are made of crystallized poison.
cobblemon.species.glimmet.name: Glimmet
cobblemon.species.glimmora.desc: When this Pokémon detects danger, it will open up its crystalline petals and fire beams from its conical body.
cobblemon.species.glimmora.name: Glimmora
cobblemon.species.gliscor.desc: It glides soundlessly on pitch-black wings and sinks sharp fangs into the throat of its prey. It takes on a look of satisfaction once it has entirely drained its prey of blood.
cobblemon.species.gliscor.name: Gliscor
cobblemon.species.gloom.desc: What appears to be drool is actually sweet honey. It is very sticky and clings stubbornly if touched.
cobblemon.species.gloom.name: Gloom
cobblemon.species.gogoat.desc: They inhabit mountainous regions. The leader of the herd is decided by a battle of clashing horns.
cobblemon.species.gogoat.name: Gogoat
cobblemon.species.golbat.desc: It sinks its sharp fangs into other creatures and slurps up their blood. A closer look at the fangs reveals that they are hollow and akin to straws.
cobblemon.species.golbat.name: Golbat
cobblemon.species.goldeen.desc: Its dorsal and pectoral fins are strongly developed like muscles. It can swim at a speed of five knots.
cobblemon.species.goldeen.name: Goldeen
cobblemon.species.golduck.desc: Its body is strong, and it has webbing on its hands and feet. Golduck can swim easily through rough seas, clawing its way through the high waves.
cobblemon.species.golduck.name: Голдак
cobblemon.species.golem.desc: The rocklike shell is shed each year. The cast-off shell then crumbles, reverting to a mass of soil, which can be spread across fields to promote crop growth.
cobblemon.species.golem.name: Голем
cobblemon.species.golett.desc: This Pokémon was created from clay. It received orders from its master many thousands of years ago, and it still follows those orders to this day.
cobblemon.species.golett.name: Голетт
cobblemon.species.golisopod.desc: They live in sunken ships or in holes in the seabed. When Golisopod and Grapploct battle, the loser becomes the winner's meal.
cobblemon.species.golisopod.name: Голизопод
cobblemon.species.golurk.desc: There's a theory that inside Golurk is a perpetual motion machine that produces limitless energy, but this belief hasn't been proven.
cobblemon.species.golurk.name: Голорк
