cobblemon.species.goodra.desc: Способен свободно управлять твёрдостью своего металлического панциря. Не выносит одиночества и очень привязчив; впадает в ярость и бунтует, если самые дорогие ему люди покидают его.
cobblemon.species.goodra.name: Гудра
cobblemon.species.goomy.desc: Goomy hides away in the shade of trees, where it's nice and humid. If the slime coating its body dries out, the Pokémon instantly becomes lethargic.
cobblemon.species.goomy.name: Гуми
cobblemon.species.gorebyss.desc: It sucks bodily fluids out of its prey. The leftover meat sinks to the seafloor, where it becomes food for other Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.gorebyss.name: Gorebyss
cobblemon.species.gossifleur.desc: It whirls around in the wind while singing a joyous song. This delightful display has charmed many into raising this Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.gossifleur.name: Gossifleur
cobblemon.species.gothita.desc: Even when nobody seems to be around, Gothita can still be heard making a muted cry. Many believe it's speaking to something only it can see.
cobblemon.species.gothita.name: Gothita
cobblemon.species.gothitelle.desc: A criminal who was shown his fate by a Gothitelle went missing that same day and was never seen again.
cobblemon.species.gothitelle.name: Gothitelle
cobblemon.species.gothorita.desc: On nights when the stars shine, this Pokémon's psychic power is at its strongest. It's unknown just what link Gothorita has to the greater universe.
cobblemon.species.gothorita.name: Gothorita
cobblemon.species.gougingfire.desc: There are scant few reports of this creature being sighted. One short video shows it rampaging and spouting pillars of flame.
cobblemon.species.gougingfire.name: Gouging Fire
cobblemon.species.gourgeist.desc: In the darkness of a new-moon night, Gourgeist will come knocking. Whoever answers the door will be swept off to the afterlife.
cobblemon.species.gourgeist.name: Gourgeist
cobblemon.species.grafaiai.desc: The color of the poisonous saliva depends on what the Pokémon eats. Grafaiai covers its fingers in its saliva and draws patterns on trees in forests.
cobblemon.species.grafaiai.name: Grafaiai
cobblemon.species.granbull.desc: Although it's popular with young people, Granbull is timid and sensitive, so it's totally incompetent as a watchdog.
cobblemon.species.granbull.name: Granbull
cobblemon.species.grapploct.desc: Searching for an opponent to test its skills against, it emerges onto land. Once the battle is over, it returns to the sea.
cobblemon.species.grapploct.name: Grapploct
cobblemon.species.graveler.desc: Dwells in holes dug into sheer walls of stone. It enjoys rolling down slopes as though it were a boulder during a rockfall, so keep an eye upward while traversing mountain roads.
cobblemon.species.graveler.name: Graveler
cobblemon.species.greattusk.desc: Sightings of this Pokémon have occurred in recent years. The name Great Tusk was taken from a creature listed in a certain book.
cobblemon.species.greattusk.name: Great Tusk
cobblemon.species.greavard.desc: It is said that a dog Pokémon that died in the wild without ever interacting with a human was reborn as this Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.greavard.name: Greavard
cobblemon.species.greedent.desc: Common throughout the Galar region, this Pokémon has strong teeth and can chew through the toughest of berry shells.
cobblemon.species.greedent.name: Greedent
cobblemon.species.greninja.desc: It appears and vanishes with a ninja's grace. It toys with its enemies using swift movements, while slicing them with throwing stars of sharpest water.
cobblemon.species.greninja.name: Greninja
cobblemon.species.grimer.desc: Made of congealed sludge. It smells too putrid to touch. Even weeds won't grow in its path.
cobblemon.species.grimer.name: Grimer
cobblemon.species.grimmsnarl.desc: Its hairs work like muscle fibers. When its hairs unfurl, they latch on to opponents, ensnaring them as tentacles would.
cobblemon.species.grimmsnarl.name: Grimmsnarl
cobblemon.species.grookey.desc: It attacks with rapid beats of its stick. As it strikes with amazing speed, it gets more and more pumped.
cobblemon.species.grookey.name: Grookey
cobblemon.species.grotle.desc: Appears where there is clean spring water. The fruit that grows on the shrubs on its shell is sweet, nutritious, and truly delicious.
cobblemon.species.grotle.name: Grotle
cobblemon.species.groudon.desc: Through Primal Reversion and with nature's full power, it will take back its true form. It can cause magma to erupt and expand the landmass of the world.
cobblemon.species.groudon.name: Groudon
cobblemon.species.grovyle.desc: This Pokémon adeptly flies from branch to branch in trees. In a forest, no Pokémon can ever hope to catch a fleeing Grovyle however fast they may be.
cobblemon.species.grovyle.name: Grovyle
cobblemon.species.growlithe.desc: They patrol their territory in pairs. I believe the igneous rock components in the fur of this species are the result of volcanic activity in its habitat.
cobblemon.species.growlithe.name: Growlithe
cobblemon.species.grubbin.desc: It uses its big jaws to dig nests into the forest floor, and it loves to feed on sweet tree sap.
cobblemon.species.grubbin.name: Grubbin
cobblemon.species.grumpig.desc: Grumpig uses the black pearls on its body to wield its fantastic powers. When it is doing so, it dances bizarrely. This Pokémon's black pearls are valuable as works of art.
cobblemon.species.grumpig.name: Grumpig
cobblemon.species.gulpin.desc: Most of Gulpin's body is made up of its stomach—its heart and brain are very small in comparison. This Pokémon's stomach contains special enzymes that dissolve anything.
cobblemon.species.gulpin.name: Gulpin
cobblemon.species.gumshoos.desc: Patient by nature, this Pokémon loses control of itself and pounces when it spots its favorite meal—Rattata!
cobblemon.species.gumshoos.name: Gumshoos
cobblemon.species.gurdurr.desc: Gurdurr excels at demolition—construction is not its forte. In any case, there's skill in the way this Pokémon wields its metal beam.
cobblemon.species.gurdurr.name: Gurdurr
cobblemon.species.guzzlord.desc: An unknown life-form called a UB. It may be constantly hungry—it is certainly always devouring something.
cobblemon.species.guzzlord.name: Guzzlord
cobblemon.species.gyarados.desc: I suspect this Pokémon to be the true identity of a dragon written of in ancient texts, which claimed that it razed an entire village with white-hot beams from its maw.
cobblemon.species.gyarados.name: Gyarados
cobblemon.species.hakamoo.desc: Before attacking its enemies, it clashes its scales together and roars. Its sharp claws shred the opposition.
cobblemon.species.hakamoo.name: Hakamo-o
cobblemon.species.happiny.desc: In imitation of Chansey, it keeps a round stone tucked into its belly pouch and cherishes it dearly. It gets along well with children and will sometimes play house with them for fun.
cobblemon.species.happiny.name: Happiny
cobblemon.species.hariyama.desc: Hariyama that are big and fat aren't necessarily strong. There are some small ones that move nimbly and use moves skillfully.
cobblemon.species.hariyama.name: Hariyama
cobblemon.species.hatenna.desc: If this Pokémon senses a strong emotion, it will run away as fast as it can. It prefers areas without people.
cobblemon.species.hatenna.name: Hatenna
cobblemon.species.hatterene.desc: If you're too loud around it, you risk being torn apart by the claws on its tentacle. This Pokémon is also known as the Forest Witch.
cobblemon.species.hatterene.name: Hatterene
cobblemon.species.hattrem.desc: Using the braids on its head, it pummels foes to get them to quiet down. One blow from those braids would knock out a professional boxer.
cobblemon.species.hattrem.name: Hattrem
cobblemon.species.haunter.desc: This frightful, malevolent spirit can glide through walls, appearing wherever it likes. According to rumor, victims of a Haunter's lick will wither to death day by day.
cobblemon.species.haunter.name: Haunter
cobblemon.species.hawlucha.desc: It always strikes a pose before going for its finishing move. Sometimes opponents take advantage of that time to counterattack.
cobblemon.species.hawlucha.name: Hawlucha
cobblemon.species.haxorus.desc: While usually kindhearted, it can be terrifying if angered. Tusks that can slice through steel beams are how Haxorus deals with its adversaries.
cobblemon.species.haxorus.name: Haxorus
cobblemon.species.heatmor.desc: A flame serves as its tongue, melting through the hard shell of Durant so that Heatmor can devour their insides.
cobblemon.species.heatmor.name: Heatmor
cobblemon.species.heatran.desc: Stories tell of this Pokémon being birthed from the boiling magma within Mount Coronet. Its molten-steel body holds many mysteries.
cobblemon.species.heatran.name: Heatran
cobblemon.species.heliolisk.desc: One Heliolisk basking in the sun with its frill outspread is all it would take to produce enough electricity to power a city.
cobblemon.species.heliolisk.name: Heliolisk
cobblemon.species.helioptile.desc: The sun powers this Pokémon's electricity generation. Interruption of that process stresses Helioptile to the point of weakness.
cobblemon.species.helioptile.name: Helioptile
cobblemon.species.heracross.desc: This Pokémon has an unparalleled horn. Heracross itself demonstrates tremendous power—it's capable of throwing several people trained in the traditional arts of war at once.
cobblemon.species.heracross.name: Heracross
cobblemon.species.herdier.desc: The black fur that covers this Pokémon's body is dense and springy. Even sharp fangs bounce right off.
cobblemon.species.herdier.name: Herdier
cobblemon.species.hippopotas.desc: Though large and languid, Hippopotas is difficult to detect due to its tendency to burrow into and lurk beneath the soil. When agitated or excited, it expels sand from its nostrils.
cobblemon.species.hippopotas.name: Hippopotas
cobblemon.species.hippowdon.desc: Short-tempered and easily moved to violence. It whips up whirlwinds of sand to crush its foes' spirits, then goes in for the attack.
cobblemon.species.hippowdon.name: Hippowdon
cobblemon.species.hitmonchan.desc: Its punches slice the air. However, it seems to need a short break after fighting for three minutes.
cobblemon.species.hitmonchan.name: Hitmonchan
cobblemon.species.hitmonlee.desc: The legs freely contract and stretch. The stretchy legs allow it to hit a distant foe with a rising kick.
cobblemon.species.hitmonlee.name: Hitmonlee
cobblemon.species.hitmontop.desc: After doing a handstand to throw off the opponent's timing, it presents its fancy kick moves.
cobblemon.species.hitmontop.name: Hitmontop
cobblemon.species.honchkrow.desc: One cry from this Pokémon, and a murder of Murkrow come flying. At such times, one would think the curtain of night had fallen, plunging the world into jet-black darkness.
cobblemon.species.honchkrow.name: Honchkrow
cobblemon.species.honedge.desc: The blue eye on the sword's handguard is the true body of Honedge. With its old cloth, it drains people's lives away.
cobblemon.species.honedge.name: Honedge
cobblemon.species.hooh.desc: Ho-Oh's feathers glow in seven colors depending on the angle at which they are struck by light. These feathers are said to bring happiness to the bearers. This Pokémon is said to live at the foot of a rainbow.
cobblemon.species.hooh.name: Ho-Oh
cobblemon.species.hoopa.desc: It is said to be able to seize anything it desires with its six rings and six huge arms. With its power sealed, it is transformed into a much smaller form.
cobblemon.species.hoopa.name: Hoopa
cobblemon.species.hoothoot.desc: It begins to hoot at the same time every day. Some Trainers use them in place of clocks.
cobblemon.species.hoothoot.name: Hoothoot
cobblemon.species.hoppip.desc: This Pokémon drifts and floats with the wind. If it senses the approach of strong winds, Hoppip links its leaves with other Hoppip to prepare against being blown away.
cobblemon.species.hoppip.name: Hoppip
cobblemon.species.horsea.desc: They swim with dance-like motions and cause whirlpools to form. Horsea compete to see which of them can generate the biggest whirlpool.
cobblemon.species.horsea.name: Horsea
cobblemon.species.houndoom.desc: Identifiable by its eerie howls, people a long time ago thought it was the grim reaper and feared it.
cobblemon.species.houndoom.name: Houndoom
cobblemon.species.houndour.desc: They make repeated eerie howls before dawn to call attention to their pack.
cobblemon.species.houndour.name: Houndour
cobblemon.species.houndstone.desc: Houndstone spends most of its time sleeping in graveyards. Among all the dog Pokémon, this one is most loyal to its master.
cobblemon.species.houndstone.name: Houndstone
cobblemon.species.huntail.desc: Deep seas are their habitat. According to tradition, when Huntail wash up onshore, something unfortunate will happen.
cobblemon.species.huntail.name: Huntail
cobblemon.species.hydrapple.desc: Seven syrpents live inside an apple made of syrup. The syrpent in the center is the commander.
cobblemon.species.hydrapple.name: Hydrapple
cobblemon.species.hydreigon.desc: The three heads take turns sinking their teeth into the opponent. Their attacks won't slow until their target goes down.
cobblemon.species.hydreigon.name: Hydreigon
cobblemon.species.hypno.desc: Avoid eye contact if you come across one. It will try to put you to sleep by using its pendulum.
cobblemon.species.hypno.name: Hypno
cobblemon.species.igglybuff.desc: Taking advantage of the softness of its body, Igglybuff moves as if bouncing. Its body turns a deep pink when its temperature rises.
cobblemon.species.igglybuff.name: Igglybuff
cobblemon.species.illumise.desc: Illumise leads a flight of illuminated Volbeat to draw signs in the night sky. This Pokémon is said to earn greater respect from its peers by composing more complex designs in the sky.
cobblemon.species.illumise.name: Illumise
cobblemon.species.impidimp.desc: It sneaks into people's homes, stealing things and feasting on the negative energy of the frustrated occupants.
cobblemon.species.impidimp.name: Impidimp
cobblemon.species.incineroar.desc: Incineroar's rough and aggressive behavior is its most notable trait, but the way it helps out small Pokémon shows that it has a kind side as well.
cobblemon.species.incineroar.name: Incineroar
cobblemon.species.indeedee.desc: Through its horns, it can pick up on the emotions of creatures around it. Positive emotions are the source of its strength.
cobblemon.species.indeedee.name: Indeedee
cobblemon.species.infernape.desc: A tall, hardy Pokémon with a dazzling appearance. It shrouds itself in flame and battles as if engaged in dance—truly a sight to behold.
cobblemon.species.infernape.name: Infernape
cobblemon.species.inkay.desc: By exposing foes to the blinking of its luminescent spots, Inkay demoralizes them, and then it seizes the chance to flee.
cobblemon.species.inkay.name: Inkay
cobblemon.species.inteleon.desc: Its nictitating membranes let it pick out foes' weak points so it can precisely blast them with water that shoots from its fingertips at Mach 3.
cobblemon.species.inteleon.name: Inteleon
cobblemon.species.ironboulder.desc: It was named after a mysterious object recorded in an old book. Its body seems to be metallic.
cobblemon.species.ironboulder.name: Iron Boulder
cobblemon.species.ironbundle.desc: Its shape is similar to a robot featured in a paranormal magazine article. The robot was said to have been created by an ancient civilization.
cobblemon.species.ironbundle.name: Iron Bundle
cobblemon.species.ironcrown.desc: There was supposedly an incident in which it launched shining blades to cut everything around it to pieces. Little else is known about it.
cobblemon.species.ironcrown.name: Iron Crown
cobblemon.species.ironhands.desc: It is very similar to a cyborg covered exclusively by a paranormal magazine. The cyborg was said to be the modified form of a certain athlete.
cobblemon.species.ironhands.name: Iron Hands
cobblemon.species.ironjugulis.desc: It resembles a certain Pokémon introduced in a paranormal magazine, described as the offspring of a Hydreigon that fell in love with a robot.
cobblemon.species.ironjugulis.name: Iron Jugulis
cobblemon.species.ironleaves.name: Iron Leaves
cobblemon.species.ironmoth.desc: This Pokémon resembles an unknown object described in a paranormal magazine as a UFO sent to observe humanity.
cobblemon.species.ironmoth.name: Iron Moth
cobblemon.species.ironthorns.desc: It has some similarities to a Pokémon introduced in a dubious magazine as a Tyranitar from one billion years into the future.
cobblemon.species.ironthorns.name: Iron Thorns
cobblemon.species.irontreads.desc: This Pokémon closely resembles a scientific weapon that a paranormal magazine claimed was sent to this planet by aliens.
cobblemon.species.irontreads.name: Iron Treads
cobblemon.species.ironvaliant.desc: It has some similarities to a mad scientist's invention covered in a paranormal magazine.
cobblemon.species.ironvaliant.name: Iron Valiant
cobblemon.species.ivysaur.desc: Exposure to sunlight adds to its strength. Sunlight also makes the bud on its back grow larger.
cobblemon.species.ivysaur.name: Ivysaur
cobblemon.species.jangmoo.desc: Jangmo-o strikes its scales to communicate with others of its kind. Its scales are actually fur that's become as hard as metal.
cobblemon.species.jangmoo.name: Jangmo-o
cobblemon.species.jellicent.desc: Whenever a full moon hangs in the night sky, schools of Jellicent gather near the surface of the sea, waiting for their prey to appear.
cobblemon.species.jellicent.name: Jellicent
cobblemon.species.jigglypuff.desc: By freely changing the wavelength of its voice, Jigglypuff sings a mysterious melody sure to make any listener sleepy.
cobblemon.species.jigglypuff.name: Jigglypuff
cobblemon.species.jirachi.desc: It's believed that when this Pokémon wakes from its 1,000-year slumber, it will grant any wishes written on the notes attached to its head.
cobblemon.species.jirachi.name: Jirachi
cobblemon.species.jolteon.desc: Bristles its fur into sharp, needlelike points when enraged. One can hear electricity crackle in its breath when it exhales.
cobblemon.species.jolteon.name: Jolteon
cobblemon.species.joltik.desc: Joltik latch on to other Pokémon and suck out static electricity. They're often found sticking to Yamper's hindquarters.
cobblemon.species.joltik.name: Joltik
cobblemon.species.jumpluff.desc: Jumpluff rides warm southern winds to cross the sea and fly to foreign lands. The Pokémon descends to the ground when it encounters cold air while it is floating.
cobblemon.species.jumpluff.name: Jumpluff
cobblemon.species.jynx.desc: The Jynx of Galar often have beautiful and delicate voices. Some of these Pokémon have even gathered a fan base.
cobblemon.species.jynx.name: Jynx
cobblemon.species.kabuto.desc: While some say this species has gone extinct, Kabuto sightings are apparently fairly common in some places.
cobblemon.species.kabuto.name: Kabuto
cobblemon.species.kabutops.desc: The cause behind the extinction of this species is unknown. Kabutops were aggressive Pokémon that inhabited warm seas.
cobblemon.species.kabutops.name: Kabutops
cobblemon.species.kadabra.desc: There are rumors that a child with mystical powers became a Kadabra; however, this remains unverified. I suspect that the spoon Kadabra holds enhances its brain waves.
cobblemon.species.kadabra.name: Kadabra
cobblemon.species.kakuna.desc: Able to move only slightly. When endangered, it may stick out its stinger and poison its enemy.
cobblemon.species.kakuna.name: Kakuna
cobblemon.species.kangaskhan.desc: There are records of a lost human child being raised by a childless Kangaskhan.
cobblemon.species.kangaskhan.name: Kangaskhan
cobblemon.species.karrablast.desc: It spits a liquid from its mouth to melt through Shelmet's shell. Karrablast doesn't eat the shell— it eats only the contents.
cobblemon.species.karrablast.name: Karrablast
cobblemon.species.kartana.desc: Although it's alien to this world and a danger here, it's apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.
cobblemon.species.kartana.name: Kartana
cobblemon.species.kecleon.desc: Its color changes for concealment and also when its mood or health changes. The darker the color, the healthier it is.
cobblemon.species.kecleon.name: Kecleon
cobblemon.species.keldeo.desc: They say that Keldeo must survive harsh battles and fully develop the horn on its forehead before this Pokémon's true power will awaken.
cobblemon.species.keldeo.name: Keldeo
cobblemon.species.kilowattrel.desc: Kilowattrel inflates its throat sac to amplify its electricity. By riding the wind, this Pokémon can fly over 430 miles in a day.
cobblemon.species.kilowattrel.name: Kilowattrel
cobblemon.species.kingambit.desc: Only a Bisharp that stands above all others in its vast army can evolve into Kingambit.
cobblemon.species.kingambit.name: Kingambit
cobblemon.species.kingdra.desc: Scales shed by this Pokémon have such a splendorous gleam to them that they've been given to royalty as gifts.
cobblemon.species.kingdra.name: Kingdra
cobblemon.species.kingler.desc: Its oversized claw is very powerful, but when it's not in battle, the claw just gets in the way.
cobblemon.species.kingler.name: Kingler
cobblemon.species.kirlia.desc: It resembles a maiden in appearance, but it wields strange powers to project visions of paradise. I suspect the crimson ornaments on its head are the key to its abilities.
cobblemon.species.kirlia.name: Kirlia
cobblemon.species.klang.desc: Many companies in the Galar region choose Klang as their logo. This Pokémon is considered the symbol of industrial technology.
cobblemon.species.klang.name: Klang
cobblemon.species.klawf.desc: Klawf hangs upside-down from cliffs, waiting for prey. But Klawf can't remain in this position for long because its blood rushes to its head.
cobblemon.species.klawf.name: Klawf
cobblemon.species.kleavor.desc: A violent creature that fells towering trees with its crude axes and shields itself with hard stone. If one should chance upon this Pokémon in the wilds, one's only recourse is to flee.
cobblemon.species.kleavor.name: Kleavor
cobblemon.species.klefki.desc: Klefki sucks in metal ions with the horn topping its head. It seems this Pokémon loves keys so much that its head needed to look like one, too.
cobblemon.species.klefki.name: Klefki
cobblemon.species.klink.desc: It's suspected that Klink were the inspiration behind ancient people's invention of the first gears.
cobblemon.species.klink.name: Klink
cobblemon.species.klinklang.desc: The three gears that compose this Pokémon spin at high speed. Its new spiked gear isn't a living creature.
cobblemon.species.klinklang.name: Klinklang
cobblemon.species.koffing.desc: It adores polluted air. Some claim that Koffing used to be more plentiful in the Galar region than they are now.
cobblemon.species.koffing.name: Koffing
cobblemon.species.komala.desc: It remains asleep from birth to death as a result of the sedative properties of the leaves that form its diet.
cobblemon.species.komala.name: Komala
cobblemon.species.kommoo.desc: Certain ruins have paintings of ancient warriors wearing armor made of Kommo-o scales.
cobblemon.species.kommoo.name: Kommo-o
cobblemon.species.koraidon.name: Koraidon
cobblemon.species.krabby.desc: If it senses danger approaching, it cloaks itself with bubbles from its mouth so it will look bigger.
cobblemon.species.krabby.name: Krabby
cobblemon.species.kricketot.desc: When the trees take on new hues, more of these Pokémon appear. The tone they create by striking their antennae together resembles that of the marimba, an instrument of foreign lands.
cobblemon.species.kricketot.name: Kricketot
cobblemon.species.kricketune.desc: It uses its cutlass-like arms to produce sound, the melody of which varies from individual to individual. It is a worthwhile endeavor to seek out one's favorite tunes.
cobblemon.species.kricketune.name: Kricketune
cobblemon.species.krokorok.desc: Although this Pokémon has specialized eyes that allow it to see in the dark, Krokorok won't move much at night—the desert gets cold after sunset.
cobblemon.species.krokorok.name: Krokorok
cobblemon.species.krookodile.desc: While terribly aggressive, Krookodile also has the patience to stay hidden under sand for days, lying in wait for prey.
cobblemon.species.krookodile.name: Krookodile
cobblemon.species.kubfu.desc: If Kubfu pulls the long white hair on its head, its fighting spirit heightens and power wells up from the depths of its belly.
cobblemon.species.kubfu.name: Kubfu
cobblemon.species.kyogre.desc: Kyogre is said to be the personification of the sea itself. Legends tell of its many clashes against Groudon, as each sought to gain the power of nature.
cobblemon.species.kyogre.name: Kyogre
cobblemon.species.kyurem.desc: It appears that this Pokémon uses its powers over ice to freeze its own body in order to stabilize its cellular structure.
cobblemon.species.kyurem.name: Kyurem
cobblemon.species.lairon.desc: During territorial disputes, Lairon fight by slamming into each other. Close inspection of their steel armor reveals scratches and dents.
cobblemon.species.lairon.name: Lairon
cobblemon.species.lampent.desc: It lurks in cities, pretending to be a lamp. Once it finds someone whose death is near, it will trail quietly after them.
cobblemon.species.lampent.name: Lampent
cobblemon.species.landorus.desc: When the incarnations of wind and of lightning clash, Landorus arrives to quell the conflict. After the tempests and thunderbolts abate, the land is sure to be blessed with bountiful harvests.
cobblemon.species.landorus.name: Landorus
cobblemon.species.lanturn.desc: This Pokémon flashes a bright light that blinds its prey. This creates an opening for it to deliver an electrical attack.
cobblemon.species.lanturn.name: Lanturn
cobblemon.species.lapras.desc: Crossing icy seas is no issue for this cold-resistant Pokémon. Its smooth skin is a little cool to the touch.
cobblemon.species.lapras.name: Lapras
cobblemon.species.larvesta.desc: Larvesta's body is warm all over. It spouts fire from the tips of its horns to intimidate predators and scare prey.
cobblemon.species.larvesta.name: Larvesta
cobblemon.species.larvitar.desc: It feeds on soil. After it has eaten a large mountain, it will fall asleep so it can grow.
cobblemon.species.larvitar.name: Larvitar
cobblemon.species.latias.desc: Latias is highly intelligent and capable of understanding human speech. It is covered with a glass-like down. The Pokémon enfolds its body with its down and refracts light to alter its appearance.
cobblemon.species.latias.name: Latias
cobblemon.species.latios.desc: Latios will only open its heart to a Trainer with a compassionate spirit. This Pokémon can fly faster than a jet plane by folding its forelegs to minimize air resistance.
cobblemon.species.latios.name: Latios
cobblemon.species.leafeon.desc: Cells similar to those of plants have been found in its fur. Its hard tail can fell a large tree with one stroke, and the tail's sharpness exceeds even that of a sword crafted by a master.
cobblemon.species.leafeon.name: Leafeon
cobblemon.species.leavanny.desc: It keeps its eggs warm with heat from fermenting leaves. It also uses leaves to make warm wrappings for Sewaddle.
cobblemon.species.leavanny.name: Leavanny
cobblemon.species.lechonk.desc: Он всеми днями ищет пищу. Имеет острое обоняние, но использует лишь ради добычи пищи.
cobblemon.species.lechonk.name: Лечонк
cobblemon.species.ledian.desc: It flies through the night sky, sprinkling sparkly dust. According to some, if that dust sticks to you, good things will happen to you.
cobblemon.species.ledian.name: Ledian
cobblemon.species.ledyba.desc: These very cowardly Pokémon join together and use Reflect to protect their nest.
cobblemon.species.ledyba.name: Ledyba
cobblemon.species.lickilicky.desc: Its tongue can extend and contract freely, and it is capable of reaching lengths over 10 times Lickilicky's height. Beware of the saliva, as it contains corrosive elements.
cobblemon.species.lickilicky.name: Lickilicky
cobblemon.species.lickitung.desc: Wields its long tongue deftly, as though it were an arm. The Pokémon's viscous saliva, once it has been collected and boiled down, yields a strong and highly useful adhesive.
cobblemon.species.lickitung.name: Lickitung
cobblemon.species.liepard.desc: This stealthy Pokémon sneaks up behind prey without making any sound at all. It competes with Thievul for territory.
cobblemon.species.liepard.name: Liepard
cobblemon.species.lileep.desc: Lileep clings to rocks on the seabed. When prey comes close, this Pokémon entangles it with petallike tentacles.
cobblemon.species.lileep.name: Lileep
cobblemon.species.lilligant.desc: I suspect that its well-developed legs are the result of a life spent on mountains covered in deep snow. The scent it exudes from its flower crown heartens those in proximity.
cobblemon.species.lilligant.name: Lilligant
cobblemon.species.lillipup.desc: This Pokémon is far brighter than the average child, and Lillipup won't forget the love it receives or any abuse it suffers.
cobblemon.species.lillipup.name: Lillipup
cobblemon.species.linoone.desc: It uses its explosive speed and razor-sharp claws to bring down prey. Running along winding paths is not its strong suit.
cobblemon.species.linoone.name: Linoone
cobblemon.species.litleo.desc: This hot-blooded Pokémon is filled with curiosity. When it gets angry or starts fighting, its short mane gets hot.
cobblemon.species.litleo.name: Litleo
cobblemon.species.litten.desc: Trying to pet Litten before it trusts you will result in a nasty scratch from its sharp claws. Be careful.
cobblemon.species.litten.name: Litten
cobblemon.species.litwick.desc: The younger the life this Pokémon absorbs, the brighter and eerier the flame on its head burns.
cobblemon.species.litwick.name: Литвик
cobblemon.species.lokix.desc: Когда он решает сражаться на полную, он встаёт на свои ранее сложенные ноги, переходя в режим схватки. Таким образом он быстро нейтрализует своих врагов.
cobblemon.species.lokix.name: Lokix
cobblemon.species.lombre.desc: It lives at the water's edge where it is sunny. It sleeps on a bed of water grass by day and becomes active at night.
cobblemon.species.lombre.name: Lombre
cobblemon.species.lopunny.desc: Its fur is warm and yet remarkably light. This Pokémon kicks as though it were a master of karate, driving back its opponents with ease.
cobblemon.species.lopunny.name: Lopunny
cobblemon.species.lotad.desc: Its leaf grew too large for it to live on land. That is how it began to live floating in the water.
cobblemon.species.lotad.name: Lotad
cobblemon.species.loudred.desc: The force of this Pokémon's loud voice isn't just the sound—it's also the wave of air pressure that blows opponents away and damages them.
cobblemon.species.loudred.name: Loudred
cobblemon.species.lucario.desc: A most gallant-looking creature. It emits energy waves and controls them with precision, using them to sense even faraway beings. I have given the name «aura» to this power.
cobblemon.species.lucario.name: Lucario
cobblemon.species.ludicolo.desc: If it hears festive music, it begins moving in rhythm in order to amplify its power.
cobblemon.species.ludicolo.name: Ludicolo
cobblemon.species.lugia.desc: Lugia's wings pack devastating power—a light fluttering of its wings can blow apart regular houses. As a result, this Pokémon chooses to live out of sight deep under the sea.
cobblemon.species.lugia.name: Lugia
cobblemon.species.lumineon.desc: Uses its gleaming fins to hunt its prey. The view of Lumineon schooling near the surface of the sea at night is breathtaking— it's as though there were shining stars right there.
cobblemon.species.lumineon.name: Lumineon
cobblemon.species.lunala.desc: It steals the light from its surroundings and then becomes the full moon, showering its own light across the night sky.
cobblemon.species.lunala.name: Lunala
cobblemon.species.lunatone.desc: It was discovered at the site of a meteor strike 40 years ago. Its stare can lull its foes to sleep.
cobblemon.species.lunatone.name: Lunatone
cobblemon.species.lurantis.desc: The petals on this Pokémon's arms are thin and super sharp, and they can fire laser beams if Lurantis gathers light first.
cobblemon.species.lurantis.name: Lurantis
cobblemon.species.luvdisc.desc: Luvdisc makes its home in coral reefs in warm seas. It especially likes sleeping in the space between Corsola's branches.
cobblemon.species.luvdisc.name: Luvdisc
cobblemon.species.luxio.desc: Proudly uses its electrified claws as weapons. It seems to be a gracious Pokémon, evenly sharing the spoils of the hunt with others of its kind.
cobblemon.species.luxio.name: Luxio
cobblemon.species.luxray.desc: They form packs, each having one male as leader. Legends say that when Luxray's two eyes shimmer with gold, the Pokémon can see through anything.
cobblemon.species.luxray.name: Luxray
cobblemon.species.lycanroc.desc: With swift movements, this Pokémon gradually backs its prey into a corner. Lycanroc's fangs are always aimed toward opponents' weak spots.
cobblemon.species.lycanroc.name: Lycanroc
cobblemon.species.mabosstiff.desc: This Pokémon can store energy in its large dewlap. Mabosstiff unleashes this energy all at once to blow away enemies.
cobblemon.species.mabosstiff.name: Mabosstiff
cobblemon.species.machamp.desc: In close combat, its four arms afford it offensive and defensive supremacy. In but a blink, this valiant Pokémon can overwhelm its foes with more than 1,000 blows from its fists.
cobblemon.species.machamp.name: Machamp
cobblemon.species.machoke.desc: A sturdy creature boasting a robust physique and boundless stamina. Loves training above all else and voluntarily assists with tasks such as construction and clearing land.
cobblemon.species.machoke.name: Machoke
cobblemon.species.machop.desc: Though as small as a child, it has strength enough to easily throw a well-built adult. Striving to become ever stronger, Machop trains by carrying a Graveler on its shoulders.
cobblemon.species.machop.name: Machop
cobblemon.species.magby.desc: This Pokémon lives in volcanic areas. With each breath, sparks spurt from its mouth and nose. When Magby is in good health, its flames gain a yellow tint.
cobblemon.species.magby.name: Magby
cobblemon.species.magcargo.desc: Magcargo's body temperature is approximately 18,000 degrees Fahrenheit. Water is vaporized on contact. If this Pokémon is caught in the rain, the raindrops instantly turn into steam, cloaking the area in a thick fog.
cobblemon.species.magcargo.name: Magcargo
cobblemon.species.magearna.desc: Built roughly 500 years ago by a scientist, the part called the Soul-Heart is the actual life-form.
cobblemon.species.magearna.name: Magearna
cobblemon.species.magikarp.desc: A feeble, pitiful imbecile of a Pokémon that is nonetheless very hardy. Unperturbed by turbid water, it can be found living in all sorts of places.
cobblemon.species.magikarp.name: Magikarp
cobblemon.species.magmar.desc: Legend has it that this Pokémon was born from the crater of a volcano. When wounded, it bathes in lava to heal its body, much as one would soak in a hot spring.
cobblemon.species.magmar.name: Magmar
cobblemon.species.magmortar.desc: Use of a strange item caused this Pokémon to evolve. Fireballs launched from the ends of its tubelike arms are hot enough to melt an iron pot in an instant.
cobblemon.species.magmortar.name: Magmortar
cobblemon.species.magnemite.desc: A bizarre Pokémon with but a single eye embedded in an iron sphere. I suspect this creature levitates due to the magnetism it emits from its arms, which resemble horseshoe-shaped magnets.
cobblemon.species.magnemite.name: Magnemite
cobblemon.species.magneton.desc: Three Magnemite gathered to evolve into this Pokémon. The source of much vexation on my part, as its powerful magnetism destroys my research equipment.
cobblemon.species.magneton.name: Magneton
cobblemon.species.magnezone.desc: I theorize that a special magnetic field influenced this Pokémon, changing its molecular structure and causing it to evolve. It emits strange radio waves toward space from its antenna.
cobblemon.species.magnezone.name: Magnezone
cobblemon.species.makuhita.desc: There's a rumor of a traditional recipe for stew that Trainers can use to raise strong Makuhita.
cobblemon.species.makuhita.name: Makuhita
cobblemon.species.malamar.desc: It's said that Malamar's hypnotic powers played a role in certain history-changing events.
cobblemon.species.malamar.name: Malamar
cobblemon.species.mamoswine.desc: This species reached its zenith during the period known as the ice age. I suspect that Hisui's frigid climate is in harmony with Mamoswine's constitution, thus awakening hidden potential.
cobblemon.species.mamoswine.name: Mamoswine
cobblemon.species.manaphy.desc: Rumored to migrate across the oceans and visit Hisui's coastal waters only rarely. Although Manaphy resembles Phione, it is also quite different. The relation between the two is unclear.
cobblemon.species.manaphy.name: Manaphy
cobblemon.species.mandibuzz.desc: They adorn themselves with bones. There seem to be fashion trends among them, as different bones come into and fall out of popularity.
cobblemon.species.mandibuzz.name: Mandibuzz
cobblemon.species.manectric.desc: It rarely appears before people. It is said to nest where lightning has fallen.
cobblemon.species.manectric.name: Manectric
cobblemon.species.mankey.desc: Проворный покемон, живущий на деревьях. Его легко разозлить, и он без колебаний атакует всё, что угодно.
cobblemon.species.mankey.name: Манки
cobblemon.species.mantine.desc: This calm and gentle Pokémon swims gracefully through the sea. After building speed, it can leap out of the water. It is often misidentified as a bird Pokémon due to this behavior.
cobblemon.species.mantine.name: Mantine
cobblemon.species.mantyke.desc: Though ball-like in shape, this Pokémon is a proficient swimmer. I have discovered that if a Mantyke spends much time with schools of Remoraid, it will eventually achieve evolution.
cobblemon.species.mantyke.name: Mantyke
cobblemon.species.maractus.desc: Once each year, this Pokémon scatters its seeds. They're jam-packed with nutrients, making them a precious food source out in the desert.
cobblemon.species.maractus.name: Maractus
cobblemon.species.mareanie.desc: Unlike their Alolan counterparts, the Mareanie of the Galar region have not yet figured out that the branches of Corsola are delicious.
cobblemon.species.mareanie.name: Mareanie
cobblemon.species.mareep.desc: Rubbing its fleece generates electricity. You'll want to pet it because it's cute, but if you use your bare hand, you'll get a painful shock.
cobblemon.species.mareep.name: Mareep
cobblemon.species.marill.desc: Even after Marill swims in a cold sea, its water- repellent fur dries almost as soon as Marill leaves the water. That's why this Pokémon is never cold.
cobblemon.species.marill.name: Marill
cobblemon.species.marowak.desc: When this Pokémon evolved, the skull of its mother fused to it. Marowak's temperament also turned vicious at the same time.
cobblemon.species.marowak.name: Marowak
cobblemon.species.marshadow.desc: This Pokémon can conceal itself in any shadow, so it went undiscovered for a long time.
cobblemon.species.marshadow.name: Marshadow
cobblemon.species.marshtomp.desc: Marshtomp is much faster at traveling through mud than it is at swimming. This Pokémon's hindquarters exhibit obvious development, giving it the ability to walk on just its hind legs.
cobblemon.species.marshtomp.name: Marshtomp
cobblemon.species.maschiff.desc: It always scowls in an attempt to make opponents take it seriously, but even crying children will burst into laughter when they see Maschiff's face.
cobblemon.species.maschiff.name: Maschiff
cobblemon.species.masquerain.desc: Its thin, winglike antennae are highly absorbent. It waits out rainy days in tree hollows.
cobblemon.species.masquerain.name: Masquerain
cobblemon.species.maushold.name: Maushold
cobblemon.species.mawile.desc: It chomps with its gaping mouth. Its huge jaws are actually steel horns that have been transformed.
cobblemon.species.mawile.name: Mawile
cobblemon.species.medicham.desc: Through the power of meditation, Medicham developed its sixth sense. It gained the ability to use psychokinetic powers. This Pokémon is known to meditate for a whole month without eating.
cobblemon.species.medicham.name: Medicham
cobblemon.species.meditite.desc: Meditite heightens its inner energy through meditation. It survives on just one berry a day. Minimal eating is another aspect of this Pokémon's training.
cobblemon.species.meditite.name: Meditite
cobblemon.species.meganium.desc: The fragrance of Meganium's flower soothes and calms emotions. In battle, this Pokémon gives off more of its becalming scent to blunt the foe's fighting spirit.
cobblemon.species.meganium.name: Meganium
cobblemon.species.melmetal.desc: Centrifugal force is behind the punches of Melmetal's heavy hex-nut arms. Melmetal is said to deliver the strongest punches of all Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.melmetal.name: Melmetal
cobblemon.species.meloetta.desc: Its melodies are sung with a special vocalization method that can control the feelings of those who hear it.
cobblemon.species.meloetta.name: Meloetta
cobblemon.species.meltan.desc: They live as a group, but when the time comes, one strong Meltan will absorb all the others and evolve.
cobblemon.species.meltan.name: Meltan
cobblemon.species.meowscarada.desc: Этот покемон использует светоотражающый мех своего плаща, чтобы замаскировать стебель своего цветка, создавая иллюзию, что цветок парит в воздухе
cobblemon.species.meowscarada.name: Мяускарада
cobblemon.species.meowstic.desc: The defensive instinct of the males is strong. It's when they're protecting themselves or their partners that they unleash their full power.
cobblemon.species.meowstic.name: Meowstic
cobblemon.species.meowth.desc: It loves to collect shiny things. If it's in a good mood, it might even let its Trainer have a look at its hoard of treasures.
cobblemon.species.meowth.name: Meowth
cobblemon.species.mesprit.desc: Known as the Being of Emotion. In legend, this Pokémon was feared, as any who showed disrespect would have their emotions thrown into disarray.
cobblemon.species.mesprit.name: Mesprit
cobblemon.species.metagross.desc: Metagross is the result of the fusion of two Metang. This Pokémon defeats its opponents through use of its supercomputer-level brain.
cobblemon.species.metagross.name: Metagross
cobblemon.species.metang.desc: Using magnetic forces to stay aloft, this Pokémon flies at high speeds, weaving through harsh mountain terrain in pursuit of prey.
cobblemon.species.metang.name: Metang
cobblemon.species.metapod.desc: Even though it is encased in a sturdy shell, the body inside is tender. It can't withstand a harsh attack.
cobblemon.species.metapod.name: Metapod
cobblemon.species.mew.desc: When viewed through a microscope, this Pokémon's short, fine, delicate hair can be seen.
cobblemon.species.mew.name: Mew
cobblemon.species.mewtwo.desc: Its DNA is almost the same as Mew's. However, its size and disposition are vastly different.
cobblemon.species.mewtwo.name: Mewtwo
cobblemon.species.mienfoo.desc: Though small, Mienfoo's temperament is fierce. Any creature that approaches Mienfoo carelessly will be greeted with a flurry of graceful attacks.
cobblemon.species.mienfoo.name: Mienfoo
cobblemon.species.mienshao.desc: Delivered at blinding speeds, kicks from this Pokémon can shatter massive boulders into tiny pieces.
cobblemon.species.mienshao.name: Mienshao
cobblemon.species.mightyena.desc: Mightyena travel and act as a pack in the wild. The memory of its life in the wild compels the Pokémon to obey only those Trainers that it recognizes to possess superior skill.
cobblemon.species.mightyena.name: Mightyena
cobblemon.species.milcery.desc: They say that any patisserie visited by Milcery is guaranteed success and good fortune.
cobblemon.species.milcery.name: Milcery
cobblemon.species.milotic.desc: It's said that a glimpse of a Milotic and its beauty will calm any hostile emotions you're feeling.
cobblemon.species.milotic.name: Milotic
cobblemon.species.miltank.desc: This Pokémon needs to be milked every day, or else it will fall ill. The flavor of Miltank milk changes with the seasons.
cobblemon.species.miltank.name: Miltank
cobblemon.species.mimejr.desc: Known to turn up in bustling marketplaces now and again. It mimics people much as a child would, then watches how they react, eyes sparkling.
cobblemon.species.mimejr.name: Mime Jr.
cobblemon.species.mimikyu.desc: There was a scientist who peeked under Mimikyu's old rag in the name of research. The scientist died of a mysterious disease.
cobblemon.species.mimikyu.name: Mimikyu
cobblemon.species.minccino.desc: They pet each other with their tails as a form of greeting. Of the two, the one whose tail is fluffier is a bit more boastful.
cobblemon.species.minccino.name: Minccino
cobblemon.species.minior.desc: Although its outer shell is uncommonly durable, the shock of falling to the ground smashes the shell to smithereens.
cobblemon.species.minior.name: Minior
cobblemon.species.minun.desc: Minun loves to cheer on its partner in battle. It gives off sparks from its body while it is doing so. If its partner is in trouble, this Pokémon gives off increasing amounts of sparks.
cobblemon.species.minun.name: Minun
cobblemon.species.miraidon.name: Miraidon
cobblemon.species.misdreavus.desc: It conceals itself in darkness, sending chills up travelers' spines with its childlike weeping. As it observes the frightened travelers with glee, the red orbs upon its chest let off an eerie light.
cobblemon.species.misdreavus.name: Misdreavus
cobblemon.species.mismagius.desc: The incantations Mismagius chants can ward against misfortune, so a custom exists of inviting it into one's home. Incur the Pokémon's displeasure, however, and disaster will surely ensue.
cobblemon.species.mismagius.name: Mismagius
cobblemon.species.moltres.desc: There are stories of this Pokémon using its radiant, flame-cloaked wings to light up paths for those lost in the mountains.
cobblemon.species.moltres.name: Moltres
cobblemon.species.monferno.desc: The deeper the blue on its face, the more powerful it will grow to become. It leaps about every which way and lands powerful blows against its opponents with the flame on its tail.
cobblemon.species.monferno.name: Monferno
cobblemon.species.morelull.desc: Morelull live in forests that stay dark even during the day. They scatter flickering spores that put enemies to sleep.
cobblemon.species.morelull.name: Morelull
cobblemon.species.morgrem.desc: With sly cunning, it tries to lure people into the woods. Some believe it to have the power to make crops grow.
cobblemon.species.morgrem.name: Morgrem
cobblemon.species.morpeko.desc: It carries electrically roasted seeds with it as if they're precious treasures. No matter how much it eats, it always gets hungry again in short order.
cobblemon.species.morpeko.name: Morpeko
cobblemon.species.mothim.desc: Scatters steel-colored scales as it flaps its wings. Despite being observed feeding primarily on the nectar of flowers, Mothim is not often seen around flower gardens.
cobblemon.species.mothim.name: Mothim
cobblemon.species.mrmime.desc: The behavior of this clown-like Pokémon reminds one of pantomime. It creates invisible walls using a force emitted from its fingertips.
cobblemon.species.mrmime.name: Mr. Mime
cobblemon.species.mrrime.desc: Its amusing movements make it very popular. It releases its psychic power from the pattern on its belly.
cobblemon.species.mrrime.name: Mr. Rime
cobblemon.species.mudbray.desc: It eats dirt to create mud and smears this mud all over its feet, giving them the grip needed to walk on rough terrain without slipping.
cobblemon.species.mudbray.name: Mudbray
cobblemon.species.mudkip.desc: In water, Mudkip breathes using the gills on its cheeks. If it is faced with a tight situation in battle, this Pokémon will unleash its amazing power—it can crush rocks bigger than itself.
cobblemon.species.mudkip.name: Mudkip
cobblemon.species.mudsdale.desc: Mudsdale has so much stamina that it could carry over 10 tons across the Galar region without rest or sleep.
cobblemon.species.mudsdale.name: Mudsdale
cobblemon.species.muk.desc: Smells so awful, it can cause fainting. Through degeneration of its nose, it lost its sense of smell.
cobblemon.species.muk.name: Muk
cobblemon.species.munchlax.desc: Its robust stomach allows it to nonchalantly devour even rotted matter. It pays frequent visits to villages, seeking out food scraps intended for compost.
cobblemon.species.munchlax.name: Munchlax
cobblemon.species.munkidori.desc: The chain is made from toxins that enhance capabilities. It stimulated Munkidori's brain and caused the Pokémon's psychic powers to bloom.
cobblemon.species.munkidori.name: Munkidori
cobblemon.species.munna.desc: It eats dreams and releases mist. The mist is pink when it's eating a good dream, and black when it's eating a nightmare.
cobblemon.species.munna.name: Munna
cobblemon.species.murkrow.desc: Widely shunned as a bearer of ill fortune. Upon crossing paths with this creature, I've been told one must chant «Workrum, Workrum—bad luck, don't come» as a protective incantation.
cobblemon.species.murkrow.name: Murkrow
cobblemon.species.musharna.desc: It drowses and dreams all the time. It's best to leave it be if it's just woken up, as it's a terrible grump when freshly roused from sleep.
cobblemon.species.musharna.name: Musharna
cobblemon.species.nacli.desc: It was born in a layer of rock salt deep under the earth. This species was particularly treasured in the old days, as they would share precious salt.
cobblemon.species.nacli.name: Nacli
cobblemon.species.naclstack.desc: This Pokémon dry cures its prey by spraying salt over them. The curing process steals away the water in the prey's body.
cobblemon.species.naclstack.name: Naclstack
cobblemon.species.naganadel.desc: One kind of Ultra Beast, it fires a glowing, venomous liquid from its needles. This liquid is also immensely adhesive.
cobblemon.species.naganadel.name: Naganadel
cobblemon.species.natu.desc: Because its wings aren't yet fully grown, it has to hop to get around. It is always staring at something.
cobblemon.species.natu.name: Natu
cobblemon.species.necrozma.desc: It needs light to survive, and it goes on a rampage seeking it out. Its laser beams will cut anything to pieces.
cobblemon.species.necrozma.name: Necrozma
cobblemon.species.nickit.desc: Cunning and cautious, this Pokémon survives by stealing food from others. It erases its tracks with swipes of its tail as it makes off with its plunder.
cobblemon.species.nickit.name: Nickit
cobblemon.species.nidoking.desc: Nidoking prides itself on its strength. It's forceful and spirited in battle, making use of its thick tail and diamond-crushing horn.
cobblemon.species.nidoking.name: Nidoking
cobblemon.species.nidoqueen.desc: It pacifies offspring by placing them in the gaps between the spines on its back. The spines will never secrete poison while young are present.
cobblemon.species.nidoqueen.name: Nidoqueen
cobblemon.species.nidoranf.desc: It uses its hard incisor teeth to crush and eat berries. The tip of a female Nidoran's horn is a bit more rounded than the tip of a male's horn.
cobblemon.species.nidoranf.name: Nidoran
cobblemon.species.nidoranm.desc: Small but brave, this Pokémon will hold its ground and even risk its life in battle to protect the female it's friendly with.
cobblemon.species.nidoranm.name: Nidoran
cobblemon.species.nidorina.desc: If the group is threatened, these Pokémon will band together to assault enemies with a chorus of ultrasonic waves.
cobblemon.species.nidorina.name: Nidorina
cobblemon.species.nidorino.desc: It's nervous and quick to act aggressively. The potency of its poison increases along with the level of adrenaline present in its body.
cobblemon.species.nidorino.name: Nidorino
cobblemon.species.nihilego.desc: It appeared in this world from an Ultra Wormhole. Nihilego appears to be a parasite that lives by feeding on people and Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.nihilego.name: Nihilego
cobblemon.species.nincada.desc: It can sometimes live underground for more than 10 years. It absorbs nutrients from the roots of trees.
cobblemon.species.nincada.name: Nincada
cobblemon.species.ninetales.desc: The coat of gleaming golden fur is quite magnificent. This species is said to store sacred power in its nine long tails and to live for a millennium.
cobblemon.species.ninetales.name: Ninetales
cobblemon.species.ninjask.desc: This Pokémon is so quick, it is said to be able to avoid any attack. It loves to feed on tree sap.
cobblemon.species.ninjask.name: Ninjask
cobblemon.species.noctowl.desc: When it needs to think, it rotates its head 180 degrees to sharpen its intellectual power.
cobblemon.species.noctowl.name: Noctowl
cobblemon.species.noibat.desc: No wavelength of sound is beyond Noibat's ability to produce. The ultrasonic waves it generates can overcome much larger Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.noibat.name: Noibat
cobblemon.species.noivern.desc: Flying through the darkness, it weakens enemies with ultrasonic waves that could crush stone. Its fangs finish the fight.
cobblemon.species.noivern.name: Noivern
cobblemon.species.nosepass.desc: Once the people of Hisui discovered that its red nose always points north, they grew to rely on it greatly when traveling afar. The nose seems to work in a similar way to ancient compasses.
cobblemon.species.nosepass.name: Nosepass
cobblemon.species.numel.desc: Numel stores magma of almost 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit within its body. If it gets wet, the magma cools and hardens. In that event, the Pokémon's body grows heavy and its movements become sluggish.
cobblemon.species.numel.name: Numel
cobblemon.species.nuzleaf.desc: They live in holes bored in large trees. The sound of Nuzleaf's grass flute fills listeners with dread.
cobblemon.species.nuzleaf.name: Nuzleaf
cobblemon.species.nymble.desc: It has its third set of legs folded up. When it's in a tough spot, this Pokémon jumps over 30 feet using the strength of its legs.
cobblemon.species.nymble.name: Nymble
cobblemon.species.obstagoon.desc: It evolved after experiencing numerous fights. While crossing its arms, it lets out a shout that would make any opponent flinch.
cobblemon.species.obstagoon.name: Obstagoon
cobblemon.species.octillery.desc: While Octillery still shoots water from its mouth, the drastic anatomical difference between it and Remoraid meant that for a long time, no one believed the former evolved from the latter.
cobblemon.species.octillery.name: Octillery
cobblemon.species.oddish.desc: During the day, it stays in the cold underground to avoid the sun. It grows by bathing in moonlight.
cobblemon.species.oddish.name: Oddish
cobblemon.species.ogerpon.desc: This Pokémon's type changes based on which mask it's wearing. It confounds its enemies with nimble movements and kicks.
cobblemon.species.ogerpon.name: Ogerpon
cobblemon.species.oinkologne.name: Oinkologne
cobblemon.species.okidogi.desc: After all its muscles were stimulated by the toxic chain around its neck, Okidogi transformed and gained a powerful physique.
cobblemon.species.okidogi.name: Okidogi
cobblemon.species.omanyte.desc: This Pokémon is a member of an ancient, extinct species. Omanyte paddles through water with its 10 tentacles, looking like it's just drifting along.
cobblemon.species.omanyte.name: Omanyte
cobblemon.species.omastar.desc: Omastar's sharp fangs could crush rock, but the Pokémon can attack only the prey that come within reach of its tentacles.
cobblemon.species.omastar.name: Omastar
cobblemon.species.onix.desc: This chain of immense stones resembles a giant serpent. Tremors shake the earth above as it burrows deep beneath the ground, feeding on boulders as it goes.
cobblemon.species.onix.name: Onix
cobblemon.species.oranguru.desc: It knows the forest inside and out. If it comes across a wounded Pokémon, Oranguru will gather medicinal herbs to treat it.
cobblemon.species.oranguru.name: Oranguru
cobblemon.species.orbeetle.desc: It emits psychic energy to observe and study what's around it—and what's around it can include things over six miles away.
cobblemon.species.orbeetle.name: Orbeetle
cobblemon.species.oricorio.desc: This Oricorio has drunk red nectar. If its Trainer gives the wrong order, this passionate Pokémon becomes fiercely angry.
cobblemon.species.oricorio.name: Oricorio
cobblemon.species.orthworm.desc: When attacked, this Pokémon will wield the tendrils on its body like fists and pelt the opponent with a storm of punches.
cobblemon.species.orthworm.name: Orthworm
cobblemon.species.oshawott.desc: This Pokémon from the Unova region uses the shell on its belly as a weapon to cut down its foes. Thus, I've conferred upon this shell the name «scalchop».
cobblemon.species.oshawott.name: Oshawott
cobblemon.species.overqwil.desc: Its lancelike spikes and savage temperament have earned it the nickname «sea fiend.» It slurps up poison to nourish itself.
cobblemon.species.overqwil.name: Overqwil
cobblemon.species.pachirisu.desc: A species related to the Pikachu line. Though Pachirisu is a calm Pokémon, it still presents a danger should one touch its electrified tail or cheeks.
cobblemon.species.pachirisu.name: Pachirisu
cobblemon.species.palafin.name: Palafin
cobblemon.species.palkia.desc: This Pokémon is feared as a deity in Hisuian legend. The birth of Palkia was what caused the walls of our world to disappear, creating a sky that spans for infinity.
cobblemon.species.palkia.name: Palkia
cobblemon.species.palossand.desc: This Pokémon lives on beaches, but it hates water. Palossand can't maintain its castle-like shape if it gets drenched by a heavy rain.
cobblemon.species.palossand.name: Palossand
cobblemon.species.palpitoad.desc: On occasion, their cries are sublimely pleasing to the ear. Palpitoad with larger lumps on their bodies can sing with a wider range of sounds.
cobblemon.species.palpitoad.name: Palpitoad
cobblemon.species.pancham.desc: Wanting to make sure it's taken seriously, Pancham's always giving others a glare. But if it's not focusing, it ends up smiling.
cobblemon.species.pancham.name: Pancham
cobblemon.species.pangoro.desc: Using its leaf, Pangoro can predict the moves of its opponents. It strikes with punches that can turn a dump truck into scrap with just one hit.
cobblemon.species.pangoro.name: Pangoro
cobblemon.species.panpour.desc: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. Plants that receive its water grow large.
cobblemon.species.panpour.name: Panpour
cobblemon.species.pansage.desc: It's good at finding berries and gathers them from all over. It's kind enough to share them with friends.
cobblemon.species.pansage.name: Pansage
cobblemon.species.pansear.desc: This Pokémon lives in caves in volcanoes. The fire within the tuft on its head can reach 600 degrees Fahrenheit.
cobblemon.species.pansear.name: Pansear
cobblemon.species.paras.desc: Sometimes seen at the foot of trees in humid forests. The mushrooms on its back—called tochukaso—are not present on infant specimens and instead emerge as Paras matures.
cobblemon.species.paras.name: Paras
cobblemon.species.parasect.desc: Mushroom-lacking specimens of this Pokémon lie unmoving in the forest, lending credence to the hypothesis that the large mushroom is in control of Parasect's actions.
cobblemon.species.parasect.name: Parasect
cobblemon.species.passimian.desc: Passimian live in groups of about 20, with each member performing an assigned role. Through cooperation, the group survives.
cobblemon.species.passimian.name: Passimian
cobblemon.species.patrat.desc: Extremely cautious, one of them will always be on the lookout, but it won't notice a foe coming from behind.
cobblemon.species.patrat.name: Patrat
cobblemon.species.pawmi.desc: It has underdeveloped electric sacs on its cheeks. These sacs can produce electricity only if Pawmi rubs them furiously with the pads on its forepaws.
cobblemon.species.pawmi.name: Pawmi
cobblemon.species.pawmo.desc: When its group is attacked, Pawmo is the first to leap into battle, defeating enemies with a fighting technique that utilizes electric shocks.
cobblemon.species.pawmo.name: Pawmo
cobblemon.species.pawmot.desc: This Pokémon normally is slow to react, but once it enters battle, it will strike down its enemies with lightning-fast movements.
cobblemon.species.pawmot.name: Pawmot
cobblemon.species.pawniard.desc: A pack of these Pokémon forms to serve a Bisharp boss. Each Pawniard trains diligently, dreaming of one day taking the lead.
cobblemon.species.pawniard.name: Pawniard
cobblemon.species.pecharunt.desc: Its peach-shaped shell serves as storage for a potent poison. It makes poisonous mochi and serves them to people and Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.pecharunt.name: Pecharunt
cobblemon.species.pelipper.desc: Skimming the water's surface, it dips its large bill in the sea, scoops up food and water, and carries it.
cobblemon.species.pelipper.name: Pelipper
cobblemon.species.perrserker.desc: After many battles, it evolved dangerous claws that come together to form daggers when extended.
cobblemon.species.perrserker.name: Perrserker
cobblemon.species.persian.desc: Its elegant and refined behavior clashes with that of the barbaric Perrserker. The relationship between the two is one of mutual disdain.
cobblemon.species.persian.name: Persian
cobblemon.species.petilil.desc: The leaves on its head are highly valued for medicinal purposes. Dry the leaves in the sun, boil them, and then drink the bitter decoction for remarkably effective relief from fatigue.
cobblemon.species.petilil.name: Petilil
cobblemon.species.phanpy.desc: Phanpy uses its long nose to shower itself. When others gather around, they thoroughly douse each other with water. These Pokémon can be seen drying their soaking-wet bodies at the edge of water.
cobblemon.species.phanpy.name: Phanpy
cobblemon.species.phantump.desc: With a voice like a human child's, it cries out to lure adults deep into the forest, getting them lost among the trees.
cobblemon.species.phantump.name: Phantump
cobblemon.species.pheromosa.desc: Although it's alien to this world and a danger here, it's apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.
cobblemon.species.pheromosa.name: Феромоза
cobblemon.species.phione.desc: Can be seen floating offshore during seasons when the seas are warm. Its azure body blends in with the ocean waters—logic suggests this is a defense mechanism against natural predators.
cobblemon.species.phione.name: Фионе
cobblemon.species.pichu.desc: Пичу накапливает электричество в щёчных мешочках, но нечаянно разряжает его при волнении или возбуждении. Будучи совсем крохой, этот покемон обращается с электричеством довольно неумело.
cobblemon.species.pichu.name: Пичу
cobblemon.species.pidgeot.desc: This Pokémon flies at Mach 2 speed, seeking prey. Its large talons are feared as wicked weapons.
cobblemon.species.pidgeot.name: Пиджиот
cobblemon.species.pidgeotto.desc: This Pokémon is full of vitality. It constantly flies around its large territory in search of prey.
cobblemon.species.pidgeotto.name: Пиджиотто
cobblemon.species.pidgey.desc: Very docile. If attacked, it will often kick up sand to protect itself rather than fight back.
cobblemon.species.pidgey.name: Пиджи
cobblemon.species.pidove.desc: It's forgetful and not very bright, but many Trainers love it anyway for its friendliness and sincerity.
cobblemon.species.pidove.name: Пидов
cobblemon.species.pignite.desc: When its internal fire flares up, its movements grow sharper and faster. When in trouble, it emits smoke.
cobblemon.species.pignite.name: Pignite
cobblemon.species.pikachu.desc: Обладает щёчными мешочками, в которых накапливает электричество. Этот умный зверёк поджаривает крепкие ягоды электрическим разрядом, прежде чем съесть их.
cobblemon.species.pikachu.name: Пикачу
cobblemon.species.pikipek.desc: It may look spindly, but its neck muscles are heavy-duty. It can peck at a tree 16 times per second!
cobblemon.species.pikipek.name: Pikipek
cobblemon.species.piloswine.desc: The long fur of this Pokémon covers its eyes, ears, and even limbs, allowing Piloswine to resist harshly frigid conditions. The Pokémon's white tusks can be used to defeat its enemies.
cobblemon.species.piloswine.name: Piloswine
cobblemon.species.pincurchin.desc: It stores electricity in each spine. Even if one gets broken off, it still continues to emit electricity for at least three hours.
cobblemon.species.pincurchin.name: Pincurchin
cobblemon.species.pineco.desc: It sticks tree bark to itself with its saliva, making itself thicker and larger. Elderly Pineco are ridiculously huge.
cobblemon.species.pineco.name: Pineco
cobblemon.species.pinsir.desc: This Pokémon clamps its pincers down on its prey and then either splits the prey in half or flings it away.
cobblemon.species.pinsir.name: Pinsir
cobblemon.species.piplup.desc: Prefers cold climes and appears along coasts. It's an adorable little thing—as cute as any child—but it's also prideful, unwilling to accept handouts from people.
cobblemon.species.piplup.name: Piplup
cobblemon.species.plusle.desc: When Plusle is cheering on its partner, it flashes with electric sparks from all over its body. If its partner loses, this Pokémon cries loudly.
cobblemon.species.plusle.name: Plusle
cobblemon.species.poipole.desc: An Ultra Beast that lives in a different world, it cackles wildly as it sprays its opponents with poison from the needles on its head.
cobblemon.species.poipole.name: Poipole
cobblemon.species.politoed.desc: The cry of a male is louder than that of a female. Male Politoed with deep, menacing voices find more popularity with the opposite gender.
cobblemon.species.politoed.name: Politoed
cobblemon.species.poliwag.desc: In rivers with fast-flowing water, this Pokémon will cling to a rock by using its thick lips, which act like a suction cup.
cobblemon.species.poliwag.name: Poliwag
cobblemon.species.poliwhirl.desc: This Pokémon's sweat is a slimy mucus. When captured, Poliwhirl can slither from its enemies' grasp and escape.
cobblemon.species.poliwhirl.name: Poliwhirl
cobblemon.species.poliwrath.desc: Poliwrath is skilled at both swimming and martial arts. It uses its well-trained arms to dish out powerful punches.
cobblemon.species.poliwrath.name: Poliwrath
cobblemon.species.poltchageist.desc: Supposedly, the regrets of a tea ceremony master who died before perfecting his craft lingered in some matcha and became a Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.poltchageist.name: Poltchageist
cobblemon.species.polteageist.desc: Leaving leftover black tea unattended is asking for this Pokémon to come along and pour itself into it, turning the tea into a new Polteageist.
cobblemon.species.polteageist.name: Polteageist
cobblemon.species.ponyta.desc: These Pokémon live in herds out in the grassland. Newborn foals lack their fiery manes, which will develop about an hour after birth.
cobblemon.species.ponyta.name: Ponyta
cobblemon.species.poochyena.desc: Poochyena is an omnivore—it will eat anything. A distinguishing feature is how large its fangs are compared to its body. This Pokémon tries to intimidate its foes by making the hair on its tail bristle out.
cobblemon.species.poochyena.name: Poochyena
cobblemon.species.popplio.desc: If Popplio want to create big, powerful balloons, they must be persistent. It takes daily practice for these Pokémon to develop their skills.
cobblemon.species.popplio.name: Popplio
cobblemon.species.porygon.desc: It has no discernible heartbeat and does not seem to draw breath, and yet it appears to function without issue. I cannot even begin to explain this utterly bizarre anomaly.
cobblemon.species.porygon.name: Porygon
cobblemon.species.porygon2.desc: A bizarre item caused this Pokémon to evolve. While it now exhibits many new gestures and expressions, its biology remains inscrutable.
cobblemon.species.porygon2.name: Porygon2
cobblemon.species.porygonz.desc: A curious item induced this evolution. The Pokémon's offensive capabilities have greatly increased, but the strangeness of its behavior has magnified in equal measure. This worries me.
cobblemon.species.porygonz.name: Porygon-Z
cobblemon.species.primarina.desc: For Primarina, every battle's a stage. Its singing and the dancing of its balloons will mesmerize the audience.
cobblemon.species.primarina.name: Primarina
cobblemon.species.primeape.desc: It stops being angry only when nobody else is around. To view this moment is very difficult.
cobblemon.species.primeape.name: Primeape
cobblemon.species.prinplup.desc: It swims gracefully through the frigid sea and sings with a voice like the roaring tide. It has powerful, sturdy wings and dignity to match.
cobblemon.species.prinplup.name: Prinplup
cobblemon.species.probopass.desc: It is able to emit powerful magnetism, allowing it control over the iron sand that forms its luscious mustache. Using this iron sand, Probopass forms hard stones with which it smites its prey.
cobblemon.species.probopass.name: Пробопасс
cobblemon.species.psyduck.desc: Suffers perpetual headaches. If the agony grows too great, Psyduck's latent power erupts, contrary to Psyduck's intent. Ergo, I am exploring ways to ease the pain.
cobblemon.species.psyduck.name: Псайдак
cobblemon.species.pumpkaboo.desc: The light that streams out from the holes in the pumpkin can hypnotize and control the people and Pokémon that see it.
cobblemon.species.pumpkaboo.name: Пампкабу
cobblemon.species.pupitar.desc: It will not stay still, even while it's a pupa. It already has arms and legs under its solid shell.
cobblemon.species.pupitar.name: Pupitar
cobblemon.species.purrloin.desc: Opponents that get drawn in by its adorable behavior come away with stinging scratches from its claws and stinging pride from its laughter.
cobblemon.species.purrloin.name: Purrloin
cobblemon.species.purugly.desc: Though impudent and difficult to tame, Purugly enjoys great popularity due to its fur, the beauty of which surpasses even velveteen.
cobblemon.species.purugly.name: Purugly
cobblemon.species.pyroar.desc: The temperature of its breath is over 10,000 degrees Fahrenheit, but Pyroar doesn't use it on its prey. This Pokémon prefers to eat raw meat.
cobblemon.species.pyroar.name: Pyroar
cobblemon.species.pyukumuku.desc: It lives in warm, shallow waters. If it encounters a foe, it will spit out its internal organs as a means to punch them.
cobblemon.species.pyukumuku.name: Pyukumuku
cobblemon.species.quagsire.desc: Its body is always slimy. It often bangs its head on the river bottom as it swims but seems not to care.
cobblemon.species.quagsire.name: Quagsire
cobblemon.species.quaquaval.desc: A single kick from a Quaquaval can send a truck rolling. This Pokémon uses its powerful legs to perform striking dances from far-off lands.
cobblemon.species.quaquaval.name: Quaquaval
cobblemon.species.quaxly.desc: This Pokémon migrated to Paldea from distant lands long ago. The gel secreted by its feathers repels water and grime.
cobblemon.species.quaxly.name: Quaxly
cobblemon.species.quaxwell.desc: These Pokémon constantly run through shallow waters to train their legs, then compete with each other to see which of them kicks most gracefully.
cobblemon.species.quaxwell.name: Quaxwell
cobblemon.species.quilava.desc: This creature's fur is most mysterious—it is wholly impervious to the burning touch of flame. Should Quilava turn its back to you, take heed! Such a posture indicates a forthcoming attack.
cobblemon.species.quilava.name: Quilava
cobblemon.species.quilladin.desc: They strengthen their lower bodies by running into one another. They are very kind and won't start fights.
cobblemon.species.quilladin.name: Quilladin
cobblemon.species.qwilfish.desc: Fishers detest this troublesome Pokémon because it sprays poison from its spines, getting it everywhere. A different form of Qwilfish lives in other regions.
cobblemon.species.qwilfish.name: Qwilfish
cobblemon.species.raboot.desc: It kicks berries right off the branches of trees and then juggles them with its feet, practicing its footwork.
cobblemon.species.raboot.name: Raboot
cobblemon.species.rabsca.desc: The body that supports the ball barely moves. Therefore, it is thought that the true body of this Pokémon is actually inside the ball.
cobblemon.species.rabsca.name: Rabsca
cobblemon.species.ragingbolt.desc: It's said to incinerate everything around it with lightning launched from its fur. Very little is known about this creature.
cobblemon.species.ragingbolt.name: Raging Bolt
cobblemon.species.raichu.desc: It can discharge bursts of electricity exceeding 100,000 volts— a single strike with that amount of power would incapacitate one of the Copperajah of my homeland.
cobblemon.species.raichu.name: Raichu
cobblemon.species.raikou.desc: Raikou embodies the speed of lightning. The roars of this Pokémon send shock waves shuddering through the air and shake the ground as if lightning bolts had come crashing down.
cobblemon.species.raikou.name: Raikou
cobblemon.species.ralts.desc: Tends to prefer people with a chipper disposition to those who are gloomy, but it has shown no discrimination with regard to age or gender. Needs more research.
cobblemon.species.ralts.name: Ralts
cobblemon.species.rampardos.desc: Very little is known about its biology. Can knock down massive trees by smashing its beautiful, pearl-like crown against them.
cobblemon.species.rampardos.name: Rampardos
cobblemon.species.rapidash.desc: Fiery mane aglow, Rapidash darts like an arrow across the land. This prodigiously swift creature can traverse the vast region of Hisui in a day and a half.
cobblemon.species.rapidash.name: Rapidash
cobblemon.species.raticate.desc: Its hind feet are webbed. They act as flippers, so it can swim in rivers and hunt for prey.
cobblemon.species.raticate.name: Raticate
cobblemon.species.rattata.desc: Will chew on anything with its fangs. If you see one, you can be certain that 40 more live in the area.
cobblemon.species.rattata.name: Rattata
cobblemon.species.rayquaza.desc: It flies forever through the ozone layer, consuming meteoroids for sustenance. The many meteoroids in its body provide the energy it needs to Mega Evolve.
cobblemon.species.rayquaza.name: Rayquaza
cobblemon.species.regice.desc: This Pokémon's body is made of solid ice. It's said that Regice was born beneath thick ice in the ice age.
cobblemon.species.regice.name: Regice
cobblemon.species.regidrago.desc: Its body is composed of crystallized dragon energy. Regidrago is said to have the powers of every dragon Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.regidrago.name: Regidrago
cobblemon.species.regieleki.desc: Its entire body is made up of a single organ that generates electrical energy. Regieleki is capable of creating all Galar's electricity.
cobblemon.species.regieleki.name: Regieleki
cobblemon.species.regigigas.desc: According to legend, Regigigas pulled landmasses together and bound them with rope to create the continent of Hisui. Though I have my doubts, the story could well contain a shred of truth.
cobblemon.species.regigigas.name: Regigigas
cobblemon.species.regirock.desc: Cutting-edge technology was used to study the internals of this Pokémon's rock body, but nothing was found—not even a brain or a heart.
cobblemon.species.regirock.name: Regirock
cobblemon.species.registeel.desc: It's rumored that this Pokémon was born deep underground in the planet's mantle and that it emerged onto the surface 10,000 years ago.
cobblemon.species.registeel.name: Registeel
cobblemon.species.relicanth.desc: This Pokémon was discovered during deep-sea exploration. Its appearance hasn't changed in 100,000,000 years, so it's called a living fossil.
cobblemon.species.relicanth.name: Relicanth
cobblemon.species.rellor.desc: This Pokémon creates a mud ball by mixing sand and dirt with psychic energy. It treasures its mud ball more than its own life.
cobblemon.species.rellor.name: Rellor
cobblemon.species.remoraid.desc: Spits water from its mouth with incredible accuracy. It captures Burmy by shooting them down off the branches from which they dangle.
cobblemon.species.remoraid.name: Remoraid
cobblemon.species.reshiram.desc: According to myth, if people ignore truth and let themselves become consumed by greed, Reshiram will arrive to burn their kingdoms down.
cobblemon.species.reshiram.name: Reshiram
cobblemon.species.reuniclus.desc: It's said that drinking the liquid surrounding Reuniclus grants wisdom. Problem is, the liquid is highly toxic to anything besides Reuniclus itself.
cobblemon.species.reuniclus.name: Reuniclus
cobblemon.species.revavroom.desc: It creates a gas out of poison and minerals from rocks. It then detonates the gas in its cylinders— now numbering eight—to generate energy.
cobblemon.species.revavroom.name: Revavroom
cobblemon.species.rhydon.desc: Rapidly rotates its horn to bore through bedrock. It swaggers around volcanic regions, protected from the lava's heat by its tough, armorlike hide.
cobblemon.species.rhydon.name: Rhydon
cobblemon.species.rhyhorn.desc: Ludicrously strong—when it butts heads with a mountain, it is the mountain that shatters. But its short legs struggle with turns, and it is incapable of stopping unless it collides with something.
cobblemon.species.rhyhorn.name: Rhyhorn
cobblemon.species.rhyperior.desc: This Pokémon evolved through use of a curious item. Its rocklike hide is composed of a mysterious substance and can withstand a blow from a masterwork sword with nary a scratch.
cobblemon.species.rhyperior.name: Rhyperior
cobblemon.species.ribombee.desc: Ribombee absolutely hate getting wet or rained on. In the cloudy Galar region, they are very seldom seen.
cobblemon.species.ribombee.name: Ribombee
cobblemon.species.rillaboom.desc: The one with the best drumming techniques becomes the boss of the troop. It has a gentle disposition and values harmony among its group.
cobblemon.species.rillaboom.name: Rillaboom
cobblemon.species.riolu.desc: Though infantile in appearance, it has the mysterious ability to read the minds of humans. The pure of heart are met with Riolu's approval, while those of ill nature earn only its loathing.
cobblemon.species.riolu.name: Riolu
cobblemon.species.roaringmoon.desc: It is possible that this is the creature listed as Roaring Moon in an expedition journal that still holds many mysteries.
cobblemon.species.roaringmoon.name: Roaring Moon
cobblemon.species.rockruff.desc: This Pokémon intimidates opponents by striking the ground with the rocks on its neck. The moment an opponent flinches, Rockruff attacks.
cobblemon.species.rockruff.name: Rockruff
cobblemon.species.roggenrola.desc: When it detects a noise, it starts to move. The energy core inside it makes this Pokémon slightly warm to the touch.
cobblemon.species.roggenrola.name: Roggenrola
cobblemon.species.rolycoly.desc: It can race around like a unicycle, even on rough, rocky terrain. Burning coal sustains it.
cobblemon.species.rolycoly.name: Rolycoly
cobblemon.species.rookidee.desc: Jumping nimbly about, this small-bodied Pokémon takes advantage of even the slightest opportunity to disorient larger opponents.
cobblemon.species.rookidee.name: Rookidee
cobblemon.species.roselia.desc: Though beautiful, it has highly poisonous thorns. There is an old tradition in my homeland wherein one would send these thorns to an opponent to challenge them to a duel.
cobblemon.species.roselia.name: Roselia
