cobblemon.species.roserade.desc: Hidden within the bouquet on each hand are thorned whips loaded with virulent poison. Roserade moves gracefully as it corners its prey and mercilessly lashes them with its whips.
cobblemon.species.roserade.name: Roserade
cobblemon.species.rotom.desc: This bizarre Pokémon appears to be a will-o'-the-wisp powered by electricity. Be wary, as Rotom is both smart and mischievous.
cobblemon.species.rotom.name: Rotom
cobblemon.species.rowlet.desc: Flies noiselessly on delicate wings. It has mastered the art of deftly launching dagger-sharp feathers from those same wings.
cobblemon.species.rowlet.name: Rowlet
cobblemon.species.rufflet.desc: Its chick-like looks belie its hotheadedness. It challenges its parents at every opportunity, desperate to prove its strength.
cobblemon.species.rufflet.name: Rufflet
cobblemon.species.runerigus.desc: Never touch its shadowlike body, or you'll be shown the horrific memories behind the picture carved into it.
cobblemon.species.runerigus.name: Runerigus
cobblemon.species.sableye.desc: It feeds on gemstone crystals. In darkness, its eyes sparkle with the glitter of jewels.
cobblemon.species.sableye.name: Sableye
cobblemon.species.salamence.desc: While basking in the joy of flight generally keeps this Pokémon in high spirits, Salamence turns into an uncontrollable menace if something angers it.
cobblemon.species.salamence.name: Salamence
cobblemon.species.salandit.desc: This sneaky Pokémon will slink behind its prey and immobilize it with poisonous gas before the prey even realizes Salandit is there.
cobblemon.species.salandit.name: Salandit
cobblemon.species.salazzle.desc: The winner of competitions between Salazzle is decided by which one has the most male Salandit with it.
cobblemon.species.salazzle.name: Salazzle
cobblemon.species.samurott.desc: Hard of heart and deft of blade, this rare form of Samurott is a product of the Pokémon's evolution in the region of Hisui. Its turbulent blows crash into foes like ceaseless pounding waves.
cobblemon.species.samurott.name: Samurott
cobblemon.species.sandaconda.desc: Its unique style of coiling allows it to blast sand out of its sand sac more efficiently.
cobblemon.species.sandaconda.name: Sandaconda
cobblemon.species.sandile.desc: Sandile is small, but its legs and lower body are powerful. Pushing sand aside as it goes, Sandile moves through the desert as if it's swimming.
cobblemon.species.sandile.name: Sandile
cobblemon.species.sandshrew.desc: It burrows into the ground to create its nest. If hard stones impede its tunneling, it uses its sharp claws to shatter them and then carries on digging.
cobblemon.species.sandshrew.name: Sandshrew
cobblemon.species.sandslash.desc: It climbs trees by hooking on with its sharp claws. Sandslash shares the berries it gathers, dropping them down to Sandshrew waiting below the tree.
cobblemon.species.sandslash.name: Sandslash
cobblemon.species.sandygast.desc: Sandygast mainly inhabits beaches. It takes control of anyone who puts their hand into its mouth, forcing them to make its body bigger.
cobblemon.species.sandygast.name: Sandygast
cobblemon.species.sandyshocks.desc: No records exist of this Pokémon being caught. Data is lacking, but the Pokémon's traits match up with a creature shown in an expedition journal.
cobblemon.species.sandyshocks.name: Sandy Shocks
cobblemon.species.sawk.desc: The karate chops of a Sawk that's trained itself to the limit can cleave the ocean itself.
cobblemon.species.sawk.name: Sawk
cobblemon.species.sawsbuck.desc: They migrate according to the seasons, so some people call Sawsbuck the harbingers of spring.
cobblemon.species.sawsbuck.name: Sawsbuck
cobblemon.species.scatterbug.desc: The powder that covers its body regulates its temperature, so it can live in any region or climate.
cobblemon.species.scatterbug.name: Scatterbug
cobblemon.species.sceptile.desc: Sceptile has seeds growing on its back. They are said to be bursting with nutrients that revitalize trees. This Pokémon raises the trees in a forest with loving care.
cobblemon.species.sceptile.name: Sceptile
cobblemon.species.scizor.desc: Evolved by way of a curious item. The shell covering its body has been shown to be stronger than forged steel.
cobblemon.species.scizor.name: Scizor
cobblemon.species.scolipede.desc: Scolipede engage in fierce territorial battles with Centiskorch. At the end of one of these battles, the victor makes a meal of the loser.
cobblemon.species.scolipede.name: Scolipede
cobblemon.species.scorbunny.desc: It has special pads on the backs of its feet, and one on its nose. Once it's raring to fight, these pads radiate tremendous heat.
cobblemon.species.scorbunny.name: Scorbunny
cobblemon.species.scovillain.desc: The red head converts spicy chemicals into fire energy and blasts the surrounding area with a super spicy stream of flame.
cobblemon.species.scovillain.name: Scovillain
cobblemon.species.scrafty.desc: While mostly known for having the temperament of an aggressive ruffian, this Pokémon takes very good care of its family, friends, and territory.
cobblemon.species.scrafty.name: Scrafty
cobblemon.species.scraggy.desc: It protects itself with its durable skin. It's thought that this Pokémon will evolve once its skin has completely stretched out.
cobblemon.species.scraggy.name: Scraggy
cobblemon.species.screamtail.desc: There has been only one reported sighting of this Pokémon. It resembles a mysterious creature depicted in an old expedition journal.
cobblemon.species.screamtail.name: Scream Tail
cobblemon.species.scyther.desc: The large, wickedly sharp scythes on its forearms are truly fearsome weapons. Prey's attempts to flee are unfailingly thwarted by this Pokémon's nimble motions.
cobblemon.species.scyther.name: Scyther
cobblemon.species.seadra.desc: Seadra's mouth is slender, but its suction power is strong. In an instant, Seadra can suck in food that's larger than the opening of its mouth.
cobblemon.species.seadra.name: Seadra
cobblemon.species.seaking.desc: Using its horn, it bores holes in riverbed boulders, making nests to prevent its eggs from washing away.
cobblemon.species.seaking.name: Seaking
cobblemon.species.sealeo.desc: Its white whiskers are very sensitive. Sealeo will balance Spheal on the tip of its nose, checking its scent and its feel to be sure the Spheal is healthy.
cobblemon.species.sealeo.name: Sealeo
cobblemon.species.seedot.desc: It attaches itself to a tree branch using the top of its head. Strong winds can sometimes make it fall.
cobblemon.species.seedot.name: Сидот
cobblemon.species.seel.desc: Loves freezing-cold conditions. Relishes swimming in a frigid climate of around 14 degrees Fahrenheit.
cobblemon.species.seel.name: Seel
cobblemon.species.seismitoad.desc: This Pokémon is popular among the elderly, who say the vibrations of its lumps are great for massages.
cobblemon.species.seismitoad.name: Seismitoad
cobblemon.species.sentret.desc: When Sentret sleeps, it does so while another stands guard. The sentry wakes the others at the first sign of danger. When this Pokémon becomes separated from its pack, it becomes incapable of sleep due to fear.
cobblemon.species.sentret.name: Sentret
cobblemon.species.serperior.desc: It can stop its opponents' movements with just a glare. It takes in solar energy and boosts it internally.
cobblemon.species.serperior.name: Serperior
cobblemon.species.servine.desc: When it gets dirty, its leaves can't be used in photosynthesis, so it always keeps itself clean.
cobblemon.species.servine.name: Servine
cobblemon.species.seviper.desc: Seviper's swordlike tail serves two purposes—it slashes foes and douses them with secreted poison. This Pokémon will not give up its long-running blood feud with Zangoose.
cobblemon.species.seviper.name: Seviper
cobblemon.species.sewaddle.desc: Since this Pokémon makes its own clothes out of leaves, it is a popular mascot for fashion designers.
cobblemon.species.sewaddle.name: Sewaddle
cobblemon.species.sharpedo.desc: This Pokémon is known as the Bully of the Sea. Any ship entering the waters Sharpedo calls home will be attacked—no exceptions.
cobblemon.species.sharpedo.name: Sharpedo
cobblemon.species.shaymin.desc: When the turning of seasons brings the cruel winter to its end and the joyous people give thanks to the heavens, Shaymin appears and covers the withered land with flowers.
cobblemon.species.shaymin.name: Shaymin
cobblemon.species.shedinja.desc: A strange Pokémon—it flies without moving its wings, has a hollow shell for a body, and does not breathe.
cobblemon.species.shedinja.name: Shedinja
cobblemon.species.shelgon.desc: Shelgon ignores its hunger entirely, never eating any food. Apparently, Shelgon will evolve once all its energy stores are used up.
cobblemon.species.shelgon.name: Shelgon
cobblemon.species.shellder.desc: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.
cobblemon.species.shellder.name: Shellder
cobblemon.species.shellos.desc: Found in abundance on seashores bordering warm waters. Shellos are unexpectedly friendly and will crawl toward any person they see. Take care not to get coated in mucus!
cobblemon.species.shellos.name: Shellos
cobblemon.species.shelmet.desc: It has a strange physiology that responds to electricity. When together with Karrablast, Shelmet evolves for some reason.
cobblemon.species.shelmet.name: Shelmet
cobblemon.species.shieldon.desc: Much remains unknown about this Pokémon, as few have ever seen it. However, we know that it is calm and dislikes conflict, and it enjoys polishing its face against trees and rocks.
cobblemon.species.shieldon.name: Shieldon
cobblemon.species.shiftry.desc: It lives quietly in the deep forest. It is said to create chilly winter winds with the fans it holds.
cobblemon.species.shiftry.name: Shiftry
cobblemon.species.shiinotic.desc: If you see a light deep in a forest at night, don't go near. Shiinotic will make you fall fast asleep.
cobblemon.species.shiinotic.name: Shiinotic
cobblemon.species.shinx.desc: Shakes its body to generate electricity. Its stature belies its aggression—one must be patient to tame this Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.shinx.name: Shinx
cobblemon.species.shroodle.desc: Though usually a mellow Pokémon, it will sink its sharp, poison-soaked front teeth into any that anger it, causing paralysis in the object of its ire.
cobblemon.species.shroodle.name: Shroodle
cobblemon.species.shroomish.desc: If Shroomish senses danger, it shakes its body and scatters spores from the top of its head. This Pokémon's spores are so toxic, they make trees and weeds wilt.
cobblemon.species.shroomish.name: Shroomish
cobblemon.species.shuckle.desc: The berries stored in its vaselike shell eventually become a thick, pulpy juice.
cobblemon.species.shuckle.name: Shuckle
cobblemon.species.shuppet.desc: There's a proverb that says, «Shun the house where Shuppet gather in the growing dusk.»
cobblemon.species.shuppet.name: Shuppet
cobblemon.species.sigilyph.desc: A discovery was made in the desert where Sigilyph fly. The ruins of what may have been an ancient city were found beneath the sands.
cobblemon.species.sigilyph.name: Sigilyph
cobblemon.species.silcoon.desc: Wraps itself in thin strings of silk while it stores energy for evolution. It can't extend its limbs and its movement is slow, but its eyes keep a sharp lookout—Silcoon is always on guard.
cobblemon.species.silcoon.name: Silcoon
cobblemon.species.silicobra.desc: It spews sand from its nostrils. While the enemy is blinded, it burrows into the ground to hide.
cobblemon.species.silicobra.name: Silicobra
cobblemon.species.silvally.desc: The final factor needed to release this Pokémon's true power was a strong bond with a Trainer it trusts.
cobblemon.species.silvally.name: Silvally
cobblemon.species.simipour.desc: It prefers places with clean water. When its tuft runs low, it replenishes it by siphoning up water with its tail.
cobblemon.species.simipour.name: Simipour
cobblemon.species.simisage.desc: Ill tempered, it fights by swinging its barbed tail around wildly. The leaf growing on its head is very bitter.
cobblemon.species.simisage.name: Simisage
cobblemon.species.simisear.desc: When it gets excited, embers rise from its head and tail and it gets hot. For some reason, it loves sweets.
cobblemon.species.simisear.name: Simisear
cobblemon.species.sinistcha.desc: It pretends to be tea, trying to fool people into drinking it so it can drain their life-force. Its ruse is generally unsuccessful.
cobblemon.species.sinistcha.name: Sinistcha
cobblemon.species.sinistea.desc: The teacup in which this Pokémon makes its home is a famous piece of antique tableware. Many forgeries are in circulation.
cobblemon.species.sinistea.name: Sinistea
cobblemon.species.sirfetchd.desc: After deflecting attacks with its hard leaf shield, it strikes back with its sharp leek stalk. The leek stalk is both weapon and food.
cobblemon.species.sirfetchd.name: Sirfetch'd
cobblemon.species.sizzlipede.desc: It wraps prey up with its heated body, cooking them in its coils. Once they're well-done, it will voraciously nibble them down to the last morsel.
cobblemon.species.sizzlipede.name: Sizzlipede
cobblemon.species.skarmory.desc: People fashion swords from Skarmory's shed feathers, so this Pokémon is a popular element in heraldic designs.
cobblemon.species.skarmory.name: Skarmory
cobblemon.species.skeledirge.desc: The fiery bird changes shape when Skeledirge sings. Rumor has it that the bird was born when the fireball on Skeledirge's head gained a soul.
cobblemon.species.skeledirge.name: Skeledirge
cobblemon.species.skiddo.desc: If it has sunshine and water, it doesn't need to eat, because it can generate energy from the leaves on its back.
cobblemon.species.skiddo.name: Skiddo
cobblemon.species.skiploom.desc: Skiploom's flower blossoms when the temperature rises above 64 degrees Fahrenheit. How much the flower opens depends on the temperature. For that reason, this Pokémon is sometimes used as a thermometer.
cobblemon.species.skiploom.name: Skiploom
cobblemon.species.skitty.desc: Skitty is known to chase around playfully after its own tail. In the wild, this Pokémon lives in holes in the trees of forests. It is very popular as a pet because of its adorable looks.
cobblemon.species.skitty.name: Skitty
cobblemon.species.skorupi.desc: Its claws are not only razor-sharp but poisonous, making Skorupi a highly dangerous Pokémon. It seems to be weakened by cold temperatures, however.
cobblemon.species.skorupi.name: Skorupi
cobblemon.species.skrelp.desc: Skrelp looks like a piece of rotten seaweed, so it can blend in with seaweed drifting on the ocean and avoid being detected by enemies.
cobblemon.species.skrelp.name: Skrelp
cobblemon.species.skuntank.desc: Sprays a poisonous fluid to take down prey. Sometimes, unable to stomach the stench of its own fluid, it leaves the bested prey uneaten.
cobblemon.species.skuntank.name: Skuntank
cobblemon.species.skwovet.desc: It eats berries nonstop—a habit that has made it more resilient than it looks. It'll show up on farms, searching for yet more berries.
cobblemon.species.skwovet.name: Skwovet
cobblemon.species.slaking.desc: Wherever Slaking live, rings of over a yard in diameter appear in grassy fields. They are made by the Pokémon as it eats all the grass within reach while lying prone on the ground.
cobblemon.species.slaking.name: Slaking
cobblemon.species.slakoth.desc: Slakoth's heart beats just once a minute. Whatever happens, it is content to loaf around motionless. It is rare to see this Pokémon in motion.
cobblemon.species.slakoth.name: Slakoth
cobblemon.species.sliggoo.desc: A creature given to melancholy. I suspect its metallic shell developed as a result of the mucus on its skin reacting with the iron in Hisui's water.
cobblemon.species.sliggoo.name: Sliggoo
cobblemon.species.slitherwing.desc: This mysterious Pokémon has some similarities to a creature that an old book introduced as Slither Wing.
cobblemon.species.slitherwing.name: Slither Wing
cobblemon.species.slowbro.desc: Being bitten by a Shellder shocked this Pokémon into standing on two legs. If the Shellder lets go, it seems Slowbro will turn back into a Slowpoke.
cobblemon.species.slowbro.name: Slowbro
cobblemon.species.slowking.desc: Slowking can solve any problem presented to it, but no one can understand a thing Slowking says.
cobblemon.species.slowking.name: Slowking
cobblemon.species.slowpoke.desc: When this Pokémon's tail is soaked in water, sweetness seeps from it. Slowpoke uses this trait to lure in and fish up other Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.slowpoke.name: Slowpoke
cobblemon.species.slugma.desc: Slugma does not have any blood in its body. Instead, intensely hot magma circulates throughout this Pokémon's body, carrying essential nutrients and oxygen to its organs.
cobblemon.species.slugma.name: Slugma
cobblemon.species.slurpuff.desc: Slurpuff's fur contains a lot of air, making it soft to the touch and lighter than it looks.
cobblemon.species.slurpuff.name: Slurpuff
cobblemon.species.smeargle.desc: It draws symbols with the fluid that oozes from the tip of its tail. Depending on the symbol, Smeargle fanatics will pay big money for them.
cobblemon.species.smeargle.name: Smeargle
cobblemon.species.smoliv.desc: It protects itself from enemies by emitting oil from the fruit on its head. This oil is bitter and astringent enough to make someone flinch.
cobblemon.species.smoliv.name: Smoliv
cobblemon.species.smoochum.desc: This is a very curious Pokémon. Smoochum decides what it likes and dislikes by touching things with its lips.
cobblemon.species.smoochum.name: Smoochum
cobblemon.species.sneasel.desc: Its sturdy, curved claws are ideal for traversing precipitous cliffs. From the tips of these claws drips a venom that infiltrates the nerves of any prey caught in Sneasel's grasp.
cobblemon.species.sneasel.name: Sneasel
cobblemon.species.sneasler.desc: Because of Sneasler's virulent poison and daunting physical prowess, no other species could hope to best it on the frozen highlands. Preferring solitude, this species does not form packs.
cobblemon.species.sneasler.name: Sneasler
cobblemon.species.snivy.desc: They photosynthesize by bathing their tails in sunlight. When they are not feeling well, their tails droop.
cobblemon.species.snivy.name: Snivy
cobblemon.species.snom.desc: It eats snow that piles up on the ground. The more snow it eats, the bigger and more impressive the spikes on its back grow.
cobblemon.species.snom.name: Snom
cobblemon.species.snorlax.desc: This glutton appears in villages without warning and devours the entirety of their rice granaries—such occurrences have long been counted among the gravest of disasters.
cobblemon.species.snorlax.name: Snorlax
cobblemon.species.snorunt.desc: Arrives alongside the first snow. It's thought that homes Snorunt visit will prosper for many generations. By tradition, one might offer a lump of ice made from pure water at one's front door.
cobblemon.species.snorunt.name: Snorunt
cobblemon.species.snover.desc: One is likely to encounter this Pokémon while out in the snow. There are stories of Snover appearing in human settlements but doing no harm—rather, they bond with the children.
cobblemon.species.snover.name: Snover
cobblemon.species.snubbull.desc: In contrast to its appearance, it's quite timid. When playing with other puppy Pokémon, it sometimes gets bullied.
cobblemon.species.snubbull.name: Snubbull
cobblemon.species.sobble.desc: When it gets wet, its skin changes color, and this Pokémon becomes invisible as if it were camouflaged.
cobblemon.species.sobble.name: Sobble
cobblemon.species.solgaleo.desc: Solgaleo was once known as the Beast That Devours the Sun. Energy in the form of light radiates boundlessly from it.
cobblemon.species.solgaleo.name: Solgaleo
cobblemon.species.solosis.desc: Many say that the special liquid covering this Pokémon's body would allow it to survive in the vacuum of space.
cobblemon.species.solosis.name: Solosis
cobblemon.species.solrock.desc: Solar energy is the source of its power, so it is strong during the daytime. When it spins, its body shines.
cobblemon.species.solrock.name: Solrock
cobblemon.species.spearow.desc: Inept at flying high. However, it can fly around very fast to protect its territory.
cobblemon.species.spearow.name: Spearow
cobblemon.species.spectrier.desc: As it dashes through the night, Spectrier absorbs the life-force of sleeping creatures. It craves silence and solitude.
cobblemon.species.spectrier.name: Spectrier
cobblemon.species.spewpa.desc: The beaks of bird Pokémon can't begin to scratch its stalwart body. To defend itself, it spews powder.
cobblemon.species.spewpa.name: Spewpa
cobblemon.species.spheal.desc: During the season when drift ice approaches the shore, Spheal prefers living on the ice—where fewer predators lurk—rather than the land. Its fur retains heat superbly and resists harsh cold.
cobblemon.species.spheal.name: Spheal
cobblemon.species.spidops.desc: It clings to branches and ceilings using its threads and moves without a sound. It takes out its prey before the prey even notices it.
cobblemon.species.spidops.name: Spidops
cobblemon.species.spinarak.desc: Although the poison from its fangs isn't that strong, it's potent enough to weaken prey that gets caught in its web.
cobblemon.species.spinarak.name: Spinarak
cobblemon.species.spinda.desc: Each Spinda's spot pattern is different. With its stumbling movements, it evades opponents' attacks brilliantly!
cobblemon.species.spinda.name: Spinda
cobblemon.species.spiritomb.desc: It lays curses by thinking wicked thoughts. Writings tell that this Pokémon was born out of the assembly of five score and eight malevolent spirits.
cobblemon.species.spiritomb.name: Spiritomb
cobblemon.species.spoink.desc: Spoink keeps a pearl on top of its head. The pearl functions to amplify this Pokémon's psychokinetic powers. It is therefore on a constant search for a bigger pearl.
cobblemon.species.spoink.name: Spoink
cobblemon.species.sprigatito.desc: Его пушистый мех похож на растения. Часто моет морду, чтобы избежать высыхания.
cobblemon.species.sprigatito.name: Спригатито
cobblemon.species.spritzee.desc: The scent its body gives off enraptures those who smell it. Noble ladies had no shortage of love for Spritzee.
cobblemon.species.spritzee.name: Spritzee
cobblemon.species.squawkabilly.name: Squawkabilly
cobblemon.species.squirtle.desc: When it feels threatened, it draws its limbs inside its shell and sprays water from its mouth.
cobblemon.species.squirtle.name: Squirtle
cobblemon.species.stakataka.desc: When stone walls started moving and attacking, the brute's true identity was this mysterious life-form, which brings to mind an Ultra Beast.
cobblemon.species.stakataka.name: Stakataka
cobblemon.species.stantler.desc: Its strangely shaped antlers have the power to bewitch those who see them. Medicine made by grinding up the black orbs from fallen antlers is an effective treatment for insomnia.
cobblemon.species.stantler.name: Stantler
cobblemon.species.staraptor.desc: It has left the flock, having gained strength enough to survive on its own. The astounding force with which Staraptor flies through the air allows it to carry away large, burly targets.
cobblemon.species.staraptor.name: Staraptor
cobblemon.species.staravia.desc: They form remarkably large flocks and are constantly fighting amongst themselves. I suspect that those with magnificent plumes on their heads are the strong ones.
cobblemon.species.staravia.name: Staravia
cobblemon.species.starly.desc: They live in the fields and mountains, gathering in large flocks. Their cries are quite obnoxious. Though small, their wings are strong—a strike from them leaves pain that persists for a week.
cobblemon.species.starly.name: Starly
cobblemon.species.starmie.desc: Starmie swims by spinning its body at high speed. As this Pokémon cruises through the ocean, it absorbs tiny plankton.
cobblemon.species.starmie.name: Starmie
cobblemon.species.staryu.desc: Fish Pokémon nibble at it, but Staryu isn't bothered. Its body regenerates quickly, even if part of it is completely torn off.
cobblemon.species.staryu.name: Staryu
cobblemon.species.steelix.desc: This Pokémon evolved through use of a strange item. Its body is coated with steel powder and notably hard—not even diamond can leave so much as a scratch.
cobblemon.species.steelix.name: Steelix
cobblemon.species.steenee.desc: Any Corvisquire that pecks at this Pokémon will be greeted with a smack from its sepals followed by a sharp kick.
cobblemon.species.steenee.name: Стини
cobblemon.species.stonjourner.desc: Once a year, on a specific date and at a specific time, they gather out of nowhere and form up in a circle.
cobblemon.species.stonjourner.name: Стонджорнер
cobblemon.species.stoutland.desc: Stoutland is immensely proud of its impressive moustache. It's said that moustache length is what determines social standing among this species.
cobblemon.species.stoutland.name: Стаутленд
cobblemon.species.stufful.desc: The way it protects itself by flailing its arms may be an adorable sight, but stay well away. This is flailing that can snap thick tree trunks.
cobblemon.species.stufful.name: Stufful
cobblemon.species.stunfisk.desc: For some reason, this Pokémon smiles slightly when it emits a strong electric current from the yellow markings on its body.
cobblemon.species.stunfisk.name: Stunfisk
cobblemon.species.stunky.desc: The poison that gushes from its aft end is accompanied by an utterly evil-smelling odor with such potency that one whiff can induce memory loss.
cobblemon.species.stunky.name: Stunky
cobblemon.species.sudowoodo.desc: Though it pretends to be a tree, it fails to fool even children. To the touch, its body feels more like rock than tree bark. Sudowoodo's extreme aversion to water merits special note.
cobblemon.species.sudowoodo.name: Sudowoodo
cobblemon.species.suicune.desc: Suicune embodies the compassion of a pure spring of water. It runs across the land with gracefulness. This Pokémon has the power to purify dirty water.
cobblemon.species.suicune.name: Suicune
cobblemon.species.sunflora.desc: Sunflora converts solar energy into nutrition. It moves around actively in the daytime when it is warm. It stops moving as soon as the sun goes down for the night.
cobblemon.species.sunflora.name: Sunflora
cobblemon.species.sunkern.desc: Sunkern tries to move as little as it possibly can. It does so because it tries to conserve all the nutrients it has stored in its body for its evolution. It will not eat a thing, subsisting only on morning dew.
cobblemon.species.sunkern.name: Sunkern
cobblemon.species.surskit.desc: It lives in ponds and marshes that feature lots of plant life. It often fights with Dewpider, whose habitat and diet are similar.
cobblemon.species.surskit.name: Surskit
cobblemon.species.swablu.desc: Since Swablu looks like a cumulus cloud, foes can have a hard time finding it. Apparently its wings turned white over many generations.
cobblemon.species.swablu.name: Swablu
cobblemon.species.swadloon.desc: It protects itself from the cold by wrapping up in leaves. It stays on the move, eating leaves in forests.
cobblemon.species.swadloon.name: Swadloon
cobblemon.species.swalot.desc: Swalot has no teeth, so what it eats, it swallows whole, no matter what. Its cavernous mouth yawns widely. An automobile tire could easily fit inside this Pokémon's mouth.
cobblemon.species.swalot.name: Swalot
cobblemon.species.swampert.desc: Swampert predicts storms by sensing subtle differences in the sounds of waves and tidal winds with its fins. If a storm is approaching, it piles up boulders to protect itself.
cobblemon.species.swampert.name: Swampert
cobblemon.species.swanna.desc: Swanna start to dance at dusk. The one dancing in the middle is the leader of the flock.
cobblemon.species.swanna.name: Swanna
cobblemon.species.swellow.desc: Swellow is very conscientious about the upkeep of its glossy wings. Once two Swellow are gathered, they diligently take care of cleaning each other's wings.
cobblemon.species.swellow.name: Swellow
cobblemon.species.swinub.desc: Swinub excels at sniffing out mushrooms buried beneath grass or snow. Since ancient times, the people of Hisui have often relied upon this skill.
cobblemon.species.swinub.name: Swinub
cobblemon.species.swirlix.desc: The sweet smell of cotton candy perfumes Swirlix's fluffy fur. This Pokémon spits out sticky string to tangle up its enemies.
cobblemon.species.swirlix.name: Swirlix
cobblemon.species.swoobat.desc: The auspicious shape of this Pokémon's nose apparently led some regions to consider Swoobat a symbol of good luck.
cobblemon.species.swoobat.name: Swoobat
cobblemon.species.sylveon.desc: Из его лентообразных органов исходит успокаивающая аура. Он обхватывает ссорящихся этими придатками, чтобы моментально унять ссору.
cobblemon.species.sylveon.name: Сильвеон
cobblemon.species.tadbulb.desc: Tadbulb shakes its tail to generate electricity. If it senses danger, it will make its head blink on and off to alert its allies.
cobblemon.species.tadbulb.name: Tadbulb
cobblemon.species.taillow.desc: Taillow is young—it has only just left its nest. As a result, it sometimes becomes lonesome and cries at night. This Pokémon feeds on Wurmple that live in forests.
cobblemon.species.taillow.name: Taillow
cobblemon.species.talonflame.desc: Talonflame dives toward prey at speeds of up to 310 mph and assaults them with powerful kicks, giving the prey no chance to escape.
cobblemon.species.talonflame.name: Talonflame
cobblemon.species.tandemaus.desc: Exhibiting great teamwork, they use their incisors to cut pieces out of any material that might be useful for a nest, then make off with them.
cobblemon.species.tandemaus.name: Tandemaus
cobblemon.species.tangela.desc: It is cloaked entirely in blue vines, preventing any glimpse of its true identity. The vines impart a refreshing sensation when chewed—they're useful as a spice.
cobblemon.species.tangela.name: Tangela
cobblemon.species.tangrowth.desc: Draped with long vines, it resembles a shrub in appearance. It swings bundles of vines as though they were arms, wrapping them around prey to ensnare them.
cobblemon.species.tangrowth.name: Tangrowth
cobblemon.species.tapubulu.desc: It makes ringing sounds with its tail to let others know where it is, avoiding unneeded conflicts. This guardian deity of Ula'ula controls plants.
cobblemon.species.tapubulu.name: Tapu Bulu
cobblemon.species.tapufini.desc: Although it's called a guardian deity, terrible calamities sometimes befall those who recklessly approach Tapu Fini.
cobblemon.species.tapufini.name: Tapu Fini
cobblemon.species.tapukoko.desc: The lightning-wielding guardian deity of Melemele, Tapu Koko is brimming with curiosity and appears before people from time to time.
cobblemon.species.tapukoko.name: Tapu Koko
cobblemon.species.tapulele.desc: Although called a guardian deity, Tapu Lele is devoid of guilt about its cruel disposition and can be described as nature incarnate.
cobblemon.species.tapulele.name: Tapu Lele
cobblemon.species.tarountula.desc: The ball of threads wrapped around its body is elastic enough to deflect the scythes of Scyther, this Pokémon's natural enemy.
cobblemon.species.tarountula.name: Tarountula
cobblemon.species.tatsugiri.name: Tatsugiri
cobblemon.species.tauros.desc: The Tauros of the Galar region are volatile in nature, and they won't allow people to ride on their backs.
cobblemon.species.tauros.name: Tauros
cobblemon.species.teddiursa.desc: It licks its paws because of the sweet honey that has soaked into them. It is cunning, stealing into the nests of Combee and taking for itself the honey that the Combee have amassed.
cobblemon.species.teddiursa.name: Teddiursa
cobblemon.species.tentacool.desc: They fire beams from the glassy, magenta orbs that resemble eyes atop their heads, and they drift in shallow seas. During low tide, they can sometimes be found on beaches, desiccated.
cobblemon.species.tentacool.name: Tentacool
cobblemon.species.tentacruel.desc: It has 80 tentacles, each with a venomous tip. These tentacles are also extendible, lengthening when Tentacruel attempts to catch prey. Use caution.
cobblemon.species.tentacruel.name: Tentacruel
cobblemon.species.tepig.desc: It loves to eat roasted berries, but sometimes it gets too excited and burns them to a crisp.
cobblemon.species.tepig.name: Tepig
cobblemon.species.terapagos.desc: It's thought that this Pokémon lived in ancient Paldea until it got caught in seismic shifts and went extinct.
cobblemon.species.terapagos.name: Terapagos
cobblemon.species.terrakion.desc: In Unovan legend, Terrakion battled against humans in an effort to protect other Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.terrakion.name: Terrakion
cobblemon.species.thievul.desc: With a lithe body and sharp claws, it goes around stealing food and eggs. Boltund is its natural enemy.
cobblemon.species.thievul.name: Thievul
cobblemon.species.throh.desc: They train in groups of five. Any member that can't keep up will discard its belt and leave the group.
cobblemon.species.throh.name: Throh
cobblemon.species.thundurus.desc: They say this wielder of electricity has waged war with its nemesis, Tornadus, since time immemorial. The lightning bolts it hurls pierce the very earth and enrich the soil.
cobblemon.species.thundurus.name: Thundurus
cobblemon.species.thwackey.desc: When it's drumming out rapid beats in battle, it gets so caught up in the rhythm that it won't even notice that it's already knocked out its opponent.
cobblemon.species.thwackey.name: Thwackey
cobblemon.species.timburr.desc: Timburr that have started carrying logs that are about three times their size are nearly ready to evolve.
cobblemon.species.timburr.name: Timburr
cobblemon.species.tinglu.desc: The fear poured into an ancient ritual vessel has clad itself in rocks and dirt to become a Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.tinglu.name: Ting-Lu
cobblemon.species.tinkatink.desc: It swings its handmade hammer around to protect itself, but the hammer is often stolen by Pokémon that eat metal.
cobblemon.species.tinkatink.name: Tinkatink
cobblemon.species.tinkaton.desc: This intelligent Pokémon has a very daring disposition. It knocks rocks into the sky with its hammer, aiming for flying Corviknight.
cobblemon.species.tinkaton.name: Tinkaton
cobblemon.species.tinkatuff.desc: This Pokémon will attack groups of Pawniard and Bisharp, gathering metal from them in order to create a large and sturdy hammer.
cobblemon.species.tinkatuff.name: Tinkatuff
cobblemon.species.tirtouga.desc: Tirtouga is considered to be the ancestor of many turtle Pokémon. It was restored to life from a fossil.
cobblemon.species.tirtouga.name: Tirtouga
cobblemon.species.toedscool.desc: Toedscool lives in muggy forests. The flaps that fall from its body are chewy and very delicious.
cobblemon.species.toedscool.name: Toedscool
cobblemon.species.toedscruel.desc: These Pokémon gather into groups and form colonies deep within forests. They absolutely hate it when strangers approach.
cobblemon.species.toedscruel.name: Toedscruel
cobblemon.species.togedemaru.desc: When it's in trouble, it curls up into a ball, makes its fur spikes stand on end, and then discharges electricity indiscriminately.
cobblemon.species.togedemaru.name: Togedemaru
cobblemon.species.togekiss.desc: Scant few have ever sighted this Pokémon. After studying what literature remains, I am certain Togekiss will reveal itself when peace reigns in the land.
cobblemon.species.togekiss.name: Togekiss
cobblemon.species.togepi.desc: This ovate creature is frequently mistaken for a moving egg when encountered out in the fields or in the mountains. Its guileless smile soothes the soul.
cobblemon.species.togepi.name: Togepi
cobblemon.species.togetic.desc: No records exist of Togetic being seen in the wilds. Rumors abound that it evolves under the loving care of a trusted human companion, upon whom the Pokémon then bestows great joy.
cobblemon.species.togetic.name: Togetic
cobblemon.species.torchic.desc: Torchic has a place inside its body where it keeps its flame. Give it a hug—it will be glowing with warmth. This Pokémon is covered all over by a fluffy coat of down.
cobblemon.species.torchic.name: Torchic
cobblemon.species.torkoal.desc: You find abandoned coal mines full of them. They dig tirelessly in search of coal.
cobblemon.species.torkoal.name: Torkoal
cobblemon.species.tornadus.desc: This storm-stirring Pokémon is said to cause the seasons to turn by whipping up the air. I suspect its humanlike form to be a false one.
cobblemon.species.tornadus.name: Tornadus
cobblemon.species.torracat.desc: When facing a powerful enemy, Torracat's fighting spirit gets pumped up, and its fire bell blazes hotter.
cobblemon.species.torracat.name: Torracat
cobblemon.species.torterra.desc: This remarkable, large-bodied Pokémon would serve beautifully as borrowed scenery for a garden, and its strength is peerless. Torterra roams the wilderness in search of clean water.
cobblemon.species.torterra.name: Torterra
cobblemon.species.totodile.desc: Despite the smallness of its body, Totodile's jaws are very powerful. While the Pokémon may think it is just playfully nipping, its bite has enough power to cause serious injury.
cobblemon.species.totodile.name: Totodile
cobblemon.species.toucannon.desc: Known for forming harmonious couples, this Pokémon is brought to wedding ceremonies as a good luck charm.
cobblemon.species.toucannon.name: Toucannon
cobblemon.species.toxapex.desc: Within the poison sac in its body is a poison so toxic that Pokémon as large as Wailord will still be suffering three days after it first takes effect.
cobblemon.species.toxapex.name: Toxapex
cobblemon.species.toxel.desc: It manipulates the chemical makeup of its poison to produce electricity. The voltage is weak, but it can cause a tingling paralysis.
cobblemon.species.toxel.name: Toxel
cobblemon.species.toxicroak.desc: Its crimson claws contain a virulent toxin. This toxin can be made into a tonic by diluting it, mixing it with several types of wild grass, and boiling it down over two days.
cobblemon.species.toxicroak.name: Toxicroak
cobblemon.species.toxtricity.desc: This short-tempered and aggressive Pokémon chugs stagnant water to absorb any toxins it might contain.
cobblemon.species.toxtricity.name: Toxtricity
cobblemon.species.tranquill.desc: These bright Pokémon have acute memories. Apparently delivery workers often choose them as their partners.
cobblemon.species.tranquill.name: Tranquill
cobblemon.species.trapinch.desc: It makes an inescapable conical pit and lies in wait at the bottom for prey to come tumbling down.
cobblemon.species.trapinch.name: Trapinch
cobblemon.species.treecko.desc: Treecko is cool, calm, and collected—it never panics under any situation. If a bigger foe were to glare at this Pokémon, it would glare right back without conceding an inch of ground.
cobblemon.species.treecko.name: Treecko
cobblemon.species.trevenant.desc: Small roots that extend from the tips of this Pokémon's feet can tie into the trees of the forest and give Trevenant control over them.
cobblemon.species.trevenant.name: Trevenant
cobblemon.species.tropius.desc: Bunches of delicious fruit grow around its neck. In warm areas, many ranches raise Tropius.
cobblemon.species.tropius.name: Tropius
cobblemon.species.trubbish.desc: This Pokémon was born from a bag stuffed with trash. Galarian Weezing relish the fumes belched by Trubbish.
cobblemon.species.trubbish.name: Trubbish
cobblemon.species.trumbeak.desc: From its mouth, it fires the seeds of berries it has eaten. The scattered seeds give rise to new plants.
cobblemon.species.trumbeak.name: Trumbeak
cobblemon.species.tsareena.desc: A kick from the hardened tips of this Pokémon's legs leaves a wound in the opponent's body and soul that will never heal.
cobblemon.species.tsareena.name: Tsareena
cobblemon.species.turtonator.desc: Eating sulfur in its volcanic habitat is what causes explosive compounds to develop in its shell. Its droppings are also dangerously explosive.
cobblemon.species.turtonator.name: Turtonator
cobblemon.species.turtwig.desc: This Pokémon becomes more energetic the more sunlight there is. The part resembling a shell is similar to silt and is slightly damp and warm to the touch.
cobblemon.species.turtwig.name: Turtwig
cobblemon.species.tympole.desc: It uses sound waves to communicate with others of its kind. People and other Pokémon species can't hear its cries of warning.
cobblemon.species.tympole.name: Tympole
cobblemon.species.tynamo.desc: One alone can emit only a trickle of electricity, so a group of them gathers to unleash a powerful electric shock.
cobblemon.species.tynamo.name: Tynamo
cobblemon.species.typenull.desc: It was modeled after a mighty Pokémon of myth. The mask placed upon it limits its power in order to keep it under control.
cobblemon.species.typenull.name: Type: Null
cobblemon.species.typhlosion.desc: Said to purify lost, forsaken souls with its flames and guide them to the afterlife. I believe its form has been influenced by the energy of the sacred mountain towering at Hisui's center.
cobblemon.species.typhlosion.name: Typhlosion
cobblemon.species.tyranitar.desc: The quakes caused when it walks make even great mountains crumble and change the surrounding terrain.
cobblemon.species.tyranitar.name: Tyranitar
cobblemon.species.tyrantrum.desc: A single bite of Tyrantrum's massive jaws will demolish a car. This Pokémon was the king of the ancient world.
cobblemon.species.tyrantrum.name: Tyrantrum
cobblemon.species.tyrogue.desc: Even though it is small, it can't be ignored because it will slug any handy target without warning.
cobblemon.species.tyrogue.name: Tyrogue
cobblemon.species.tyrunt.desc: This Pokémon is selfish and likes to be pampered. It can also inflict grievous wounds on its Trainer just by playing around.
cobblemon.species.tyrunt.name: Tyrunt
cobblemon.species.umbreon.desc: It is most active in the wee hours of the night, when moonlight bathes the land. Its large eyes can pierce the darkness and perceive prey with absolute clarity.
cobblemon.species.umbreon.name: Umbreon
cobblemon.species.unfezant.desc: This Pokémon is intelligent and intensely proud. People will sit up and take notice if you become the Trainer of one.
cobblemon.species.unfezant.name: Unfezant
cobblemon.species.unown.desc: It is hard to believe these strangely shaped Pokémon are truly living creatures. I've pointed out that the species' many forms resemble writing from other lands; no one will take me seriously.
cobblemon.species.unown.name: Unown
cobblemon.species.ursaluna.desc: I believe it was Hisui's swampy terrain that gave Ursaluna its burly physique and newfound capacity to manipulate peat at will.
cobblemon.species.ursaluna.name: Ursaluna
cobblemon.species.ursaring.desc: When the cold season arrives in Hisui, this Pokémon will wander fields and mountains alike in search of its favorite berries. Ursaring's hunger during this time makes it a ferocious danger.
cobblemon.species.ursaring.name: Ursaring
cobblemon.species.urshifu.desc: Inhabiting the mountains of a distant region, this Pokémon races across sheer cliffs, training its legs and refining its moves.
cobblemon.species.urshifu.name: Urshifu
cobblemon.species.uxie.desc: A Pokémon feared but also respected for stealing away the memories of evildoers. I have found records that suggest Uxie holds dominion over knowledge.
cobblemon.species.uxie.name: Uxie
cobblemon.species.vanillish.desc: It blasts enemies with cold air reaching −148 degrees Fahrenheit, freezing them solid. But it spares their lives afterward—it's a kind Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.vanillish.name: Vanillish
cobblemon.species.vanillite.desc: Supposedly, this Pokémon was born from an icicle. It spews out freezing air at −58 degrees Fahrenheit to make itself more comfortable.
cobblemon.species.vanillite.name: Vanillite
cobblemon.species.vanilluxe.desc: People believe this Pokémon formed when two Vanillish stuck together. Its body temperature is roughly 21 degrees Fahrenheit.
cobblemon.species.vanilluxe.name: Vanilluxe
cobblemon.species.vaporeon.desc: Тесты показали, что его клетки очень схожи с молекулами воды, что, возможно, объясняет его способность скрываться под водой. Кажется, этот покемон может иметь связь с истоками русалочьего фольклора.
cobblemon.species.vaporeon.name: Вапореон
cobblemon.species.varoom.desc: It is said that this Pokémon was born when an unknown poison Pokémon entered and inspirited an engine left at a scrap-processing factory.
cobblemon.species.varoom.name: Varoom
cobblemon.species.veluza.desc: When Veluza discards unnecessary flesh, its mind becomes honed and its psychic power increases. The spare flesh has a mild but delicious flavor.
cobblemon.species.veluza.name: Veluza
cobblemon.species.venipede.desc: Its fangs are highly venomous. If this Pokémon finds prey it thinks it can eat, it leaps for them without any thought of how things might turn out.
cobblemon.species.venipede.name: Venipede
cobblemon.species.venomoth.desc: The powdery scales on its wings are hard to remove from skin. They also contain poison that leaks out on contact.
cobblemon.species.venomoth.name: Venomoth
cobblemon.species.venonat.desc: Its large eyes act as radar. In a bright place, you can see that they are clusters of many tiny eyes.
cobblemon.species.venonat.name: Venonat
cobblemon.species.venusaur.desc: A bewitching aroma wafts from its flower. The fragrance becalms those engaged in a battle.
cobblemon.species.venusaur.name: Venusaur
cobblemon.species.vespiquen.desc: Commands its subjects to build its hive. It will dispatch any interlopers who dare sneak into its nest and use them as nourishment for itself.
cobblemon.species.vespiquen.name: Vespiquen
cobblemon.species.vibrava.desc: To help make its wings grow, it dissolves quantities of prey in its digestive juices and guzzles them down every day.
cobblemon.species.vibrava.name: Vibrava
cobblemon.species.victini.desc: When it shares the infinite energy it creates, that being's entire body will be overflowing with power.
cobblemon.species.victini.name: Victini
cobblemon.species.victreebel.desc: Lures prey with the sweet aroma of honey. Swallowed whole, the prey is dissolved in a day, bones and all.
cobblemon.species.victreebel.name: Victreebel
cobblemon.species.vigoroth.desc: Vigoroth is simply incapable of remaining still. Even when it tries to sleep, the blood in its veins grows agitated, compelling this Pokémon to run wild throughout the jungle before it can settle down.
cobblemon.species.vigoroth.name: Vigoroth
cobblemon.species.vikavolt.desc: If it carries a Charjabug to use as a spare battery, a flying Vikavolt can rapidly fire high-powered beams of electricity.
cobblemon.species.vikavolt.name: Vikavolt
cobblemon.species.vileplume.desc: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.
cobblemon.species.vileplume.name: Vileplume
cobblemon.species.virizion.desc: It darts around opponents with a flurry of quick movements, slicing them up with its horns.
cobblemon.species.virizion.name: Virizion
cobblemon.species.vivillon.desc: The patterns on this Pokémon's wings depend on the climate and topography of its habitat. It scatters colorful scales.
cobblemon.species.vivillon.name: Vivillon
cobblemon.species.volbeat.desc: Volbeat's tail glows like a lightbulb. With other Volbeat, it uses its tail to draw geometric shapes in the night sky. This Pokémon loves the sweet aroma given off by Illumise.
cobblemon.species.volbeat.name: Volbeat
cobblemon.species.volcanion.desc: It expels its internal steam from the arms on its back. It has enough power to blow away a mountain.
cobblemon.species.volcanion.name: Volcanion
cobblemon.species.volcarona.desc: This Pokémon emerges from a cocoon formed of raging flames. Ancient murals depict Volcarona as a deity of fire.
cobblemon.species.volcarona.name: Volcarona
cobblemon.species.voltorb.desc: An enigmatic Pokémon that happens to bear a resemblance to a Poké Ball. When excited, it discharges the electric current it has stored in its belly, then lets out a great, uproarious laugh.
cobblemon.species.voltorb.name: Voltorb
cobblemon.species.vullaby.desc: Vullaby grow quickly. Bones that have gotten too small for older Vullaby to wear often get passed down to younger ones in the nest.
cobblemon.species.vullaby.name: Vullaby
cobblemon.species.vulpix.desc: In its belly burns a fire, which Vulpix spits out in the form of fireballs. When young, this Pokémon has but one white tail. As the Pokémon matures, this single tail splits into six.
cobblemon.species.vulpix.name: Vulpix
cobblemon.species.wailmer.desc: When it sucks in a large volume of seawater, it becomes like a big, bouncy ball. It eats a ton of food daily.
cobblemon.species.wailmer.name: Wailmer
cobblemon.species.wailord.desc: Its immense size is the reason for its popularity. Wailord watching is a favorite sightseeing activity in various parts of the world.
cobblemon.species.wailord.name: Wailord
cobblemon.species.walkingwake.name: Walking Wake
cobblemon.species.walrein.desc: Its thick tusks are strong enough to shatter drift ice. They have been known to break, but they will grow back by the next year. The Hisui region is well known for these broken tusks.
cobblemon.species.walrein.name: Walrein
cobblemon.species.wartortle.desc: It cleverly controls its furry ears and tail to maintain its balance while swimming.
cobblemon.species.wartortle.name: Wartortle
cobblemon.species.watchog.desc: When they see an enemy, their tails stand high, and they spit the seeds of berries stored in their cheek pouches.
cobblemon.species.watchog.name: Watchog
cobblemon.species.wattrel.desc: When its wings catch the wind, the bones within produce electricity. This Pokémon dives into the ocean, catching prey by electrocuting them.
cobblemon.species.wattrel.name: Wattrel
cobblemon.species.weavile.desc: This species corners prey as a pack, under the guidance of a leader. Weavile displays increased cunning, leading me to speculate that its evolution caused further brain development.
cobblemon.species.weavile.name: Weavile
cobblemon.species.weedle.desc: Beware of the sharp stinger on its head. It hides in grass and bushes where it eats leaves.
cobblemon.species.weedle.name: Weedle
cobblemon.species.weepinbell.desc: When hungry, it swallows anything that moves. Its hapless prey is dissolved by strong acids.
cobblemon.species.weepinbell.name: Weepinbell
cobblemon.species.weezing.desc: It can't suck in air quite as well as a Galarian Weezing, but the toxins it creates are more potent than those of its counterpart.
cobblemon.species.weezing.name: Weezing
cobblemon.species.whimsicott.desc: As long as this Pokémon bathes in sunlight, its cotton keeps growing. If too much cotton fluff builds up, Whimsicott tears it off and scatters it.
cobblemon.species.whimsicott.name: Whimsicott
cobblemon.species.whirlipede.desc: Whirlipede protects itself with a sturdy shell and poisonous spikes while it stores up the energy it'll need for evolution.
cobblemon.species.whirlipede.name: Whirlipede
cobblemon.species.whiscash.desc: Strikes its caudal fin against the swamp bed to shake the ground and startle its prey. It will then swallow the fleeing prey whole. People mistook this behavior as the cause of earthquakes.
cobblemon.species.whiscash.name: Whiscash
cobblemon.species.whismur.desc: When Whismur cries, the sound of its own voice startles it, making the Pokémon cry even louder. It cries until it's exhausted, then it falls asleep.
cobblemon.species.whismur.name: Whismur
cobblemon.species.wigglytuff.desc: It's proud of its fur, which is fine and delicate. In particular, the curl on its forehead has a texture that's perfectly heavenly.
cobblemon.species.wigglytuff.name: Wigglytuff
cobblemon.species.wiglett.desc: This Pokémon can pick up the scent of a Veluza just over 65 feet away and will hide itself in the sand.
cobblemon.species.wiglett.name: Wiglett
cobblemon.species.wimpod.desc: Wimpod gather in swarms, constantly on the lookout for danger. They scatter the moment they detect an enemy's presence.
cobblemon.species.wimpod.name: Wimpod
cobblemon.species.wingull.desc: It soars on updrafts without flapping its wings. It makes a nest on sheer cliffs at the sea's edge.
cobblemon.species.wingull.name: Wingull
cobblemon.species.wishiwashi.desc: When it senses danger, its eyes tear up. The sparkle of its tears signals other Wishiwashi to gather.
cobblemon.species.wishiwashi.name: Wishiwashi
cobblemon.species.wobbuffet.desc: To keep its pitch-black tail hidden, it lives quietly in the darkness. It is never first to attack.
cobblemon.species.wobbuffet.name: Wobbuffet
cobblemon.species.wochien.desc: The grudge of a person punished for writing the king's evil deeds upon wooden tablets has clad itself in dead leaves to become a Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.wochien.name: Wo-Chien
cobblemon.species.woobat.desc: It emits ultrasonic waves as it flutters about, searching for its prey—bug Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.woobat.name: Woobat
cobblemon.species.wooloo.desc: If its fleece grows too long, Wooloo won't be able to move. Cloth made with the wool of this Pokémon is surprisingly strong.
cobblemon.species.wooloo.name: Wooloo
cobblemon.species.wooper.desc: When walking on land, it covers its body with a poisonous film that keeps its skin from dehydrating.
cobblemon.species.wooper.name: Wooper
cobblemon.species.wormadam.desc: When Burmy evolved, its cloak became a part of this Pokémon's body. The cloak is never shed.
cobblemon.species.wormadam.name: Wormadam
cobblemon.species.wugtrio.desc: It has a vicious temperament, contrary to what its appearance may suggest. It wraps its long bodies around prey, then drags the prey into its den.
cobblemon.species.wugtrio.name: Wugtrio
cobblemon.species.wurmple.desc: Likes sap and is abundant in the wild. Why it evolves into various different forms is unknown. One cannot tell from a Wurmple's appearance which form it will take when it evolves.
cobblemon.species.wurmple.name: Wurmple
cobblemon.species.wynaut.desc: It tends to move in a pack with others. They cluster in a tight group to sleep in a cave.
cobblemon.species.wynaut.name: Wynaut
cobblemon.species.wyrdeer.desc: The black orbs shine with an uncanny light when the Pokémon is erecting invisible barriers. The fur shed from its beard retains heat well and is a highly useful material for winter clothing.
cobblemon.species.wyrdeer.name: Wyrdeer
cobblemon.species.xatu.desc: This odd Pokémon can see both the past and the future. It eyes the sun's movement all day.
cobblemon.species.xatu.name: Xatu
cobblemon.species.xerneas.desc: When the horns on its head shine in seven colors, it is said to be sharing everlasting life.
cobblemon.species.xerneas.name: Xerneas
cobblemon.species.xurkitree.desc: They've been dubbed Ultra Beasts. Some of them stand unmoving, like trees, with their arms and legs stuck into the ground.
cobblemon.species.xurkitree.name: Xurkitree
cobblemon.species.yamask.desc: The spirit of a person from a bygone age became this Pokémon. It rambles through ruins, searching for someone who knows its face.
cobblemon.species.yamask.name: Yamask
cobblemon.species.yamper.desc: This gluttonous Pokémon only assists people with their work because it wants treats. As it runs, it crackles with electricity.
cobblemon.species.yamper.name: Yamper
cobblemon.species.yanma.desc: Its frail wings are so thin that one can see clear through them. However, during flight these wings exhibit the power to churn air with force enough to launch a house skyward.
cobblemon.species.yanma.name: Yanma
cobblemon.species.yanmega.desc: Extremely violent. When hunting, it wastes none of its energy, aiming only for prey's most vulnerable spots. Any who manage to tame this Pokémon must be of incredible bravery.
cobblemon.species.yanmega.name: Yanmega
cobblemon.species.yungoos.desc: Although it will eat anything, it prefers fresh living things, so it marches down streets in search of prey.
cobblemon.species.yungoos.name: Yungoos
cobblemon.species.yveltal.desc: When its life comes to an end, it absorbs the life energy of every living thing and turns into a cocoon once more.
cobblemon.species.yveltal.name: Yveltal
cobblemon.species.zacian.desc: This Pokémon has slumbered for many years. Some say it's Zamazenta's elder sister—others say the two Pokémon are rivals.
cobblemon.species.zacian.name: Zacian
cobblemon.species.zamazenta.desc: This Pokémon slept for aeons while in the form of a statue. It was asleep for so long, people forgot that it ever existed.
cobblemon.species.zamazenta.name: Zamazenta
cobblemon.species.zangoose.desc: Zangoose usually stays on all fours, but when angered, it gets up on its hind legs and extends its claws. This Pokémon shares a bitter rivalry with Seviper that dates back over generations.
cobblemon.species.zangoose.name: Zangoose
cobblemon.species.zapdos.desc: Zapdos is a legendary bird Pokémon. It's said that when Zapdos rubs its feathers together, lightning will fall immediately after.
cobblemon.species.zapdos.name: Zapdos
cobblemon.species.zarude.desc: Once the vines on Zarude's body tear off, they become nutrients in the soil. This helps the plants of the forest grow.
cobblemon.species.zarude.name: Zarude
cobblemon.species.zebstrika.desc: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.
cobblemon.species.zebstrika.name: Zebstrika
cobblemon.species.zekrom.desc: Mythology tells us that if people lose the righteousness in their hearts, their kingdoms will be razed by Zekrom's lightning.
cobblemon.species.zekrom.name: Zekrom
cobblemon.species.zeraora.desc: Electricity sparks from the pads on its limbs. Wherever Zeraora runs, lightning flashes and thunder echoes.
cobblemon.species.zeraora.name: Zeraora
cobblemon.species.zigzagoon.desc: Zigzagoon that adapted to regions outside Galar acquired this appearance. If you've lost something, this Pokémon can likely find it.
cobblemon.species.zigzagoon.name: Zigzagoon
cobblemon.species.zoroark.desc: With its disheveled white fur, it looks like an embodiment of death. Heedless of its own safety, Zoroark attacks its nemeses with a bitter energy so intense, it lacerates Zoroark's own body.
cobblemon.species.zoroark.name: Zoroark
cobblemon.species.zorua.desc: A once-departed soul, returned to life in Hisui. Derives power from resentment, which rises as energy atop its head and takes on the forms of foes. In this way, Zorua vents lingering malice.
cobblemon.species.zorua.name: Zorua
cobblemon.species.zubat.desc: Makes its home in gloomy caves. Atrophied eyes have left this Pokémon blind, so it scans its surroundings via sound waves that it emits from its mouth as it flies.
cobblemon.species.zubat.name: Zubat
cobblemon.species.zweilous.desc: Their two heads will fight each other over a single piece of food. Zweilous are covered in scars even without battling others.
cobblemon.species.zweilous.name: Zweilous
cobblemon.species.zygarde.desc: Some say it can change to an even more powerful form when battling those who threaten the ecosystem.
cobblemon.species.zygarde.name: Zygarde
